story:
Short Summary

Her Footprints’ mission is to empower girls to be bold, strong and fit on the trails of nature and beyond. Our hiking enrichment program serves girls of color who are between the ages 8 to 14 years old and reside in Oakland, CA.

During the school year, we organize monthly hikes around the San Francisco Bay Area through an innovative model. A female student's journey on the trails is one that begins with her mind and body and then goes further to incorporate mentorship, new experiences and peer support.

Who we are:

For Her Footprints to operate successfully, we rely on dedicated professionals who enrich the program:

  • 5  volunteers (women professionals serve as mentors to the girls & attend the monthly hikes)
  • 6 Her Footprints executive board members
  • 3 advisors from the legal, policy and college admission fields

Our unique program is designed to:

Who we serve:

We partnered with Frick Impact Academy, part of Oakland Unified School District (OUSD), to pilot our program with sixth grade girls during the 2016-2017 school year. Located in East Oakland, Frick Impact Academy predominantly serves low-income families and students of color. Over 50% of students are African American.  Latino students make up another 42% of the student population. Through our partnership with Frick, we've hosted 7 hikes over an 8-month period and hiked over 15 miles with 14 girls.

Currently, we’re set for a 60% INCREASE in program participants this school year – as we’ll be serving both 6th & 7th grade girls. We will also continue to include younger sisters of participants, in the 4th & 5th grades, since parents want their daughters to share in the enriching moments that we offer.  In the future we hope to expand the program to all grade levels within Frick Academy and to other OUSD schools. 

YOUR CONTRIBUTION will help us strategically manage our growth by offering more developmental engagements off the trails (such as leadership and mindfulness workshops) and diversifying the trails we explore - empowering our participants with a variety of experiences. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Your contribution will help with the increase of participants engaged directly with Her Footprints.

Where will your money go?

100% of your contribution will go towards funding our monthly program costs - which consists mainly of food and transportation - as well as our yearly "SisterTrek Retreat" - an overnight stay at Dye Creek Preserve.

Our Current Expenses

- Transportation ($300 per hike, 9 hikes total) - $2,700 
- Food ($120 per hike, 9 hikes total)  - $1,080 
- Promotional Materials and Items for Activities  - $500 
- Retreat Transportation (for two-day retreat) -  $1,200 
- Retreat Food $360 

The Impact

Please join us as we empower young girls with the tools to help them navigate their journey into adulthood and memories they will have for a lifetime. With YOUR partnership, she'll experience an expanded worldview, take on challenges, embrace the unfamiliar, and build her confidence.  After all, she's already done it on the trails!

Our program is designed to tackle these figures in a fun, supportive environment.

Other Ways You Can Help

Besides contributing financially, there are other ways that you can help us make our 2017-2018 school year a success:

  • Email links to this IndieGoGo fundraising page to your family and friends. The URLs are below
  • Post links to this fundraising page on your Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.
  • Follow us on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook and share our website to your family and friends. This absolutely makes a HUGE difference! The more people who learn about our organization, the better chance we have of raising the funds we need.
  • In-kind donations such as healthy snacks and bottled water for our monthly hikes. To arrange a contribution of this kind, email us at herfootprints.sfbayarea@gmail.com.

Together We Can!

story:
I am beyond excited to announce my acceptance and enrollment into The Green Program’s renewable energy and sustainability program for the summer of 2018. I will be traveling to Iceland for 10 days this summer to work on an intense capstone project at Reykjavik University, which is Iceland’s School of Energy. 

Why Iceland? Simply stated, 100% of Iceland’s electricity comes from clean, renewable energy sources. This is an incredible number in of itself, but compared to the US’s meager 15% it is even more apparent that we need to change. 

I am campaigning to better fund my trip abroad to Iceland to complete this rigorous 10 day project. I plan to bring my findings back to the US and continue the work and apply it towards my senior thesis project at Carthage College. Any amount, small or big, is very appreciated. 

This project will shape not only my future, but the future of renewable energy across the world. 

Thank you for contributing to this once in a lifetime experience. 
https://thegreenprogram.com/programs/iceland

story:
AN INVENTOR'S JOURNEY

Ten years ago my wife Nichole and I (Randolph) had a great idea for an invention.  We thought, talked, and even daydreamed about how it would help people in their everyday life.  IT WAS A WINNER.  To our surprise a year or so later we saw our idea on a shelf at our local CVS store.  This same heartbreak happen twice more before we eventually realized that we were not the only one with good ideas (shocking)!  The same good ideas were sprouting in other minds across town, AT THE SAME TIME (stranger things have happened).  The biggest difference between us and them is that while we were talking, they were walking.  Literally taking steps to make their day dreams come true.  Rather than pout, the next great idea we had, we decided to act.  As as a result, we experienced the joy of seeing our dream become a reality!  Now ten years, three inventions (one in 150+ stores), one company, and a bouncing baby boy (now nine years old) later, we have learned two major things...

The Journey Of A 1000 Miles MAY HAVE ALREADY BEGUN.  If your invention is near and dear to your heart it is very likely that you have already done a prototype, chosen a target market, and already have several suppliers, partners, and potential investors right there in your cell phone.  WE DID!  We just had to take the time to notice what parts of our everyday life were doubling as a part of our inventor’s journey.

The Journey Of 8 MILES Begins With A Single Step, Too!  What stopped us from actually taking that step with our first several invention ideas was the overwhelming thought that the process would take time, money, or other resources that we just didn’t have.  This is true for some invention ideas, BUT NOT FOR ALL.  We have found that in the case of MANY ideas, the use of three basic tools and eights straightforward steps can make inventing something great...

...So Easy A Kid Can Do It (AND DID!)  Mostly all creative works begin in the imagination: inventions, novels, paintings, songs, etc.  And if children have such vivid imaginations shouldn’t there be more kid inventors, authors, artist, and singers?  WE THINK SO!   Popsicles, earmuffs, the trampoline, flippers, Braille, even Superman were all invented by kids.  We have not had the privilege of meeting these young imaginers.  However, 15 years of weekly youth mentoring, working closely with hundreds of children with varying backgrounds has taught my wife and me that there are great ideas in the mind of every child.

Please join us on our journey to HELP CHILDREN OF ALL AGES & BACKGROUNDS experience the amazing feeling of accomplishment and self-value that comes with seeing their great idea grow from their imagination to the real world!

 

OUR GOAL IS TO RAISE $4,100 WITH YOUR SUPPORT

  • $3,400 goes to the printing and shipping fees of our initial manufacturing order for 300 toolkits (books, journals, & games).
  • $700 goes to the printing, shipping, and set up stamping fees of our initial manufacturing order for 300 inventor light bulb pens.
  • Because most supporters will have multiple kids whom they love in their lives (children, grandchildren, nieces, nephews, and neighbors) we have created single & multiple item perks ranging from $5 to $250.  The IMAGINATION ACTIVATION Toolkit ($30 Perk) has all the tools needed to help any child see their idea come to life!
  • If we don't reach our goal right now, we will use the funds raised towards a lesser initial manufacturing order and continue to fundraise locally until the goal is reached.
  • Should we manage to hit our goal and go past it, excess funds will be used to develop an audio version of the book, as well as to increase the size of the print run.

 

HOW THE IMAGINATION ACTIVATION TOOLKIT WORKS...

TOOL # 1 ~ THE BOOK

Children begin their inventor’s journey by reading the exciting children’s novel ‘FOUR I’s FLINT And The BIG Idea’ where they meet Flint Gardner, a friendly and lovable 10-year old with a big idea and an even bigger problem.  He has no idea how to make his idea a reality!  With each chapter, he learns a new lesson which gets him closer and closer to that reality.  Starting with the 4 I’s and ending with the 4 P’s. 

  • Chapter 1  –  Meet Flint
  • Chapter 2  –  Imagine
  • Chapter 3  –  Investigate
  • Chapter 4  –  Invite
  • Chapter 5  –  Ignite
  • Chapter 6  –  The Game Changer
  • Chapter 7  –  Plan
  • Chapter 8  –  Promote
  • Chapter 9  –  Produce
  • Chapter 10 – Persevere
  • Chapter 11 – The Perfect Pitch
  • Chapter 12 – Flint’s Journal Entries

 

TOOL # 2 ~ THE JOURNAL

Flint does not learn these lessons alone, the reader learns right alongside him.  In the novel Flint write all his ideas, wishes, important memories and lessons in his IMAGINATION Journal.  As children read each chapter they are encouraged to follow Flint’s example of journaling their ideas and lessons just as he does.

 

TOOL # 3 ~ THE GAME

As the book comes to its climax (spoiler alert) children are delighted to discover that Flint’s BIG idea is actually a game designed to help them put into practice the lessons learned in the novel.   It is the same game in the Imagination Activation Toolkit.  ‘PERFECT PITCH’ enhances player’s creativity, cooperation, memory, and prioritization skills.  Not to mention it’s FUN!

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

Our company, Dynamic Training Solutions, has been involved in similar projects for the past 10 years, and it's almost inevitable that there will be some obstacles to overcome. However, we have a strong team of people working with us that always step-in to find solutions.  Our passion for youth, inventors, and their inventive motivation always pushes us forward.

All of the heavy lifting (writing, concept & game development, design work) has been done, and all there is left is the final step of printing, shipping, and stamping.  And seeing as we are working with a fantastic team of manufacturers, with your help, this will be a snap.  Thank you!

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP...

  • Please help by getting the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  •  Please use the Indigogo share tools!
  • Please scroll all the way down to see all the offers. PLEASE SHARE OFFERS YOU LIKE!

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!!

story:
Trend 1: In 2015 the United Nations released the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) in order to provide clear frameworks, guidelines and targets for countries to adopt in accordance with their own priorities and the environmental challenges of the world at large. The United Nations has declared 12 years left until the point of no return in the latest Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change Report (IPCC) 2018. Daily we become more aware that the world facing some of its greatest social, environmental and economic challenges. To ensure we meet these needs, it is required that education systems nurture future generations which are geared with understanding the SDGs, their interconnectedness and how to implement and integrate them into their lives and work.

Trend 2: The future world of work is uncertain. Climate change and sustainable development; human population growth and rapid urbanisation; increasing inequality and decreasing natural resources; rapid innovations in technology and artificial intelligence; the fourth industrial revolution and the sixth innovation wave are changing the relationship between industry and society rapidly and radically. The future world of work (or world without work) demands our youth to have 21st century skill-sets and character qualities for a completely new way of thinking about the work we do and our impact on society because of it.

Trend 3: Education requires an evolution. The way we educate and what we educate has remained the same for the last two centuries - the need for innovation within education is globally understood and agreed upon. National education systems and schools across the world are realising the need for innovation and have begun pioneering new frameworks and learning methodologies and content in order to nurture learners equipped with the skill-sets and character qualities demanded by the future world of work and Sustainable Development.

Plant the Seed are building services and developing partnerships to support South African schools, school leadership and teachers integrate the frameworks, educational content and learning methodologies necessary to engage students in meaningful learning experiences which develop 21st century skills and values/attitudes. Plant the Seed understand that teachers are pivotal in this process – we are on a mission to empower South African teachers and support them as champions of sustainability and innovation in the classroom.

“The way and things we teach are from the past 200 years. Teaching needs something new and unique” – Jack Ma, Founder and Executive Chairman Alibaba Group

What we teach and how it is taught requires a rejuvenation. We have partnered with EcoRise, to help us rejuvenate South African teachers and classrooms. EcoRise is an international educational organisation specialising in online sustainability and innovation content and professional development teacher training's. EcoRise has over 10 years’ experience and a proven track in developing content and conducting in-person training's.

This partnership enables us to strengthen our work with schools in South Africa and add enormous value to South African teachers with an online curriculum platform and in-person training processes. These will allow Plant the Seed to equip and up-skill teachers with exciting and relevant learning methodologies and content.  

Educational Content: EcoRise educational content is framed under four main educational suites; Sustainable Intelligence, Biomimicry, Ecopreneurship and Design Thinking - each of which have different educational objectives and outcomes. Within these educational suites lies an array of content and knowledge which contributes to building the knowledge and a curiosity for knowledge demanded by the real world.

Learning Methodologies: EcoRise lesson plans utilise different learning methodologies which are seen globally as necessities in developing students with 21st century skill sets. These learning methodologies include: project based learning, design thinking, technology integration, and more. Together, the content and learning methodologies builds the knowledge and skills students require for the real world and 21st century.

EcoRise educational content has a plethora of multimedia lesson plans, teacher’s notes, resources and even predesigned student projects with support material that teachers and students love. These resources offer a fantastic base upon which Plant the Seed can support teachers with all the resources and content they’ll need to rejuvenate their subjects and classroom.

However, all this content needs to be aligned, contextualised and customised to the most applicable South African subjects and curriculum requirements if it is going to offer effective and efficient support to South African teachers. Plant the Seed require funding to do this work.

Your support will allow us to:

  1. Align and customise EcoRise content and lesson plans for South African curriculum and classroom requirements
  2. Adjust the online platform (teachers access to lesson plans) and structure the content accordingly 
  3. Pilot the curriculum, platform and training's with 8 schools from differing socio-economic contexts, and gain necessary feedback to improve the content alignment and platform
  4. Translate core curriculum and lesson plans into the most appropriate South African languages


We have numerous requirements which enable us to deepen our impact and support for South African teachers and schools. Our ideal funding amount is $55 000.

We have broken down our funding requirement into three funding goals which allow us to achieve different aspects of our overall goal.

We believe that experiences really do shape our learning and how we show up in the world. Therefore we have created a range of experiences we’d like to offer in return for your support and contribution. Experiences we believe speak to our ethos, experiences which re-connect you to nature and people. Unfortunately these experiences are all situated in and around Cape Town, our home base. Some of these have limited spaces so make sure you book your spot by contributing early. 

We have the experience and networks required to develop an effective online platform which truly supports teachers and which has a functioning business model.

Plant the Seed have been helping schools on their journey to sustainability for 3 years. The majority of our work in schools has been focused on designing and running experiential workshops for students with the aim of developing greater critical thinking, collaboration, systems and creative thinking. Our impact in schools to date:

20 Schools empowered | 30 Programmes facilitated | 2700 mind inspired

 

Over and above our work in schools Plant the Seed have been designing online and offline platforms and behaviour change for the public and business to start their sustainability journey. 

Plastic Detox: An online and social media driven behaviour change campaign aimed at challenging individual’s consumption and disposal habits of single-use plastic and raising awareness on the associated environmental, social and economic concerns.

 

MeatLessMay: An online and social media driven behaviour change campaign aimed at challenging individuals consumption habits of meat and animal products and raising awareness on sustainability concerns around the meat industry.

Walking the Daisies: WTD is a platform to create a fun, creative and interactive space for raising awareness, education & support around issues such as global warming and environmental degradation, while taking into account social issues such as unemployment, poverty and inequality that prevail in the South African context. View our 2017 Impact Report here.

 

We have a dynamic and growing team of teaching and sustainability professionals with a great mix of skill-sets, knowledge and experience . We are actively looking to grow and most importantly diversify our team. 

Core Team

Thomas Chevallier: Co-founder & Director, Plant the Seed | Honours in Sustainable Development, Sustainability Institute

Mattieu Theron: Co-founder & Managing Director, Plant the Seed | M.Com in Economic Development, University of Cape Town

Damien Hewitt: Education Director, Plant the Seed | B.SocSci in Psychology and Organisational Psychology, University of Cape Town | PGCE in SP/FET, University of Cape Town

Jess Dormehl: Marketing & Communications, Plant the Seed | B.Com in Entrepreneurship and Economics, Stellenbosch University | Certificate in Digital Marketing (Brightfire), Instagram Marketing (Los Angeles) and Social Media Management (Edx)

Denham Preen: Platform Developer, Plant the Seed | BSc in Economics and Computer Science, Rhodes University | PG Honours in Computer Science, University of Cape Town

Board & Advisors

Laura Bergh: Chief Enabler, The Poverty Stoplight Office | Master’s in Sustainability Leadership, Cambridge University | Policies & Procedures Manager | Engen

Gerry Noel: Biology Teacher, Bishops Diocesan College | Master’s in Complexity Thinking, Sustainability Institute

These resources offer a fantastic base upon which Plant the Seed can support teachers with all the resources and content they’ll need to rejuvenate their subjects and classroom.However, all this content needs to be aligned, contextualised and customised to the most applicable South African subjects and curriculum requirements if it is going to offer effective and efficient support to South African teachers. Plant the Seed require funding to do this work.Your support will allow us to:
Align and customise EcoRise content and lesson plans for South African curriculum and classroom requirements
Adjust the online platform (teachers access to lesson plans) and structure the content accordingly 
Pilot the curriculum, platform and training's with 8 schools from differing socio-economic contexts, and gain necessary feedback to improve the content alignment and platform
Translate core curriculum and lesson plans into the most appropriate South African languages
We have numerous requirements which enable us to deepen our impact and support for South African teachers and schools. Our ideal funding amount is $55 000. We have broken down our funding requirement into three funding goals which allow us to achieve different aspects of our overall goal.We believe that experiences really do shape our learning and how we show up in the world. Therefore we have created a range of experiences we’d like to offer in return for your support and contribution. Experiences we believe speak to our ethos, experiences which re-connect you to nature and people. Unfortunately these experiences are all situated in and around Cape Town, our home base. Some of these have limited spaces so make sure you book your spot by contributing early. We have the experience and networks required to develop an effective online platform which truly supports teachers and which has a functioning business model.Plant the Seed have been helping schools on their journey to sustainability for 3 years. The majority of our work in schools has been focused on designing and running experiential workshops for students with the aim of developing greater critical thinking, collaboration, systems and creative thinking. Our impact in schools to date:20 Schools empowered | 30 Programmes facilitated | 2700 mind inspired

 
Over and above our work in schools Plant the Seed have been designing online and offline platforms and behaviour change for the public and business to start their sustainability journey. 

Plastic Detox: An online and social media driven behaviour change campaign aimed at challenging individual’s consumption and disposal habits of single-use plastic and raising awareness on the associated environmental, social and economic concerns.


 

MeatLessMay: An online and social media driven behaviour change campaign aimed at challenging individuals consumption habits of meat and animal products and raising awareness on sustainability concerns around the meat industry.
Walking the Daisies: WTD is a platform to create a fun, creative and interactive space for raising awareness, education & support around issues such as global warming and environmental degradation, while taking into account social issues such as unemployment, poverty and inequality that prevail in the South African context. View our 2017 Impact Report here.


 


We have a dynamic and growing team of teaching and sustainability professionals with a great mix of skill-sets, knowledge and experience . We are actively looking to grow and most importantly diversify our team. Core TeamThomas Chevallier: Co-founder & Director, Plant the Seed | Honours in Sustainable Development, Sustainability InstituteMattieu Theron: Co-founder & Managing Director, Plant the Seed | M.Com in Economic Development, University of Cape TownDamien Hewitt: Education Director, Plant the Seed | B.SocSci in Psychology and Organisational Psychology, University of Cape Town | PGCE in SP/FET, University of Cape TownJess Dormehl: Marketing & Communications, Plant the Seed | B.Com in Entrepreneurship and Economics, Stellenbosch University | Certificate in Digital Marketing (Brightfire), Instagram Marketing (Los Angeles) and Social Media Management (Edx)Denham Preen: Platform Developer, Plant the Seed | BSc in Economics and Computer Science, Rhodes University | PG Honours in Computer Science, University of Cape TownBoard & AdvisorsLaura Bergh: Chief Enabler, The Poverty Stoplight Office | Master’s in Sustainability Leadership, Cambridge University | Policies & Procedures Manager | EngenGerry Noel: Biology Teacher, Bishops Diocesan College | Master’s in Complexity Thinking, Sustainability Institute

story:
Nimuno Mats were developed as a fun & educational *STEAM puzzle toy, designed to teach kids vital Visual Perceptual and Motor related skills through real world play. Mastering these skills lays the foundation for, among others, learning to read, write, problem solve and ultimately navigate the world around them.

 

Studies have shown that providing children with puzzles and tangible educational toys during early childhood development has long-reaching beneficial cognitive effects. The challenge however lies in providing activities that are fun, engaging and beneficial for a child. Furthermore, knowing how to foster and encourage vital mental and physical skills development outside of the digital world is becoming ever more difficult. 

 

Our Mats facilitate the development of creativity and imagination, which when coupled with problem solving enables innovation and builds confidence!

 

 

What’s unique about Nimuno Mats is its ability to train a young child’s mind to move from 2D to 3D visual perception through its interchangeable puzzle-lock system.

 

Problem solving is key for accurate shape alignment which is trickier than it seems. The puzzle pieces only align properly when in the correct orientation. This means the tiles need to be flipped and rotated until correct alignment is achieved, making it a fun challenge for adults and children alike which should not be underestimated!

 

"You see Dad! Not as easy as it looks is it?  - Dylan Wiggill to his exasperated Father

 

 

The University of Stanford's *DREME study shows that shape manipulation, stacking, and sorting allows young children to explore and develop spatial sense; furthering the development of aspects like mental transformation, orientation, spatial awareness and spatial language.

 

These skills prime young minds in preparation for a world where mathematical fluency is important not only for one’s education, but for comprehending the world as a whole.

 

So why are honing these skills of fundamental importance? Studies show that spatial ideas underlie much of a person's mathematical understanding (addition, subtraction, division, equivalence, multiplication etc), with research showing how spatial knowledge and language predict future academic performance in kids (Ginsberg & Oppenzato, 2017). 

*DREME (Development and Research in Early Math Education, Stanford University).  

 

 

Fine Motor Skills like In-hand manipulation and Hand-eye coordination.

Visual Perceptual Skills- Visual perception is our ability to make sense of what we see. Visual perceptual skills are essential for everything from navigating our world to reading, writing, mathematics and memory.

 

 

Physiotherapy

Thanks to its chunky soft-touch design Nimuno Mats are also a valuable tool for the rehabilitation of neurological trauma victims as they allow for extended periods of neuro-physical engagement which can be exercised at the hospital or at home. 

 

Older Minds

The elderly have also found Nimuno Mats to be a fun way to keep their minds active whilst engaging in eye-hand manipulation.

story:
The Ripple Over The Drop

Women everywhere are struggling personally, professionally and economically and underneath it all, yearning for happiness. 

This graph is from a working paper by Professors Richard Easterlin and Anke Plagnol.

They were part of a General Social Survey where 1.3 million men and women were surveyed over the last 40 years, both here in North America and in developed countries around the world.

   

The creeping unhappiness can seep into all aspects of a woman’s life and has a direct correlation to her economic potential.  

Overall, the trajectory is consistent.  It’s consistently going downhill and this affects not only the woman herself, it affects our entire global economy.

Women have been told we can be anything, have anything and do anything - but more than 85% are doing all of that on their own and it’s killing us - it’s the very reason most women run businesses in North America don’t earn a profit large enough to live off of.

 

The Impact

Wealthy Woman Warrior™ ultimately wants women to discover that they don't have to do it all on their own while they try to reach financial success. Instead, through collaboration, support, and online training, they can passionately create their path to personal, professional and economic success.

With your donation, we're creating a scholarship fund for women to go through 8 months of training within 5 areas of vulnerability proven to be keeping women stuck.

 

​​Some Challenges

Challenge #1

  • Reaching the women who need it most.  It was very evident with these candid conversations that helping women with their own businesses who are struggling and cannot afford the cost of training is necessary.  Many simply can't afford relevant training because their businesses are struggling to earn profits.

That is why this campaign will help fund training scholarships to support women’s business developments for their future. 

Challenge #2​

  • Spreading the word about why educating women in these five areas of vulnerability will transform communities, cities and the world.  Research shows that when women solve these 5 areas of vulnerability they reinvest in their community, city and beyond.  Gender equality depends on women receiving the right training.  Due to out of date content, an increase of "free training" that doesn't give all the important details to create success, and women being inclined to re-invent the wheel on their own, women are stuck and not moving forward.  The upside of this is that when these 5 areas become strengths through relevant and current training, women re-invest in their community, city and beyond increasing the global GDP and more importantly transforming our generations to come.

Challenge #3

  • Reaching the women in corporate who want the training but they can't get their corporation to pay for it. Many women in corporate are eager to learn so they can leverage and rise up, and they need help too.  Many corporations polled believe that they are gender inclusive, yet the studies show otherwise.  This is a cycle that needs to be addressed so that employee retention, engagement and larger goals can be achieved.

That is why this campaign will help fund the implementation of working hands to make all this happen while increasing production and support levels.

The 5 Proven Areas of Vulnerability Women Are Struggling With: 

We Call Core Competency Pillars For Success

Mindset - The moment you learn how to train your thinking, is the moment you are able to choose your results. Women struggle daily with believing in themselves and we can help positively change this for the better.  

Communication - Success is not the absence of conflict; it is the ability to handle conflict with successful communication. Communication isn't something that is taught, it's expected.  That's why learning how to handle situations is imperative for negotiations and progress.

Financial Literacy - Financial freedom is within reach when you understand the foundational principles. Money conversations and financial requirements are often swept under the rug for fear of not knowing.  Learning how to manage money begins with women mentoring women.

Sales - To rise up the corporate ladder or charge your value, the art of selling  has to be understood.  Learning how to sell and understand your value proposition is imperative to economic change and happiness.

Technology - A must have in our global economy, yet an underperforming area with women of all ages. We're taking the scary out of tech so women connect and leverage themselves to reach the heights we know they can.

 

Get To Know Us

Wealthy Woman Warrior™ CEO & Founder Andrea Carter has spent the past year speaking with almost 300 women.  Through the research, why gender parity is the hot topic and the lack of actionable results, comes her new online leadership training platform – Wealthy Woman Warrior™.

Andrea is an award-winning business coach for corporate women and entrepreneurs. Last year she started listening to the stories of hundreds of women and found that there was one common mistake being made and 5 areas of vulnerability, that if changed would help end gender inequality.

The one common mistake – women are still trying to do it all, be it all, and have it all - by going it alone. Women are trying to move the needle on their own, and it's not working. There is a huge lack of collaboration and collaborative platforms that are accessible during the times women are able to connect.

The 5 areas of vulnerability - Mindset, Communication,  Financial Literacy, Sales and Technology

Each one of the women who shared her story with Andrea conveyed how she lacked current training, relevant for tomorrow's world, to help her reach her economic potential.  Many sited that if they had one place where they could just get current training online they'd be able to either make an impact on their business or rise up the corporate ladder.

Andrea looked at the statistics for North America as a starting place.  What was revealed was that only 2% of women-run business are earning seven figures and 3% are earning 500K according to 2016 State of Women-Owned Businesses by America Express OPEN.

Many Canadian TSX-listed companies that claim inclusivity still report less than 15% of women holding executive office.  To date, no one in Canada is talking about the women who are continually being pushed out of corporate, increasing the number of women entrepreneurs, yet decreasing earnings and it's significantly impacting the Canadian economy.

Although the Canadian government set a target that by 2019, women would make up at least 40% of all appointments to evert provincial board and agency, we've had marginal decreases from 2015-2016.

Research shows that when women become knowledgeable in the 5 main areas of vulnerability: mindset, communication, financial literacy, sales and technology, she'll have the tools for success in corporate and entrepreneurship. All facets of Wealthy Woman Warrior™ focus on these areas of vulnerability because we want to transition them into areas of empowerment so women thrive instead of survive.

"What happened to me from these conversations is my heart broke with each one.  Listening to the real stories, the businesses that were 'failing', the mortgages that were in trouble trying to make their business grow, the applications for loans that were denied, the women in corporate being pushed out at senior levels, the stories were not only shocking they were gut-wrenching.  I quickly realized that something had to change and these issues needed to be addressed on a much larger scale.

It wasn't just that women need to stop trying to do it all and be it all - all on their own, they need relevant training.  Training that isn't offered in the educational systems! Training in the online space, because that's where we're moving to and where it's easily accessible, so that no matter who you are or where you are in the world you can gain access.

Plus, more now than ever, women need support.  Not just video support, they need access to real women who've been there and done it and are actually in a video meeting to answer questions or lend support.  Women want to be mentored by women.

Knowing my area of expertise is in mindset and understanding that there are four other areas of vulnerability, I decided to research.  I spent time with other women who were already making a difference in those areas with their own work.  Then we collaborated bringing everyone together, creating products that were tested in the market and rolling them out one at a time, together as a massive collaboration.

Together we're walking beside each other, arm in arm, shoulder to shoulder.  We've got support meetings in place every day of the week to help women rise up.  Together, I believe we can make our goal of helping 1 million women reach their economic potential by 2025." ~Andrea Carter

  • CEO & Founder Andrea Carter is the visionary leading the Wealthy Woman Warrior™ movement, she embraces collaboration and celebrates the talented women walking beside her. Andrea not only holds her degree in psychology; certificates in executive coaching and leadership development but also has 15 years of experience in the field.

  • Watch Andrea's TEDx TrinityBellwoodsWomen Talk on Collaboration: The Pivot To Gender Parity

     

     

Meet The Team

 

 

ANDREA CARTER, Wealthy Woman Warrior™ CEO & Founder, Creator of Power To Thrive™ Mindset Training Program

 

HEATHER CAVANAGH, MBA, Coach, Facilitator, Power To Thrive™ Mindset Trainer Specialty Corporate Women Over-Achievers

 

KATHY TABERNER 
MA in Leadership, PCC, ICF Member, CoFounder of the Institute of Curiosity, Communication Enhancement Ambassador

KIRSTEN TABERNER SIGGINS
PCC, ICF Member, CoFounder of the Institute of Curiosity, Communication Enhancement Ambassador

 

LINDA HURKOT
MSLP, RSLP, SLP(C) Communication Enhancement Ambassador for PWS (WOMEN WHO STUTTER)

MORE AMBASSADORS ARE IN THE PROCESS OF ONBOARDING ... watch for them soon!

Why We Need Your Help

  • With your donation, you will be helping to give 8 month training scholarships to support women’s business developments for their future. 
  • You’ll be helping with the implementation of working hands to make this all happen by increasing production and support levels to create the momentum necessary.
  • Help us as we roll out needed professional training programs and deliver collaborative support to help women rise.
  • Your donation supports the empowerment of 1 million women by 2025.

What research shows is that collectively women working together make an incredible difference for our global GDP.  Because we brought the platform online, in the five areas of vulnerability, women can now access the training when they have time, wherever they are in the world and always have access to the needed support.  

Take a look at the online training centre here:

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

SOCIAL POWER!  Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

Share this campaign if you care about helping women reach their economic potential.

  • Follow us on Facebook to always stay informed on what we're doing next
  • Sharing our campaign means more than you could know, spread the message and help end gender inequality

If you're a corporation and you want to become a corporate sponsor please connect with Andrea​

Thank you for all the support you've given!  We look forward to sending out the selection of your choice after March 1, 2018!

story:
One of the most frustrating things about being an entrepreneur is...no one really tells you how to do it! Whether you're building a side hustle, a creative passion project, a non-profit or the next tech giant, the secret codes feel locked up somewhere at MIT or Google. You're either clicking around a bunch of links online, searching out some books at the library, asking friends of friends, or dropping a ton of cash (and time!) to go get an MBA. Like all of the best things in life, there's no rule book.

Serial founders and professors Justin Wolske and Jason D'Mello at Caseworx have built one. We looked at how they teach entrepreneurship at elite university programs and top-tier accelerators. We didn't find that many textbooks or lectures. Instead, we found Harvard case studies, interviews with a great entrepreneurs, collaboration and teamwork. We found that learning through story is the best way to learn really hard things like becoming an entrepreneur. We've literally been doing it for hundreds of years.

So, we took what we saw, and improved on it to build our how-to guide to become a founder. Street Fighting Entrepreneurship is an 8-part scenario-based curriculum designed to give you experience with the biggest challenges that founders face, from idea to exit. You'll watch Hollywood-level scenes of founders in crisis. You'll make real decisions. You'll build teams with fellow entrepreneurs around the world. You'll get access to experienced founders, investors and professors to help build your venture. And you'll do it on a platform designed to teach entrepreneurship, leadership and other really valuable skills.

Street Fighting Entrepreneurship will cover:

  1. Problem Ideation
  2. Solution Optimization
  3. Value Proposition
  4. The Right Money
  5. Product/Market Fit
  6. Pivoting
  7. Growth Management
  8. The Exit

Our curriculum is already up and running in major universities and corporations. But we want to build a space for YOU, the individual learner. This crowdfund will help build out the platform for learners like you, giving you all the support and community you'd have if you were working from a university.

The skills you build as an entrepreneur are the most valuable asset you ever have. It's often too hard to get access to resources to help you build them. Caseworx has changed that. Join us, and train like you're actually going to do something with it.

Like all of the best things in life, there's no rule book.

Serial founders and professors Justin Wolske and Jason D'Mello at Caseworx have built one. We looked at how they teach entrepreneurship at elite university programs and top-tier accelerators. We didn't find that many textbooks or lectures. Instead, we found Harvard case studies, interviews with a great entrepreneurs, collaboration and teamwork. We found that learning through story is the best way to learn really hard things like becoming an entrepreneur. We've literally been doing it for hundreds of years.
So, we took what we saw, and improved on it to build our how-to guide to become a founder. Street Fighting Entrepreneurship is an 8-part scenario-based curriculum designed to give you experience with the biggest challenges that founders face, from idea to exit. You'll watch Hollywood-level scenes of founders in crisis. You'll make real decisions. You'll build teams with fellow entrepreneurs around the world. You'll get access to experienced founders, investors and professors to help build your venture. And you'll do it on a platform designed to teach entrepreneurship, leadership and other really valuable skills.
Street Fighting Entrepreneurship will cover:

Problem Ideation
Solution Optimization
Value Proposition
The Right Money
Product/Market Fit
Pivoting
Growth Management
The Exit

Our curriculum is already up and running in major universities and corporations. But we want to build a space for YOU, the individual learner. This crowdfund will help build out the platform for learners like you, giving you all the support and community you'd have if you were working from a university.
The skills you build as an entrepreneur are the most valuable asset you ever have. It's often too hard to get access to resources to help you build them. Caseworx has changed that. Join us, and train like you're actually going to do something with it.

story:
WELCOME AND THANK YOU FOR VISITING MY INDIEGOGO FUNDRAISING CAMPAIGN PAGE.  YOU CAN HEAR A SONG FROM MY ALBUM, "LIFE IS" FEATURING LINDSAY STARK, PLAYING IN THE BACKGROUND OF THE VIDEO.

MY NAME IS OSCAR AKA OSK.  I AM A SAN FRANCISCO NATIVE WHO HAS LIVED QUITE A LIFE HERE IN THE CITY BY THE BAY AND AM NOW LOOKING TO SHARE MY STORIES WITH YOUNG PEOPLE. 

UNFORTUNATELY, I HAD A DAD WHO FOLLOWED THE CYCLE OF ALCOHOL AND ABUSE HE LEARNED FROM HIS DAD.  SEE, I DON’T REMEMBER MY DAD HUGGING ME OR TELLING ME THAT HE LOVED ME OR THAT HE WAS PROUD OF ME.  INSTEAD I REMEMBER THE NEGATIVITY HIS ALCOHOLISM CAUSED OUR FAMILY AND EVEN WITNESSED PHYSICAL ABUSE TOWARDS MY MOM.  AND THEN THREE WEEKS AFTER I TURNED FIFTEEN, MY DAD DIED BY DROWNING.

THE LACK OF A FATHER FIGURE LED ME TO FOLLOW IN MY DAD’S FOOTSTEPS.  I ALSO BECAME AN ALCOHOLIC.  THERE HAVE BEEN FIFTEEN TIMES THAT I’VE BLACKED OUT AND WOKEN UP EITHER IN A JAIL CELL OR HOSPITAL BED.  I HAVE BEEN CONVICTED OF DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, HAVE HAD 2 DUI’S AND ONCE EVEN OVERDOSED.  WORSE OF ALL, I TWICE PUT MY OWN SON’S LIFE AT RISK.

YEAH I KNOW HOW CRAZY IT SOUNDS, FIFTEEN TIMES…….. I TRULY HAD THE WRONG WAY OF THINKING ABOUT ALCOHOL AND UNTIL THAT CHANGED I CONTINUED IN THE CYCLE.

I HAVE SPENT THE LAST THREE YEARS WORKING ON CHANGING.  I HAVE READ OVER 75 LEADERSHIP BOOKS IN THAT TIME, LISTENED TO MANY AUDIO RECORDINGS BY LEADERS AND HAVE ASSOCIATED WITH PEOPLE ON THE SAME ROAD OF A SELF-DIRECTED EDUCATION.  I HAVE PUT MANY HABITS AND PRINCIPLES INTO PRACTICE AND HAVE SEEN THE POSITIVE CHANGE THEY MAKE.  AND, FOR ME, THIS IS JUST THE BEGINNING!

ON OCTOBER 29th, 2015 I FINALLY MADE THE DECISION TO CUT ALCOHOL OUT OF MY LIFE!

I AM CURRENTLY WORKING AN ALBUM AND BOOK CALLED, “LIFE IS..WORK IN PROGRESS”, THAT SHARE MY EXPERIENCES ALONG WITH THE BELIEF I HAVE THAT EVERYONE CAN LIVE BETTER LIVES IF WE PRACTICE RIGHT HABITS AND PRINCIPLES.  MY COMPANY IS CALLED PROMOTERS OF PEACE UNITY LOVE AND RESPECT, INC. AND ITS PURPOSE IS TO SHARE THESE IDEAS TO ALL AUDIENCES, ESPECIALLY MIDDLE AND HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS.

I WILL USE THIS ALBUM AND BOOK AS THE STARTING POINT TO SHARING MY POINT OF VIEW WITH YOUNG PEOPLE.  I WILL GO INTO SCHOOLS AND TALK TO STUDENTS ABOUT LEADERSHIP HABITS AND TO SHINE A LIGHT ON SOME OF THE CONSEQUENCES OF DRUGS AND ALCOHOL.  I WANT TO GIVE THEM ENOUGH INFORMATION SO THAT THEY CAN MAKE INFORMED DECISIONS ABOUT THESE SUBJECTS.

I WOULD LOVE TO BE ABLE TO PUT A COPY OF THIS ALBUM AND BOOK FREE-OF-CHARGE INTO THE HANDS OF EVERY MIDDLE AND HIGH SCHOOL STUDENT IN THE U.S. BUT HEY LET’S START WITH SAN FRANCISCO.  YOUR SUPPORT WILL HELP MAKE THIS A REALITY.  I LOOK FORWARD TO PARTNERING WITH YOU.  PLEASE SHARE MY CAMPAIGN WITH ALL OF YOUR FAMILY AND FRIENDS!

THE FUNDS

MY FUNDRAISING GOAL IS $15,000!  IT IS A BIG GOAL BUT I BELIEVE THAT THIS MESSAGE I HAVE TO SHARE IS WORTH WHATEVER COST IT TAKES.  THE ALBUM IS HALFWAY COMPLETED AND THE BOOK HAS BEEN STARTED.  THE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO FINISH THE MIXING, MASTERING AND DUPLICATING PROCESS OF THE ALBUM AS WELL AS ALL THE GRAPHIC AND WEB DESIGN NEEDED.  FOR THE BOOK, FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR PROOF READING, EDITING AND OTHER COSTS NECESSARY ALONG WITH PUBLISHING AND PRINTING FEES.

SPECIAL THANKS TO ALL MY CURRENT SUPPORTERS:

LEVEL 2: ZACH / KEN / CAMERON / CYNTHIA

LEVEL 3: KWAME / THE FAHEY FAMILY / MARGIE / HENRY / GARY / JOHN / ANDREW / MIKE

LEVEL 4: CHRISTINE / THE FLORES FAMILY / PAUL

LEVEL 6: LESLIE / ERIC

LISTEN…

INTERESTED IN HEARING MORE OF MY MUSIC?

HERE YOU GO:  www.415connected.com

  www.reverbnation.com/kpchozen/songs

story:
CHECK OUT OUR NEW REFERRAL REWARDS BELOW!

Hello! My name is Professor Qwbli and I need your help in transforming education by harnessing the Power of Play!

A little more than a million years ago, I set out from my planet, Qeslora, on an adventure throughout the galaxy and when I got to Earth, I decided to stay here for a while since what I found was utterly fascinating.

On Qeslora, we play ALL the time and in the process, we learn. Here, you divide this into two separate categories. I find that puzzling. Then again, our Elders thought that way once. It wasn’t until they understood the Power of Play that we evolved into the higher beings we are today.

In the words of your Kay Redfield Jamison & Joseph Chilton Pearce: 


My purpose here is to play. Education lies at the core of any and all solutions to issues that plague our collective future. As the lead teacher on my planet, I have been asked to stay to work with students, teachers and parents to offer some help and guidance.

With Play With Purpose, I am establishing play-based learning centers across planet Earth, harnessing The Power of Play through screen-free games. I shall call them Professor Qwbli’s Play-Based Learning Centers & Qeslora Intergalactic Museum & Space Shops. Great name, huh? 

Here, among other things, we will help to develop tomorrow’s great thinkers, problem-solvers and leaders that will lead us to success within classrooms, homes, communities, the planet, and ultimately the entire galaxy.

We want this space to include a studio to produce online professional development workshops, webinars & podcasts, as well as special place exclusively for teachers. Learn more about these below.

The first Professor Qwbli's Play-Based Learning Center will be located in beautiful Traverse City, Michigan this summer! Get ready to play, Northern Michigan!




The space will be used to host play-based after-school programs & camps, teacher workshops and events such as Family Game Nights and Parent Institutes, plus much more (check out our mock schedule below.) 
The space will also have a retail storefront that will feature The Qeslora Intergalactic Museum & Space Shop. The shop will sell Qeslora artifacts, memorabilia, souvenirs, as well as screen-free games from across the galaxy. 

This campaign was launched specifically to utilize the space's flexibility. The funds from this campaign will be used to build a studio to produce our online professional development workshops, as well as FREE webinars and podcasts. 


Teachers (and others) from around the world will be able to access our professional development workshops for continuing education credit via The Play With Purpose Academy, which is a partnership with Teachable. Our free webinars & podcasts will further our reach, as well as advance the play-based learning movement.

Perhaps the most exciting space within Professor Qwbli's is Q's Teacher's Lounge! Since we hold teachers in such high esteem, we are designating a special free space just for them: Q's Teacher's Lounge & Resource Center, where they can collaborate with Professor Qwbli, Play With Purpose and their colleagues, as well as discover play-based learning resources for their classrooms - or simply hang out and knock out some lesson plans or grab some coffee with a colleague.


Here is a mock schedule to give you a better idea of how the space will be used:




Here is a breakdown of how the funds will be used:









LET'S RECAP. WHO IS PROFESSOR QWBLI'S PLAY-BASED LEARNING CENTER FOR?
  • Students
  • Teachers
  • Parents
  • Families
  • Local Community


Over the past seven years, Play With Purpose has become the leader in play-based learning. We have worked with thousands of teachers, students and parents across the country using screen-free games to strengthen the cognitive abilities of our students.

We have done so through innovative after-school enrichment programs, including our Young Inventor and Young Authors Workshops, camps, effective professional development workshops, as well as events such as our Family Game Night.

Each game we use within our programs, workshops and events has been vetted and hand-picked by our network of Contributing Teachers who are using the games within their classrooms across the country.

We are extremely excited to open the galaxy's first play-based learning center with Professor Qwbli! It is truly an honor to have been chosen as his earthly education partner!




Through this space, we will help students build, develop & strengthen critical cognitive abilities while laughing and having a blast with their peers! Shhh! They don’t need to know that they are developing important skills that will lead them to a lifetime of success!

Teachers will be inspired to use play within their classrooms and we’ll provide them the knowledge, support and resources to do so. 

Parents will LOVE Professor Qwbli’s! Not only for our student programs, camps & events, but also because they will discover new ways to connect as a family.

Our events, brain lunch, B. SHARP senior programs and game store will help the community not only learn more about the importance of play, but we will also provide them ways to keep their brains fit at any age!



In addition to promoting imagination, independence and creativity, Play:
  • improves memory & stimulates the growth of the cerebral cortex
  • triggers the secretion of BDNF (brain-derived neurotrophic factor) a substance essential for the growth & maintenance of brain cells

  • is vital to a child’s EMOTIONAL, AFFECTIVE, PHYSICAL, ATTENTION, LANGUAGE, SOCIAL & COGNITIVE development 
Even more significant in educational terms, Play:
  • influences READING, WRITING & MATH FLUENCY

  • influences WORKING MEMORY, which is the ability to hold new information in short-term memory, concentrate, and manipulate that information to produce some result or reasoning processes. It is important in higher-order thinking, learning, and achievement

  • influences EXECUTIVE FUNCTIONS, which help students connect past experiences with present action and taps their ability to plan, organize, strategize, pay attention to and remember details and manage time & space

  • And most importantly, it influences COGNITIVE PROCESSING SPEED, which is the speed at which your brain processes information. Put simply, faster processing speed means more efficient thinking and learning
Cognitive Processing Speed has a major impact on students successfully navigating the world.



Just think - we can build, strengthen and develop the cognitive abilities that will lead our students to a lifetime of successes in the classroom, in the community and within their families by simply playing!



We have some great perks for you to help experience The Power of Play first hand! From our most popular family game, to a private online workshop exploring the benefits of play, to hosting Family Game Nights and other Specialty Game Events, to our Young Inventor Workshop, to games that will keep your brain active over the summer, there is something for everyone!

Event perks are available anywhere in the continental United States.

Professor Qwbli has fallen in love with cherries! It has become an obsession, so he has insisted that we include some special perks from Traverse City, The Cherry Capital of the World!

We even have a DOUBLE SECRET PERK that is only accessible by contacting us directly at jpine@qwbli.com. HINT: You may find yourself fully vested in our mission!

You can check out our full list of perks on the right. Here are some of the special Traverse City items included in our perks!


NEW REFERRAL REWARDS!





Jason Pine is using the Power of Play to develop tomorrow’s great thinkers, problem-solvers, communicators and leaders. J. is the Founder/President of Play With Purpose. He has over 25 years of educational experience, including classroom experience as a teacher in Chicago Public Schools, 20+ years experience in after-school programming and extensive experience in curriculum development. Jason has also started and run successful small ventures, and most recently, led the education initiative for a leading national toy and game retailer. He has a BS in Education and a Masters in Applied Professional Studies from DePaul University in Chicago, Illinois.

In addition to speaking at various educational events across the country, he also has a series of play-based learning curriculum books releasing in 2017 and has created an online play-based learning community for teachers to share, collaborate, create and discover play-based learning resources. The community is currently in Beta testing and is scheduled to launch in the first quarter of 2017.

Jason spent the past five years in Southern California, after twenty years in Chicago. In March, he fulfilled a lifelong dream of returning to his hometown of Traverse City, Michigan, where he now resides, making the most of life with his wife, Aneta, and their two children, JuJu & Van.

Aneta Michalczuk is a Polish first-generation American who left her hometown of Chicago, IL in 2011 after three decades of complaining about the weather extremes. Once she learned to embrace the positive aspects around her and fall in love with the city, she decided that unfortunately, she’d never learn to fall in love with the weather. (Yes, she waited five minutes.) 

Aneta spent 5 years residing in Southern California with her husband and two children, splitting her time between writing and her other passion, Play With Purpose, a cognitive development company that focuses on play-based learning. She has a B.A. in English Lit and has taught/been an instructional supervisor for Berlitz Language Centers. She had also opened and run her own successful language & advocacy center. 

In addition, she is a licensed and nationally board certified massage therapist. Aneta now lives in her new beloved hometown of Traverse City with her family and is excited to Play in the snow once again.

story:
Overview

When you know more about rural children in China, you will be more shocked by the simple fact that they are working so hard with English, but when it comes to communication, they can’t even speak a word.

“Mute English” is what Chinese people use to describe this language learning situation. After years of test taking, rote memorization and excessive assignments, these children are losing the confidence to speak English. What’s even worse, is that the way they are learning English makes them feel frustrated and disgusted with the language. These negative feelings and poor language ability have influenced their understanding of the western world, even generated prejudice against the western culture and values.  

There are many great English education groups in China, but they are not paying enough attention to the students in underdeveloped areas.China has more than 560 million rural people and over 1600 counties. What we are doing is to help these rural children with their language learning struggle. We want to get them out of the fear for English, to expand the limits of their language, and to know more about the world. And we need your help.

Who are we？

We are Dreamkids, a start-up English school built in 2018, based in Sishui, a small town in Shandong province in China. We devote ourselves to provide quality English education for the underdeveloped area in China.

We are a group of grassroots born and raised in these rural areas. As the survivors of the “Mute English”, we have a deeper realization of the English education gap between cities and our hometowns, and a better understanding of the struggle these rural kids are experiencing.

Rather than staying in metropolitans like Beijing or Shanghai, we decided to go back to our hometown after finishing the study in university, and do something for our younger brothers and sisters with their English learning.

What are we doing？

Instead of forcing the kids to learn new words, new grammars and memorize the rules in the old way, we let them absorb the language naturally.

1 Our lessons

The Dreamkids lessons are composed of two major parts— the offline classes and the app.

1) Offline classes

The Offline classes are designed to break the “Mute English ” tradition, therefore the kids are involved in an amount of oral practice during class time. We create meaningful language circumstances for the kids to have a better understanding of the content.

2) App

Another barrier that these rural families are facing, is that the parents are not able to give more help to their children, because of their poor grasp of the language. The fact is simple, the parents are also the victims of the “Mute English”.

Our APP provides an interactive way for the kids to review the class, do the homework and practice oral English independently. The reward mechanism of the APP encourages them to work harder on English.

For example, this is a typical learning process of one of our kids:

Owen takes the DreamKids English class on a Sunday. He goes home after the class, and receives the learning pages ( words, reading materials, phonics content in the class), and the homework, through the app downloaded on his mother’s phone or pad. Then he starts to review the learning pages, and do the oral practice and reading exercises.

At the same time, his teacher can check the percentage of progress on the app while he is reviewing. When he finished the homework, the performance will be updated for the teacher. And in the next Sunday class, his teacher could adjust the review part based on the update on the App.     

2 Our course system

3 Cultures, traditions and values of English-speaking countries

Language also brings people, especially the rural kids a broader look of the world.

  1. With their curiosity being sparked by different school events like X’ mas Party, Flea Market, Easter Egg Hunt…, they want to know more about the world.                                                       
  2. We help them understand and respect the differences between cultures and traditions.
  3. We wish to influence their values with a more global perspective. Every unit has a “Future Leader” part, the kids are encouraged to discuss topics like environment protection, water shortage, food safety and so on.​

Recently, we threw a big Halloween party. Many kids were so excited because that was the first Halloween they ever had. They dressed up in costumes, shouted “Trick or treat” for joy, got a pocket full of candies, went through the “Horror House ”…just like every normal kid in western countries.

George, one of our students, a 6-year-old boy, said to us after the party: “I wish everyday at Dreamkids is Halloween! When will we have this kind of party again?”

Sincerely Thanks

We want to give special thanks to the families who trust us at the beginning of our journey! 

We really appreciate the valuable feedback and homework videos you provided, and the effort you made to create an English-speaking environment at your home!

Our Expectation

Since we began this journey, hundreds of rural kids and their families have already been influenced by Dreamkids. We believe, these kids will have a bigger dream and a better future.

 To build more Dreamkids schools in rural areas, convey our concepts, and attract more young people like us to join our work, we need your help. We are estimating $52,000USD in capital costs for a new Dreamkids school. Next , we plan to cover 5-10 new counties with our school. Every penny you donate will help us a lot.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’ t contribute, we will also be very thankful If you can help by sharing our project, If you care about rural kids and English education, if you care about reducing the frustration and confusion of the cost of“Mute English”:

· Use the Indiegogo share tools!

· Post this campaign on social media!

· Send emails to your family and friends to let them know!

· It would be wonderful if you or your friends want to join us!

Let’s MAKE IT HAPPEN!

  

We are estimating $52,000USD in capital costs for a new Dreamkids school. Sample expenses:

Rent: $5000/year

Furniture: $2000

Air conditioner: $3000

Smart board: $3200($800*4)

Projector: $2000 ($500*4)

Decor and design: $5000  

Recruitment and salary: $20000

Tearoom and supplies: $1800

Restroom: $1000

Computer and printer: $3000

Books and Software: $4000

Promotional cost: $2000
story_txt:
OverviewWhen you know more about rural children in China, you will be more shocked by the simple fact that they are working so hard with English, but when it comes to communication, they can’t even speak a word.“Mute English” is what Chinese people use to describe this language learning situation. After years of test taking, rote memorization and excessive assignments, these children are losing the confidence to speak English. What’s even worse, is that the way they are learning English makes them feel frustrated and disgusted with the language. These negative feelings and poor language ability have influenced their understanding of the western world, even generated prejudice against the western culture and values.  There are many great English education groups in China, but they are not paying enough attention to the students in underdeveloped areas.China has more than 560 million rural people and over 1600 counties. What we are doing is to help these rural children with their language learning struggle. We want to get them out of the fear for English, to expand the limits of their language, and to know more about the world. And we need your help.Who are we？We are Dreamkids, a start-up English school built in 2018, based in Sishui, a small town in Shandong province in China. We devote ourselves to provide quality English education for the underdeveloped area in China.We are a group of grassroots born and raised in these rural areas. As the survivors of the “Mute English”, we have a deeper realization of the English education gap between cities and our hometowns, and a better understanding of the struggle these rural kids are experiencing.Rather than staying in metropolitans like Beijing or Shanghai, we decided to go back to our hometown after finishing the study in university, and do something for our younger brothers and sisters with their English learning.What are we doing？Instead of forcing the kids to learn new words, new grammars and memorize the rules in the old way, we let them absorb the language naturally.1 Our lessonsThe Dreamkids lessons are composed of two major parts— the offline classes and the app.1) Offline classesThe Offline classes are designed to break the “Mute English ” tradition, therefore the kids are involved in an amount of oral practice during class time. story:
Who We've Been, Who We Are & Where We're Going

When InterActing was founded 35 years ago, our vision was to bring the emotion and comedy of theatre to the world of language learning. On our journey, we have broadened our scope to include most learning needs and environments and deliver cross-curricular drama-based teaching throughout Europe. Our mission is to extend the way theatre and drama connect with education.

 

Revenge in Goldtown - The Online Show!

We need your help to fund the production of our latest project - an online Wild West show for language students based on our classic theatre play 'Revenge In Goldtown'!

(Original Illustrations of the play)

(The Goldtown cast - 2018)

(Watch our trailer here)
 

In recent years, we've been working hard to convert our energy from the stage to the screen. Our digital transformation has certainly been crafted with soul. We've been experimenting with many different techniques and ideas to capture that same energy, and we think we've cracked it. Now, we want to keep doing what we love!

 

With your help, we want to continue making quality language learning content, improving our equipment, and keep on training to be able to deliver the best quality products in drama-based learning. 

 

What We Need & What You Get​

Up until now, we've been delivering quality products despite our limited budget - mostly by investing lots of our time! Now however, time is of the essence for us and in order to deliver more content - with hopefully even better quality - we need better equipment and know-how.

Our plan is to invest any money raised into three main areas:

  • Recording equipment: Upgrading our outdated cameras, sound/light equipment, etc.
  • Post-production equipment: computers and editing software.
  • ​Then there's us! Human Resources: hours of training and investing in our work. 

We want to give back to the people who have helped us! Your reward varies with your donation, ranging from seeing your name in our credits, to being part of the show itself, or even full access to all our online content! 

With your help, we're sure we can get our project on its feet. However, if we don't manage to make our funding goal we still want to continue doing what we love - making the best of our resources to provide you with even more interactive language learning content! 

 

What We've Done, and Where We're Heading...

We are pioneers in bespoke theatre-based learning experiences and want to continue to campaign for the acceptance of drama and games as worthy educational tools. For many years we've been providing teacher training, performing thousands of theatre shows for language learners worldwide, and lending our expertise in blended learning to many European projects.

Now, circumstances have changed and we've turned our experience online in order to deliver high-quality educational resources to teachers and students who now have to learn online.

So far we've created both a Halloween and a Christmas pantomime special (in collaboration with the Irish Embassy and Face2Face Theatre respectively), entertaining educational videos where we explore the traditions of English-speaking culture whilst enjoying arts and crafts, karaoke, and storytelling. 

(Watch our trailer for the Christmas Special)

 

(Watch our trailer for the Halloween Special)

In collaboration with Connected Learning Community, we've created a full streaming show: 'Around the World in 80 Minutes', with a scene-by-scene interactive quiz. This show is based on one of our theatre shows and is in a similar format to our plan for 'Revenge In Goldtown'.

(Watch our trailer for Around the World in 80 Minutes) 
 

Last but not least, with CLC we've also crafted a series of 'Choose Your Own Adventure' videos to take the little ones on quests with some of our favourite original characters - Mr. Bear and Cheeky the Bee! In these interactive videos, the viewer tries to find the right way to progress the story from the options that appear on screen, often with hilarious results! 

Risks & Challenges

The artistic and cultural industries are facing one of the most challenging times in recent memory and we are no exception. In this turbulent time, we've been experimenting in order to adapt to this new situation where we can't rely on our theatre shows and while we believe we've created worthwhile products, we need to stay afloat to reach the people who need the resources that we know we can provide. Your contributions will go a long way to keeping our team together and making the educational content that teachers are currently crying out for.

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

  • Follow our social media to stay updated with us and what we're doing next!
    instagram: https://www.instagram.com/interactingcompany/
    facebook: https://www.facebook.com/InteractingTheatreCompany
    twitter: https://twitter.com/interacting_co
    Tik-Tok: @interactingcompany
  • Share this campaign wherever you can, on Indiegogo and elsewhere!
  • Put us in contact with people you know who'd be interested in what we can provide!

story:
WHO WE ARE

The Human Communication Studio, founded by innovator and strategist Kathryn Kellner, is a global company dedicated to the idea that all people have the capacity to realize their full potential.

We provide people with the fundamental skills needed to manifest profound changes in their lives, as clear and effective communication is crucial to personal growth every step of the way. Whether applied at work, at school, or amongst colleagues and friends, we have seen the difference these tools can make when cementing opportunities, advancing careers, and improving quality of life.

Here is what we know: When you have the knowledge needed to create a strategy, and the skills needed to execute, you can dramatically expand your capacity as a powerful communicator. In today’s world, making your voice heard is important, but being clearly understood is what makes all the difference when you strive for outcomes. 

We are an opportunity-seizing, new-job-landing, potential-realizing, “get-you-over-the-finish-line” company. To realize that potential, we employ gesture, body language, breath, and speech to decode concepts behind communication buzz words and transform pop science ‘tips and tricks’ into actionable tools for self development.

How we teach and apply this information is through use of videos and in-person and remote training. Our teaching continues to evolve alongside advances in technology - but these skills have been used for decades by our private clients.

Thousands upon thousands of people just like you have used our techniques to improve personal relationships, transform job interviews, conquer debates, engage a public audience, master speaking opportunities, gain agency in social interactions, and thrive in leadership positions.

And now, after years in development, our rapidly expanding video resources ensure that strategies can be tailored to support unique outcomes and serve the unique needs of people both in-person and through distance learning.

We are committed to providing all learners with effective patterns of authentic communication.

Help us to expand our reach and bring this platform to people around the world.

 

WHAT OUR PERKS OFFER


 

OUR PURPOSE

Our purpose is simple. We exist to make a difference in your life.

What does that mean? It’s simple. There is satisfaction in being understood.

Understanding and being fully understood underscore all forms of educational, personal, and professional success stories.

That’s the kind of difference that our clients know we can make. We give people the communicative agility needed to create the strong “big picture” and “in the moment” perceptions necessary to effectively communicate their thoughts and ideas. That means guiding everyone to develop THEIR OWN relationship and personal agency over what THEY control and how it's used.

We help people to make their mind, their breath, and their body into an asset that can propel them toward achieving real outcomes in the real world. That’s becoming more and more important in a tech-centered, globally focused workplace.

The integration of technology into every facet of daily life has created a culture that may be highly “plugged in”, but one which is more and more socially disengaged in face-to-face contexts. We structure, define, and make accessible the kind of soft skills that are falling out of practice and which are highly in demand.

Our system provides concepts and tools that can be used immediately with measurable outcomes:

  • improved relationships through the fostering of charismatic connection;
  • building effective dialogue between adversaries;
  • bridging the gap in multigenerational communication;
  • encourage critical and innovative thinking;
  • promotion active listening skills;
  • mastering oral, visual and written communication skills;
  • overcoming fear of speaking in public or in front of figures of authority;

It’s not just about a “communication”, and it never has been.

Soft skills are in demand because soft skills get concrete results - and no matter how tech driven our society becomes, there are still thinking, breathing, feeling human beings on both sides of the communication equation.

We are your solution to gaining that feeling of confidence, fulfilling that desire to nail it, crafting that need to stand out, defining the “what” of the what you already know and do, so you can do it over and over again under a variety of circumstances.

Experience the empowerment that comes from understanding exactly what does and doesn't work for your own body, and learn the skills that can help you navigate towards your own goals and as your own person.



 

WHY WE'RE LAUNCHING THIS CAMPAIGN

It's time. Everyone needs these fundamental skills. Our mission is to cultivate these skills in all humans around the world.

This noble and important motivation has been encouraging us to decide to grow as a company, to have worldwide exposure and visibility and to build a better, bigger e-learning platform with ever-expanding content. In this way we can help serve a more diverse population of people facing unique challenges in need of specific solutions.

With your help we will be able to expand access to underserved communities around the world and fund the inclusion of contributors and talent that are more representative of our global community.

We believe in the power of face-to-face interactions as transformational experiences. We seek to benefit individuals who truly desire to improve or alter their way of communicating in order to reach better opportunities in their personal or professional experiences. We are unique because we provide face-to-face skills and strategy through a digital medium (our video platform) and we are launching a campaign to be able to deliver this across the world to all people and to affect world change. 

Our small team has accomplished so much. We’ve piloted our program with organizations across the globe. We’ve done our homework and collected feedback. We’ve begun to make a difference with people. Help us take it to the next level!



 

OUR GOALS AND EXPECTATIONS 

A successful campaign will allow The Human Communication Studio to develop even more cutting edge and advanced technology to address critical interpersonal communication challenges faced by people around the world. The campaign would allow for the development of new technology, allow us to expand into new foreign markets and offer support in new languages, respond to the needs of the underserved and people with disabilities, and increase traffic on our social media platforms and website.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP 

Contributing to our campaign isn't the only way to help us. You can help us today by sharing our campaign on Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn, and with your friends, family and network. Please use the hashtag #CommunicateTheWayForward and tag The Human Communication Studio so we can help amplify your efforts.

We are grateful to each and every one of you for your support!
The Human Communication Studio

The campaign would allow for the development of new technology, allow us to expand into new foreign markets and offer support in new languages, respond to the needs of the underserved and people with disabilities, and increase traffic on our social media platforms and website.
