story:
We are dedicated to advocating for people with misattributed parentage experiences (MPEs). We promote educational awareness and other advocacy work for people who have a an MPE, usually discovered from an over-the-counter DNA test.  Perhaps you have visited our website at www.righttoknow.us?

We are in the process of creating credentialed educational courses with four licensed mental health professionals to educate their peers on the multifaceted aspects and implications of treating people with MPEs. 

Our rigorous curriculum consists of peer-reviewed definitional and statistical information; information on identity crisis, ambiguous loss, grief, and ethical concerns; as well as trauma treatment options. Help us pay the necessary certification registration fees, technology costs, and establish a scholarship fund for therapists and laypeople who would like to take this course.
story_txt: We are dedicated to advocating for people with misattributed parentage experiences (MPEs). We promote educational awareness and other advocacy work for people who have a an MPE, usually discovered from an over-the-counter DNA test.  Perhaps you have visited our website at www.righttoknow.us?We are in the process of creating credentialed educational courses with four licensed mental health professionals to educate their peers on the multifaceted aspects and implications of treating people with MPEs. Our rigorous curriculum consists of peer-reviewed definitional and statistical information; information on identity crisis, ambiguous loss, grief, and ethical concerns; as well as trauma treatment options. Help us pay the necessary certification registration fees, technology costs, and establish a scholarship fund for therapists and laypeople who would like to take this course.

story:
PR INQUIRIES  press@geeekclub.reproj.com

Welcome to Geeek Club, the easy and FUN way to gain engineering skills. It’s no secret, engineering is one of the single most valuable skillsets you can have in this day and age.

For anyone who wants to work on their inventor muscles, there’s no better way to start! If you’ve always looked up to geniuses like Tesla and Edison, then you can get a small taste of their genius and develop your technical abilities without boring yourself to tears with courses and textbooks.

 

Are you ready to become a genius, have fun and impress everyone you meet? Geeek Club has TWO unique robotics kits for you to choose from.

 

Imagine a world where light is the only available power source, and robots scour the land in search of the precious energy to keep them going. Those robots would function in a very similar way to these nano-smart bots!

With light sensors and vibro-motors, these robots will intelligently move toward any light source, giving you endless amusement and an amazing conversation starter. Their size makes them the perfect décor for your office desk and kids love playing with these bite-sized robots.

 

 2L4G

This miniature robot earnestly sets out in any direction after the light it seeks. Building this robot is not only fun, but also enriching: you’ll learn everything from structural engineering to vibro-motor mechanics.

 

2L1G

Every one of these miniature light-seeking robots has their own personality which will make them a main-stay at home or in the office. By the time you are done, you’ll have a better appreciation for printed circuit boards and will have some of the essential skills of an inventor!

 

6L1G

This complex robot has 6 legs just like its namesake, and seeks the light relentlessly! You’ll learn about soldering using through-holes, surface-mounted devices and technology, and how to ensure electricity flows through every essential component.

 

MAT001

This is the biggest robot in the Nano-bots set, requiring 4 printed circuit board cars to assemble. It blinks and has plenty of personality!

 

W001

This nano-robot is unstoppable! With vibration, oscillation and resonance motor engineering, you’ll learn valuable skills that can help you become an electrical genius in no time!

 

TM BOT

This is the logo of our maker space TroubleMaker where the idea of nanobots was born. It represents the “devil may care” spirit of pure creative engineering, daring to push the boundaries in order to invent something new.

 

OTAKU

OTAKU is a vintage Japanese robot-card. Funny illustration for start with, easy soldering for beginners, this vintage robot will take you outer space to meet the invaders.

 

The designs were inspired by North and South American indigenous cultures, as well as Scandinavian, African, and Asian amulets and artwork. This vibrant set also allows you to mix and match different pieces to invent your own creations.

The Voodoo robots set is perfect for combining every aspect of STEAM learning – Science, Technology, Engineering, Art and rudimentary Math.

 

Suún Inca

This robot design is based off of the sun god and has numerous rays exuding from its circuit board body in an entrancing way. It is motor powered with many lights, helping you learn about soldering and electrical engineering while having fun. 

 

Tribz Benin

This gorgeous robot makes an interesting and unique décor piece as well as an outstanding educational experience, with SMD and SMT as well as through-hole soldering fun.

 

Bony Mexico

The Bony robot has several very bright LED’s which attach to the mask/head, teaching you about electricity, light emitting diode technology, and structural engineering without you even noticing!

 

Baȁtz Indonesia Bali

While you build this macabre Voodoo robot, you’ll also learn about the mechanics of oscillation and vibration motors which help you create a unique robot with functional mobility.

 

Drøpz Japan

This bright blue light-emitting robot is so fun to make, you’ll completely forget that you are acquiring valuable engineering skills!

Wāld Scandinavia

Wald may be the most vibrant in this set, with a vast array of bright green lights forming a spellbinding matrix. The complexity of Wald is easy enough for beginners, while giving experienced engineers enough to be interested in the entire time!

 

Helly Haiti

This robot is perfect as a Halloween decoration, with its motion and devilish appearance! The light-emitting diodes around its head give it an eerie, yet oddly satisfying finished look.

 

With step-by-step instructions in the box, building robots becomes no more complicated than other common constructions toys.

But we don’t just want you to follow steps without learning anything about what you’re doing!

That’s why you’ll also receive instructional videos where the inventor of these robots shows you exactly how they work, as well as electrical information in the instruction books that familiarizes you with the components you are soldering onto these printed circuit boards.

 

There are no definitive rules when putting the robots together. Be creative, and do it in your own style!

 

Co-Founders Nico and Nikita are on a mission to bring movie-like robots to your DIY tabletop, but it’s not only that. They’re pushing to create a world of inventors for the next generation of technology.

When Nico and Nikita met at their favorite maker space -- TroubleMaker, which was founded by Nico with partners -- they hit it off and knew they had to team up to begin writing their history on the pages of Shenzhen.

 

Nico 

 

Nico (Nicolas Deladerrière) comes from a family of artists and inventors, so it’s no mystery how he got the idea to start the TroubleMaker maker space, but a lot of things had led to that point. After he achieved a Masters degree in both fine art and Industrial Design and marketing, he set out to indulge in his worldly desires with travel, due in part to the fact that he had a craving to experience all types of cultures after bouncing around different European cities as a child. All the while pondering the relationship between science and art, Nico was naturally drawn to Shenzhen, the Silicon Valley of China and a breeding ground for hardware startups.

In his words, “One of my friends called and asked me to join his design studio in Shenzhen. I definitely saw this as an opportunity for fresh air, resetting my European heritage. I got very interested and started to search about this new city, and the fun part is that Shenzhen is a brand new city, like a New York at its beginning. There was almost nothing about Shenzhen on the internet at the time I arrived there 12 years ago, just an interview of an artist was found, and that artist was answering a journalist’s question of why he went to Shenzhen, and his answer was “because I took the wrong plane.” This quip made me laugh and was my first step in discovering Shenzhen, which I in fact found to be very interesting — a blank page where lots of things were to be written and created.

After a decade of living in Shenzhen and working in R&D for big groups and startups , he decided together with his friend Hans to found a Maker Space called ”TroubleMaker” right in the heart of the biggest world electronic market. Their aim was to create the perfect environment for different inventors and technological people, providing them with everything needed to create something totally new. It’s a very well-known Maker Space, especially among all English speaking people.

 

Nikita

 

 

The perfect complement to Nico’s skillet, Nikita Potrashilin has extensive experience working hands-on with Chinese suppliers and manufacturers. His 13 years in China and 8 years  in product development, sourcing and knowledge of the Chinese language keeps everything at Geeek Club running smoothly. Nikita is a surfer, a proud and self-proclaimed geek, and is a dedicated member of TroubleMaker.

 

With the success of this project, we will be enabled to explore further possibilities within this space. Our goal is to implement and develop further our other forward-technology ideas, ones that progress upon this one and become more complex, because we want to teach more people the basics (and beyond) of electronics.
 

 

 Geeek club is a manufacturer of PCB gadgets and electronics education tools with the mission of providing electronics proficiency in the basics and beyond. The skills we look to instill in our supporters include hardware engineering, structure engineering, vibration/resonance/oscillation engineering, the principles of current — and most important of all, how to have fun while doing it! 

 

Geeek Club Robots are made to enthrall experts and beginners alike! If you’ve never built a robot before, then welcome to the club! You’ll have a blast! And those who are familiar with this technology are sure to enjoy the aesthetic, artistic way we’ve created these robots.

 

For children, they should be supervised by an adult as there is a soldering component to these robot construction kits. Please be sure to observe the proper safety precautions at all times.

Laurence Von Thomas - Design and Founder of Reflex modular film camera project. Founder and editor of online photography gallery: "If You Leave".

story:
About PURT

Purt is an NGO operating in Slovakia since 2012. It seeks to empower Roma communities and promotes interethnic cooperation. We work with a network of Roma activists to improve the quality of life and co-habitation in villages with a considerable amount of Roma population. With a little contribution and a lot of enthusiasm we can help locals achieve real change in their own lives. 

How does Purt work?

-  It is a network of Roma activists who represent their villages, and understand the small issues that affect the everyday lives of locals. 

-  Our activists discuss these problems on our regular meetings, suggest solutions to them, then draw a shortlist of the most pressing issues. 

-  The organization provides the necessary financial support from donations, as these projects usually do not exceed a few dozen euros in cost.

-  The projects of Purt are usually implemented with the involvement of local workforce, local companies, local governments and citizens, which has a significantly positive impact on good relations and local cohabitation. 

What are we campaigning for?

The organization provides financial support for a list of projects approved for each monthly implementation period. These projects normally have  a small budget, but significantly improve the quality of life and co-habitation. They cover a range of issues, such as a new sound system for children's performances, renovating bus stops or community centers, repainting fences or benches in public areas and occasionally supporting community-building events. These projects are usually co-funded with local authorities, to maximize the organization's outreach. 

The impact and vision of Purt

In the past years Purt has implemented successful projects in more than 50 settlements, and the number of successful projects has exceeded 200. The increasing number of participants proves that Purt is a good example and that with minimal input we can achieve big improvements. With your support we can spread this well-functioning model to other regions as well, and to improve the quality of life and neighborly relations among the Roma and non-Roma population.

story:
We collaborate with a wide variety of individuals, community agencies, organizations, clubs and activity programs to provide a diverse and inclusive range of activities for young people to engage in, under the guidance of mentors, coaches, teachers and leaders in Crook County.

We provide a cooperative model of community education with a young person focus, in a shared space which fosters collaboration, learning and engagement in new and inspirational activities.

We network with existing organizations, groups and schools to reduce duplication of activities, to foster wrap-around services and ensure that that the needs of all Crook County youth are being met in a safe and healthy community of learners.

We are drug and alcohol free and offer group support for those who are trying to make healthy decisions and might be struggling with the challenges of making lifestyle changes.

We offer a responsive and flexible schedule of activities and classes based on the needs of youth and families and the available skills of community partners, mentors and coaches.

We welcome young parents and offer early childhood education programs in collaboration with children’s playgroups and parent support circles. We support young moms and dads equally.

We offer meeting space and classroom space for community organizations or individuals for art classes, certification courses, meetings or other community appropriate needs in off hours.

We prioritize public, private and home-school groups in the scheduling of spaces, honoring a multitude of ways of learning and supporting families in healthy and appropriate choices.

We partner with organizations who offer tutoring and homework help We also support individual education pathways through MOOCs, distance education or webinars as well as internships, mentorships and apprenticeships. We help young people reconnect to education opportunities.

Who We Serve

While Ochoco Innovation Station is created with young people ages 14-25 as our target audience, we are open to people of all ages, and everyone is encouraged to find their place at the station and contribute to the community.

Programs and Services

  We accomplish our mission in the following ways

  • By offering a safe, supervised space and a variety of structured, self-directed activities designed through community input and participant needs

  • By engaging young people in all processes, from strategic planning, to daily responsibilities, to program design and implementation using research-based strategies

  • By offering real-world education in vocational and technical skills and in The Arts

  • By creating a vibrant and welcoming space where all kinds of people are welcome and where communication, collaboration and conflict resolution can be practiced with support

  • By encouraging innovation and new ideas, and recognizing there is opportunity in failure

  • By maintaining a database of volunteers and master-instructors who are thoroughly background-checked and trained as mentors, advocates and coaches

  • By focusing on co-created spaces for music and art, innovation and design, vocational skills, food preparation and sharing and a commitment to a collaborative community

  • By offering a multitude of opportunities for people to engage in the work, thereby making Ochoco Innovation Station a vibrant heart-of Crook County space

Goals 2016-2018

  1. Reduce the influence of drugs and alcohol on our youth by empowering them with a sense of belonging to a healthy and creative community that they have a role in directing, regardless of socio-economic level, gender, interest, talent or ability

  2. Connect young people to meaningful opportunities for leadership development, community engagement, scholarship, service and fun.

  3. Offer space for all ages of learners to engage in The Arts, Technology and Innovation.

  4. Offer meeting space for community groups who support young adults in addictions recovery, parenting skills, financial literacy, healthy living and nutrition.

  5. Offer weekly events for all-ages fun and entertainment.

  6. Deepen relationship among local networks to increase understanding, effectiveness and capacity for community engagement, vibrancy and growth.

  7. Create partnerships between Ochoco Innovation Station and local businesses, government, philanthropy and community members.

  8. Increased opportunities for cost-saving collaborations, shared spaces and cooperative problem-solving.

What We Need & What You Get

  • $50,000.00 ASAP to secure the perfect building and begin the work
  • $20,000.00 for supplies, tools, equipment and safety.
  • Perks -

    Community Partner

    $10,000

    artistic cut-metal banner hung in the main gallery space

    5 one-year adult memberships (can be designated)

    Steward

    $1000

    named on plaque in main gallery space

    2 one-year adult memberships

    Member

    $250

    Member T-Shirt and 1 one-year adult membership

    Ambassador - 14-25 yrs

    $20

    Ambassador T-Shirt and ID card

    It Matters!

    $5

    Shout Out! via social media, chalk-talk wall of fame

The Impact

Like small, rural communities everywhere, resources in Crook County are limited and access to healthy activities is a challenge for too many young people. The Ochoco Innovation Station will target this group, but serve the entire community through a wide range of programs. Inter-generational understanding, healthy lifestyle choices, successful transitions from high school to adult life, alternatives to drug and alcohol culture (and the support to make healthy changes) through music, art, innovation and exploration will all happen here in a collaborative community space. You can help! If not with money, by sharing our story!

story:
HOW DID WE BEGIN?
The Old Balara Christian Community School is a non-stock, non-profit enterprise originally established in 1987 as a church outreach program in an urban poor community in Old Balara, Quezon City. The founders, Rex and Anji Resurreccion, have worked with several young people in the area since 1981. Through regular weekly Bible studies with about 15 to 20 children, many of them managed to stay in school and developed attitudes and habits that helped them to eventually finish College. Together, they established the Old Balara Christian Community (OBCC) School in 1987 to reach out to other young people in the hope of transforming the youth to be “salt and light” in the community. 

Based on their own experience, the members of OBCC noted that the labor market had increasingly become more competitive through the years, so that the poor could not manage to match their middle class counterparts in bagging the more attractive job offers in the market place. It was also noted that among the poor, early failure in schooling was common, and the youth experienced school-or teacher-induced sense of hopelessness, lack of ambition and aspiration, and loss of motivation for further development and exercise of creativity.  Through OBCC community outreach programs, individuals and families were helped to defeat patterns of behaviors that contributed to their greater poverty, through the development of positive work habits. 

HOW ARE WE DIFFERENT?
The OBCC School views education as not simply about preparing the young to look for good jobs, but also about preparing them to create their own jobs (through business or self-employment). This has significant meaning to children belonging to the poor of Old Balara, where very few are able to reach or finish College. Currently, half of our students (numbering 270) come from families who are able to pay tuition, and the other half come from indigent community residents whom we admit as “scholars”.  Thus, we take in one indigent scholar for every paying student we teach at the school. Due to our limited space at 701 Tandang Sora Street, Old Balara, Quezon City, we could not accommodate more students beyond 300.  Over the years, parents from within and outside the Old Balara community have visited our premises as they have heard of our unique enterprise-oriented Christian curriculum from various media.  

The OBCCS upholds the building of an enterprising society emphasizing the following values in the curriculum:  Christianity, Nationalism, Science, Excellence and Entrepreneurship.

Our school has been featured in Philippine National TV before, and published in magazines and newspapers like the Philippine Daily Inquirer: http://business.inquirer.net/196312/gradeschoolers-learn-complex-ways-of-business

THE CHALLENGE:
The owner of the lot plans to develop it into a business. So the school will lose its location. This means displacement for all the existing students by March 2016. We have found a new location, but the owner of the lot is asking for PHP 10,000,000.00 ($200,000) as earnest money. Then we will have to pay an additional PHP 40,000,000 ($800,000) to buy the lot and building. 

We hope that you will find it in your heart to support this school, and help make a change in the lives of the underprivileged children that we teach.

BENEFITS:
  • $300 - Sponsor one child's education to our school for one year
  • $600 - Sponsor one child's education, plus contribute to our building fund. Your name will be published on our website, and engraved on our donor's wall. You will also receive a letter from a Teacher with the photo of our OBCCS students.
  • $1,200 - All of the above, plus a hand-painted shirt from a student with a personal letter.
  • 2,500 - All the above, plus a medium-sized painting from a student
  • $12,500 and up - All of the above, and we will conduct one livelihood seminar for parents and teachers for free, in your name, per $10,000 contribution.
  • $50,000 - A room in the school will be named after your company/organization.

The OBCCS is Philippine SEC Registered (CN 200258170)  and BIR tax exempt (TIN 228-919 725 000).   

All contributions will be issued official receipts.
story_txt:
HOW DID WE BEGIN?The Old Balara Christian Community School is a non-stock, non-profit enterprise originally established in 1987 as a church outreach program in an urban poor community in Old Balara, Quezon City. The founders, Rex and Anji Resurreccion, have worked with several young people in the area since 1981. Through regular weekly Bible studies with about 15 to 20 children, many of them managed to stay in school and developed attitudes and habits that helped them to eventually finish College. Together, they established the Old Balara Christian Community (OBCC) School in 1987 to reach out to other young people in the hope of transforming the youth to be “salt and light” in the community. 
Based on their own experience, the members of OBCC noted that the labor market had increasingly become more competitive through the years, so that the poor could not manage to match their middle class counterparts in bagging the more attractive job offers in the market place. It was also noted that among the poor, early failure in schooling was common, and the youth experienced school-or teacher-induced sense of hopelessness, lack of ambition and aspiration, and loss of motivation for further development and exercise of creativity.  Through OBCC community outreach programs, individuals and families were helped to defeat patterns of behaviors that contributed to their greater poverty, through the development of positive work habits. 
HOW ARE WE DIFFERENT?The OBCC School views education as not simply about preparing the young to look for good jobs, but also about preparing them to create their own jobs (through business or self-employment). This has significant meaning to children belonging to the poor of Old Balara, where very few are able to reach or finish College. Currently, half of our students (numbering 270) come from families who are able to pay tuition, and the other half come from indigent community residents whom we admit as “scholars”.  Thus, we take in one indigent scholar for every paying student we teach at the school. Due to our limited space at 701 Tandang Sora Street, Old Balara, Quezon City, we could not accommodate more students beyond 300.  Over the years, parents from within and outside the Old Balara community have visited our premises as they have heard of our unique enterprise-oriented Christian curriculum from various media.  
The OBCCS upholds the building of an enterprising society emphasizing the following values in the curriculum:  Christianity, Nationalism, Science, Excellence and Entrepreneurship.Our school has been featured in Philippine National TV before, and published in magazines and newspapers like the Philippine Daily Inquirer: http://business.inquirer.net/196312/gradeschoolers-learn-complex-ways-of-businessTHE CHALLENGE:The owner of the lot plans to develop it into a business. So the school will lose its location. This means displacement for all the existing students by March 2016. We have found a new location, but the owner of the lot is asking for PHP 10,000,000.00 ($200,000) as earnest money. Then we will have to pay an additional PHP 40,000,000 ($800,000) to buy the lot and building. 
We hope that you will find it in your heart to support this school, and help make a change in the lives of the underprivileged children that we teach.

$300 - Sponsor one child's education to our school for one year
$600 - Sponsor one child's education, plus contribute to our building fund. Your name will be published on our website, and engraved on our donor's wall. You will also receive a letter from a Teacher with the photo of our OBCCS students.
$1,200 - All of the above, plus a hand-painted shirt from a student with a personal letter.
2,500 - All the above, plus a medium-sized painting from a student
$12,500 and up - All of the above, and we will conduct one livelihood seminar for parents and teachers for free, in your name, per $10,000 contribution.
$50,000 - A room in the school will be named after your company/organization.

All contributions will be issued official receipts.

story:
The aim of this campaign:

Through your kind help and funding you shall be helping me become a competent and confident permaculture teacher in Greece: inspiring the Greek people into becoming resilient and self-sufficient, sowing the seeds of hope and dignity.


Who I am:

My name is Elena Gogou, and I come from Athens, Greece. I am currently working in the field of Alternative Medicine as a Healer and Flower Therapist. I have also been practicing Biodynamic Gardening and Permaculture for the last 7 years,  I am a mother of 3 teenagers, a seed saver, an occasional artist, and a blogger.

For the first 10 years of my professional life I worked as an EFL teacher in both formal and  informal educational settings. I then worked as an Investigator for the Greek Ombudsman and the Children’s Rights Ombudsman, where I organized and coordinated the operation of the Youth Advisory Forum and e-Forum, empowering young people to learn, demand, and enjoy their Human Rights.

In 2006 I came across the world of Permaculture through the Internet, and began reading about it, and tentatively practicing it. In 2008 and 2009 I participated in 2 consecutive workshops on “Permaculture and Ecovillage Design”, given by Craig Gibsone and Beatriz Guttierez from the Findhorn Community. My life changed: I became a member of the first food cooperative in Athens, I went on a course to gain systematic knowledge of Biodynamics, and I began organizing my life along permaculture principles. In 2010 I gave up my job at the Greek Ombudsman to pursue a career in Alternative Medicine, and with a group of like minded friends started the first Athenian Urban Farm in Halandri. This was intended as a working biodynamic farm, and as a nurturing ground exploring the dynamics and the possibility for an intentional community (potential ecovillage). 

Meanwhile, I became a volunteer for  Peliti (seed savers network)and a seed-saver. In 2013 I did a PDC with Rod  Everett and Mill Millichap at Seliana, in Greece, and started giving short courses at the Urban Farm on permaculture, growing food, composting, etc. In 2014, having organized various awareness-raising events (about seed and food sovereignty) I became the coordinator of the Peliti group in Athens.  

videos of events I have organised 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Jz3fsKVrGOY

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bJ1ZdkCHnOg


In 2014 I went to India representing Peliti at the Bhoomi Festival in Delhi, organised by Navdanya. I also visited the Earth University "Bija Vidyapeeth" in Dehradun, and gave a presentation about the work of Peliti seed saving network in and around Greece to the students of the "A-Z Agroecology" course.


My quest and vision:

I am enthralled with the beauty of our planet, and this inspires me to make art, flower essences, and practice permaculture. The more I practice it, the more I want to share it with others. 

I believe we can live in peace, dignity and abundance, celebrating our diversity, caring for and learning from each other (‘other’ meaning not only human but also all the non-human inhabitants of the Earth). I believe we really  have all the resources we need to live in happiness and abundance, and the only resource really lacking is inspiration and imagination: this, I think, is the greatest gift permaculture has to offer to humanity today.


So far, I have been sharing permaculture with my friends and colleagues at the Urban Farm, either through short courses/workshops or simply explaining why we do things the way we do. It never fails to inspire and fire the imagination! But, being an artist, I want to do it more artfully! This is why I have chosen to do Rowe Morrow’s course “Permaculture Teaching Matters” in Mallorca this year (this is where you can see what it's all about). Rowe Morrow is an acclaimed permaculture teacher of many years, and the author of the book “The Earth User’s Guide to Permaculture”, which was the first permaculture book to be translated into Greek, and which I had the honour and pleasure to edit. Through working on this book I came to appreciate and respect the writer’s knowledge, care, and expertise in permaculture.

Through the “PTM” course I am hoping to become more artful, competent and confident in spreading the word of Permaculture in Greece. There are already 2-3 Greek permaculture teachers, but there is a pressing need for more!

I believe permaculture offers inspiration and viable ideas and solutions for a way forward. It creates optimism and hope grounded in all the successful ventures worldwide as well as in the tried-and-tested practices of our ancestors, combined with modern science.


I believe in empowering people to become masters and mistresses of their own fate rather than expecting gods governments or gurus to think for them or “save” them.

I believe that the way forward is beyond the left and the right, beyond capitalism. It lies in a new paradigm that is based upon the 3 permaculture ethics: earth care, people care, fair share.

This is the vision that I want to inspire in people, this is the vision that inspires me.

Why Permaculture in Greece?

Every industrialized modern country needs permaculture! But Greece has a few more reasons that demand it:

a.  It is a land with an abundance of valuable material and spiritual resources that can be harvested without harming either the people or the Earth, and which, wisely used, can contribute to the wealth not only of the Greek people but also of the world.

b.  The political system (both local and European) has failed the people of Greece, whose only  hope for dignity and survival lies in a return to its tradition: small-scale farming, self-sufficiency, resilience, arts & crafts. Yet tradition has to be informed and updated with the modern-day findings of agro-ecology, hydrology, biotecture, and soil science in order to be viable and relevant today. Permaculture is a system that allows for all this and more: ideas and practices that enliven a fractured multi-cultural society (social permaculture).

c.  Greece is facing a humanitarian crisis – nobody can eat money, and most people’s creativity is shattered in westernized “9-5-type” jobs in cities!

d.  The Greeks are an artistic life-loving people who are now at an impasse how to go forward, how to find a way out of the debt trap that capitalism has lured them into (like it has lured so many other countries in its death march)

I would like your help to be able to train to become an effective permaculture teacher, so as to be able to offer permaculture training to local Greek communities in the Greek language (without translators or interpreters). Thus we shall be able to build a culture of resilience and sustainability in a land which has still much to offer, still much to teach the world, but which is suffering for lack of empowerment and inspiration as well as lack of wise planning and ethical management.


A gift for a gift

In Greece when we accept a gift we always give a gift back to the giver, and we have a special name for this: “antidoron”.he only material thing I can offer you back for your support in my training as permaculture teacher, is a packet of biodynamic heritage seeds grown in the Halandri Urban Farm (for donations from 1-20 euros), pebbles from a greek beach with hand-drawn original designs on them: a little sample of my art on stone. Each one is unique. You could make them into rings or pendants, or you could simply have them on your desk or altar as a small token of my gratitude (donations between 20 -100 euros).

For donations that exceed 100 euros, my antidoron will be an original watercolour painting.

Post Script:

For all the friends who wish to donate but for whatever reason (capital controls in Greece, for example) cannot do so through their credit cards, please leave a comment and I will get back to you for alternative routes!

story:
Languages available below:

  • English
  • Svenska
  • Norsk
  • Dansk
  • Deutsch
  • Türkçe
  • Italiano

ENGLISH: A school is a long-term solution

In the fall of 2014 300,000 thousand people had to flee the attacks of ISIL against Kobane i Kurdistan. But thanks to YPG/YPJ's defence thousands of people have chosen to return to their homes. This has created the need for reconstruction. The Rojava Committees has collected and shipped 10 tons of clothes, built a music studio and staffed and equipped a rehabilitation centre for wounded fighters among other things. There is now a desperate need for the building of schools so that the people won't feel such a strong need to leave their homes in search for a future for their children.

We need your help with raising funds to build a new schools. One that does not bare the marks of the oppression from the old regime and from the bullets fired by ISIL. Let this school become an oasis of freedom for the ones who have grown up under dictatorship and civil war.

Contribute with funds for building materials at rebuildkobane.org!

---

SWEDISH: En skola - en långsiktig lösning 

Hösten 2014 tvingades 300 000 människor på flykt till följd av ISIS:s attack mot Kobane i Kurdistan. Men tack vare YPG/YPJ:s försvar, har tusentals människor nu valt att återvända till sina sönderbombade hem i Kobane. Det har skapat behovet för återuppbyggnad. Rojavakommiteerna har samlat in och skickat 10 ton kläder, byggt en musikstudio och bidragit med både personal och material till rehabiliteringscenter m.m. Ett akut behov, för att folket ska slippa lämna sina hem, är det fortsatta bygget av skolor. Utbildnings- möjligheter innebär framtidsutsikter. 

Vi behöver din hjälp i vår insamling för bygget av en ny skola, en som inte är märkt av den gamla regimens förtryck och av ISIS kulhål. Utan en som ska symbolisera ett fritt Rojava. Låt det bli en oas av frihet för de som vuxit upp under diktatur och inbördeskrig. 

Bidra med pengar till byggmaterial! 

  • Kortbetalning: rebuildkobane.org 
  • Swish: 070 037 5204
---

NORSK

Høsten 2014 ble 300 000 mennesker tvunget på flukt, som følge av ISIS' angrep på Kobane i Kurdistan. Men takket være YPG/YPJ's forsvar, har tusentals mennesker nå valgt å returnere til sine utbombede hjem i Kobane. Det har skapt et behov for gjenoppbygging.

Rojavakomiteene har samlet inn og sendt 10 tonn med klær, bygget et musikkstudio og bidratt med både personal og materialer til et rehabiliteringssenter m.m. For at folk skal slippe å forlate sine hjem, er det et akutt behov for å fortsette byggingen av skoler. Utdanningsmuligheter innebærer framtidsutsikter.

Vi behøver din hjelp til vår innsamling for byggingen av en ny skole, en som ikke bærer preg av det gamle regimets undertrykkelse og ISIS kulehull. Derimot en som skal symbolisere et fritt Rojava. La det bli en oase av frihet for de som har vokst opp med diktatur og borgerkrig.

---

DANSK

Rfteråret 2014 blev 300.000 mennesker tvunget på flugt efter ISIS' angreb på Kobane i Kurdistan. Takket været YPG/YPJ's forsvar vender mange tusinde nu tilbage til sine sønderbombede hjem i byen. Det har skabt et stort behov for genopbygning.

Rojavakomiteerne har indsamlet og sendt 10 tons tøj afsted, bygget et musikstudie og bidraget med både personale og materiale til rehabiliteringscenter mv.
Der er akut behov for skoler for at sikre, at folk ikke tvinges til at forlade sine hjem. Uddannelsesmuligheder giver bedre fremtidsudsigter.

Vi behøver din hjælp i vores indsamling for at bygge en ny skole, der ikke er præget af det gamle regime og af ISIS' kuglehuller. Den skal i stedet symbolisere et frit Rojava. Lad det blive en oase af frihed for dem, der voksede op under diktatur og borgerkrig.

---

DEUTSCH

Herbst 2014 zwang der Islamische Staat durch seinen Angriff auf Kobane 300 000 Menschen zur Flucht. Dank der Verteidigung durch die YPG und YPJ haben sich nun tausende Menschen zur Rückkehr in ihre zerbombte Heimatstadt entschieden. Dadurch ist der Wiederaufbau nun besonders wichtig. Die Rojavakomitees haben unter anderem 10 Tonnen Kleidung gespendet, ein Musikstudio gebaut sowie mit Personal und Material zu einem Rehabilitationszentrum beigetragen. Um den Menschen ein Leben in Kobane zu ermöglichen ist besonders der weitere Wiederaufbau von Schulen erforderlich, denn Bildungsmöglichkeiten schaffen Zukunftsperspektiven.

Wir brauchen nun im Rahmen unserer Spendenaktion zum Bau einer Schule deine Hilfe! Diese Schule soll ein Symbol für das freie Rojava sein, weder durch die Spuren des alten unterdrückerischen Regimes, noch von Einschusslöchern der Waffen des IS gezeichnet. Diese Schule soll eine Oase der Freihet sein, für die Generation die unter Diktatur und Bürgerkrieg herangewachsen ist.

---

TÜRKÇE

2014’ün Sonbaharında 300.000 insan İşid saldırıları nedeniyle Kürdistan'ın Kobane şehirindeki evlerinden kaçmaya zorlandı. YPG/YPJ birliklerinin başarılı savunması sayesinde şu an binlerce kişi bombalanmış evlerine geri dönme seçeneği buldu. Bu durum şehrin yeniden yapılanma ihtiyacını doğurmuştur. Rojavakommiterna (Rojava komiteleri) şimdiye dek hem personel hem de malzeme desteğiyle, 10 ton giysi toplayip göndererek ve bir müzik stüdyosu inşaa ederek Kobane’deki rehabilitasyon merkezleri ve benzeri oluşumlara katkıda bulunmuştur. İnsanların evlerini yeniden terk etmeye mecbur kalmamaları için şu an en acil ihtiyaçlardan biri okulların inşaasının devam etmesidir. Kobane’de eğitimin yeniden başlaması insanların umutlanmaları anlamına geliyor.

Duvarları İşid’in mermileriyle delik deşik olmayan, eski rejimin izlerini taşımayan ve Özgur bir Rojava’yı temsil edecek yeni bir okulun yapımı için sizin yardımınıza ihtiyacımız var. Rojava diktatörluk, zulüm ve iç savaş altında büyüdü. Şimdi onu hep birlikte bir özgürlük alanına dönüştürme zamanı. Bunu gerçekleştirmek için sizin de dayanışma ve desteğinizi bekliyoruz.

---

ITALIANO

Nell’ autunno 2014, 300.000 persone sono state costrette a fuggire a causa di un attacco dell’ISIS a Kobane in Kurdistan. Grazie alla difesa di YPG/YPJ, migliaia di persone hanno ora scelto di tornare nelle loro case bombardate di Kobane. Questo ha creato la necessità di ricostruire ciò che è stato distrutto dai bombardamenti. Rojavakommiteerna (Comitati di Rojava) ha raccolto e inviato 10 tonnellate di abbigliamento, costruito uno studio di registrazione e ha contribuito con personale e strumenti alla rinascita del locale centro di riabilitazione. Un bisogno primario affinché le persone non si vedano costrette a lasciare le proprie abitazioni, è la ricostruzione delle scuole, affinché il diritto allo studio apra nuovi orizzonti per il futuro.

Abbiamo bisogno del vostro aiuto nella nostra raccolta di fondi per la costruzione di una nuova scuola, una scuola priva di simboli oppressori del vecchio regime o di fori di proiettili dell’ ISIS. Una scuola che possa simboleggiare una Rojava libera, un'oasi di libertà per coloro che sono cresciuti sotto la dittatura e la guerra civile.

Languages available below:


English
Svenska
Norsk
Dansk

Italiano


ENGLISH: A school is a long-term solution
In the fall of 2014 300,000 thousand people had to flee the attacks of ISIL against Kobane i Kurdistan. But thanks to YPG/YPJ's defence thousands of people have chosen to return to their homes. This has created the need for reconstruction. The Rojava Committees has collected and shipped 10 tons of clothes, built a music studio and staffed and equipped a rehabilitation centre for wounded fighters among other things. There is now a desperate need for the building of schools so that the people won't feel such a strong need to leave their homes in search for a future for their children.
We need your help with raising funds to build a new schools. One that does not bare the marks of the oppression from the old regime and from the bullets fired by ISIL. Let this school become an oasis of freedom for the ones who have grown up under dictatorship and civil war.
Contribute with funds for building materials at rebuildkobane.org!
---

SWEDISH: En skola - en långsiktig lösning 
Hösten 2014 tvingades 300 000 människor på flykt till följd av ISIS:s attack mot Kobane i Kurdistan. Men tack vare YPG/YPJ:s försvar, har tusentals människor nu valt att återvända till sina sönderbombade hem i Kobane. Det har skapat behovet för återuppbyggnad. Rojavakommiteerna har samlat in och skickat 10 ton kläder, byggt en musikstudio och bidragit med både personal och material till rehabiliteringscenter m.m. Ett akut behov, för att folket ska slippa lämna sina hem, är det fortsatta bygget av skolor. Utbildnings- möjligheter innebär framtidsutsikter. 
Vi behöver din hjälp i vår insamling för bygget av en ny skola, en som inte är märkt av den gamla regimens förtryck och av ISIS kulhål. Utan en som ska symbolisera ett fritt Rojava. Låt det bli en oas av frihet för de som vuxit upp under diktatur och inbördeskrig. 
Bidra med pengar till byggmaterial! 


Kortbetalning: rebuildkobane.org 
Swish: 070 037 5204

---


NORSK
Høsten 2014 ble 300 000 mennesker tvunget på flukt, som følge av ISIS' angrep på Kobane i Kurdistan. Men takket være YPG/YPJ's forsvar, har tusentals mennesker nå valgt å returnere til sine utbombede hjem i Kobane. Det har skapt et behov for gjenoppbygging.
Rojavakomiteene har samlet inn og sendt 10 tonn med klær, bygget et musikkstudio og bidratt med både personal og materialer til et rehabiliteringssenter m.m. For at folk skal slippe å forlate sine hjem, er det et akutt behov for å fortsette byggingen av skoler. Utdanningsmuligheter innebærer framtidsutsikter.
Vi behøver din hjelp til vår innsamling for byggingen av en ny skole, en som ikke bærer preg av det gamle regimets undertrykkelse og ISIS kulehull. Derimot en som skal symbolisere et fritt Rojava. La det bli en oase av frihet for de som har vokst opp med diktatur og borgerkrig.
---
DANSK
Rfteråret 2014 blev 300.000 mennesker tvunget på flugt efter ISIS' angreb på Kobane i Kurdistan. Takket været YPG/YPJ's forsvar vender mange tusinde nu tilbage til sine sønderbombede hjem i byen. Det har skabt et stort behov for genopbygning.
Rojavakomiteerne har indsamlet og sendt 10 tons tøj afsted, bygget et musikstudie og bidraget med både personale og materiale til rehabiliteringscenter mv.Der er akut behov for skoler for at sikre, at folk ikke tvinges til at forlade sine hjem. Uddannelsesmuligheder giver bedre fremtidsudsigter.
Vi behøver din hjælp i vores indsamling for at bygge en ny skole, der ikke er præget af det gamle regime og af ISIS' kuglehuller. Den skal i stedet symbolisere et frit Rojava. Lad det blive en oase af frihed for dem, der voksede op under diktatur og borgerkrig.
---
DEUTSCH
Herbst 2014 zwang der Islamische Staat durch seinen Angriff auf Kobane 300 000 Menschen zur Flucht. Dank der Verteidigung durch die YPG und YPJ haben sich nun tausende Menschen zur Rückkehr in ihre zerbombte Heimatstadt entschieden. Dadurch ist der Wiederaufbau nun besonders wichtig. Die Rojavakomitees haben unter anderem 10 Tonnen Kleidung gespendet, ein Musikstudio gebaut sowie mit Personal und Material zu einem Rehabilitationszentrum beigetragen. Um den Menschen ein Leben in Kobane zu ermöglichen ist besonders der weitere Wiederaufbau von Schulen erforderlich, denn Bildungsmöglichkeiten schaffen Zukunftsperspektiven.
Wir brauchen nun im Rahmen unserer Spendenaktion zum Bau einer Schule deine Hilfe! Diese Schule soll ein Symbol für das freie Rojava sein, weder durch die Spuren des alten unterdrückerischen Regimes, noch von Einschusslöchern der Waffen des IS gezeichnet. Diese Schule soll eine Oase der Freihet sein, für die Generation die unter Diktatur und Bürgerkrieg herangewachsen ist.
---

TÜRKÇE
2014’ün Sonbaharında 300.000 insan İşid saldırıları nedeniyle Kürdistan'ın Kobane şehirindeki evlerinden kaçmaya zorlandı. YPG/YPJ birliklerinin başarılı savunması sayesinde şu an binlerce kişi bombalanmış evlerine geri dönme seçeneği buldu. Bu durum şehrin yeniden yapılanma ihtiyacını doğurmuştur. Rojavakommiterna (Rojava komiteleri) şimdiye dek hem personel hem de malzeme desteğiyle, 10 ton giysi toplayip göndererek ve bir müzik stüdyosu inşaa ederek Kobane’deki rehabilitasyon merkezleri ve benzeri oluşumlara katkıda bulunmuştur. İnsanların evlerini yeniden terk etmeye mecbur kalmamaları için şu an en acil ihtiyaçlardan biri okulların inşaasının devam etmesidir. Kobane’de eğitimin yeniden başlaması insanların umutlanmaları anlamına geliyor.
Duvarları İşid’in mermileriyle delik deşik olmayan, eski rejimin izlerini taşımayan ve Özgur bir Rojava’yı temsil edecek yeni bir okulun yapımı için sizin yardımınıza ihtiyacımız var. Rojava diktatörluk, zulüm ve iç savaş altında büyüdü. Şimdi onu hep birlikte bir özgürlük alanına dönüştürme zamanı. Bunu gerçekleştirmek için sizin de dayanışma ve desteğinizi bekliyoruz.---ITALIANO
Nell’ autunno 2014, 300.000 persone sono state costrette a fuggire a causa di un attacco dell’ISIS a Kobane in Kurdistan. Grazie alla difesa di YPG/YPJ, migliaia di persone hanno ora scelto di tornare nelle loro case bombardate di Kobane. Questo ha creato la necessità di ricostruire ciò che è stato distrutto dai bombardamenti. Rojavakommiteerna (Comitati di Rojava) ha raccolto e inviato 10 tonnellate di abbigliamento, costruito uno studio di registrazione e ha contribuito con personale e strumenti alla rinascita del locale centro di riabilitazione. Un bisogno primario affinché le persone non si vedano costrette a lasciare le proprie abitazioni, è la ricostruzione delle scuole, affinché il diritto allo studio apra nuovi orizzonti per il futuro.
Abbiamo bisogno del vostro aiuto nella nostra raccolta di fondi per la costruzione di una nuova scuola, una scuola priva di simboli oppressori del vecchio regime o di fori di proiettili dell’ ISIS. Una scuola che possa simboleggiare una Rojava libera, un'oasi di libertà per coloro che sono cresciuti sotto la dittatura e la guerra civile.

story:
Hello, we are Nitrox Development; a group of four students and software developers that have been close friends for several years.  When we decided it was time to push our boundaries as tech-savvy people we came to the conclusion that we should develop our own mobile application.  Because we are all studying in college as aspiring professionals in different software related fields, we figured it would be best to construct an application on something relatable to our lives and the lives of many young adults; college.  That is when the idea of UConnect was conjured.

This campaign is extremely important to us because while we are still growing as students and learning everyday, we surely don't lack passion.  We are up for the challenge but we need your help to make UConnect a reality and help bring it to every college across America.  We appreciate your support!



We are trying to raise  money for development resources and programs.  With an app of the magnitude we hope to achieve, there will be many costs along the way including buying graphic design software, building or paying for servers, etc.  Our fund are low, so any and all contributions toward completing this project will help speed up the overall process and get a beta version out to schools very soon! Want to see UConnect come to your campus first? Check out how to make this happen:

  • $1 - "Thank You!"
  • $5 - "Tier 1"
  • $15 - "Tier 2"
  • $25 - "Tier 3"
  • $50 - "Tier 4"
  • $500 - "School Investor"

Whether or not we reach our goal we will take whatever funding we raised and work with what we have.  We are passionate about this project and will do whatever it takes with what we have to make this work.




Even if monetary contributions aren't your style, don't worry!  Just help spread the word by telling friends, tweeting at us - @NitroxDev - or liking/sharing us on Facebook - Facebook.com/NitroxDev.  We appreciate any help you can give us.
