story:
(Versão  Português está abaixo)

"This is where Alice in Wonderland meets the Wizard of Oz. ... When the kids see that bus, it's magic." -Art Instructor Lynette Henry of the Orange Show Art Bus

This campaign is about putting education on wheels and bringing it to areas in Rio de Janeiro, where there is no permanent library structure, or sufficient language, art and writing classes in schools. 

The bus will be a converted short bus that’s part library, part art and writing studio. It will work as a part of our pending non-profit arm PJAE, which works to find and support exceptional young artists and writers in Brazil.

The Art and Writing Library Bus, Book Bus for short, will allow us to give thousands of kids access to our team of teachers, volunteers, hundreds of books (in four different languages) and intriguing classes.  We will be able to support schools and communities with library facilities, storytelling sessions, book clubs, poetry and play readings, art workshops and language classes. We will work alongside schools to determine what books and activities are fitting.  As our bus will also work as a classroom we will be able to invite guest instructors to lead creative classes from art to astronomy to you name it. 

WHO WE ARE

We are Lesa, Talita, Katia, Evandro, Millicent and Stacey, some of the names behind this Project. One half of us live in Brazil, the other half in Canada and the USA but what bonds us is our belief in how education can transform and this project.  We are educators, artists, parents, caregivers, volunteers and entrepreneurs.  Collectively we have over fifteen years of teaching experience and countless volunteer experience around the world. 

While doing research on the arts in Brazilian schools and developing PJAE, we found that a lot of students weren’t getting the opportunity to explore them in the classroom, especially in rural and poor areas. How were we going to find the best young artists and writers, if some were being excluded based on economics and access?  So we needed to find an inclusion solution and that is what this bus aims to be, the first of many mobile classrooms and libraries across Brazil, that provides a space that encourages reading, learning and sharing in the visual and language arts.

WHAT’S IT GONNA TAKE?

We already have a good collection of books, and we have a bunch of art equipment to start.  So that just leaves the bus.  We're asking you for at least $4,700 USD to purchase an old mini-bus, ensure that it is roadworthy (repaired, licensed and insured) and to transform it into a fun mobile library in its simplest form. The more you contribute, the better the bus will be aesthetically and functionally, for example if we raise $15,750 we will be able to install important items – like an air conditioner, lighting, a built-in awning (for outdoor classes), custom folding chairs and tables, a natural gas (NGV) kit (so we can save on transportation costs), solar panels (for power), a computer, library software, speakers and a projector.  To accomplish any or some of these extras remember we need to raise more than our $4,700 goal. 

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU? 

If you check out the right sidebar there are some awesome perks waiting for you.  T-shirts, postcards, your name on the bus, even your portrait on the bus!! Plus we are inviting you to Rio de Janeiro, Brazil to volunteer with us for a day.  





$50 Face off - Have your picture illustrated as a part of a crowd painting that will be placed on the bus. View updates as the illustration is being made. Receive a color postcard with the image of the final painting and a high res digital photograph through email.  + Dollar Dreams + Shout Outs! + Postal + Name on It 

Crowd Founder Certificate - If you choose any perk at or above $75 will get you a crowd founder certificate. Yes! Not funder but Founder. The certificate recognizes that you: One, are helping to found and are investing in the education of students in underserved communities, and Two, that you believe in this project you are helping to create. Here you can frame your certificate & showcase it to the world. 

$75 T-CERT - Get a Members only Bus T-shirt, only available here, + an official Crowdfunding Certificate naming you a Crowd Founder of this Project.  Once you’ve got them, don’t forget to take a pic in your TEE, with cert in hand and post it on our Facebook  page. +Dollar Dreams +Shout Outs! +Postal + Name on it + Face off

$75 Teeny Mini Bus - Get a mini handmade clay sculpture of the Book Bus. We will send you a minibus sculpture made by our students at our first set of art classes.  They will get the chance to make two minibus sculptures one for them and one for you. Each student artist will be photographed with their creations and will write you a little note of thanks (these items will be included in your shipped package).  Each bus will be carefully packaged in handmade paper boxes and sent from Brazil. + Crowd Founder Certificate + Dollar Dreams + Shout Outs! + Name on It 

$100 Road trip! - Come visit us and volunteer on the bus for a day! Come in 2016 /2017!  (We’ll send you the details and help you make arrangements. Just know that you’ll have to cover all your own expenses, airfare, transportation, stay etc.) We'll even have a traditional Brazilian lunch together. Want to spend a week add an additional $25 for each additional day. This perk at this value will not be available after the campaign. + Crowd Founder Certificate + Dollar Dreams + Shout Outs! + Name on It 

$100 Bus Print - Receive a painted monoprint of the Book Bus. A monoprint is a single impression of an image made from a reprintable block. Each print will be an original work of art on fine art paper, signed by the artist. Size: 8.5 x11 inches.  + Crowd Founder Certificate + Dollar Dreams + Shout Outs! + Name on It 

$200 Work it! - Come visit us and host a 1 day workshop! We'll provide the translator and help you plan the workshop. Come in 2016 /2017! (We’ll send you the details. Just remember you’ll have to cover all your own expenses, airfare, transportation, food etc.). Want to spend a week add an additional $25 for each additional day. + Crowd Founder Certificate + Dollar Dreams + Shout Outs! + Name on It 

$325 I want it all! - Dollar Dreams +Shout Outs! +Postal + Name on it + Face off + T-CERT + Road Trip +Bus Print + teeny mini bus Sculpture = You get it all! Just read the afore mentioned perks for details. If you choose to retrieve your perks in person then great! When you come to spend the day, they'll be here. If you choose to have them shipped to you just add $10 to your contribution.

$500 Busy Bus - Get Your Logo on our bus! It’s that simple. Plus we'll send you a hi-res pic and every clipping or T.V. report about the bus where your logo appears.

$1,000 Star bus! - Get your logo on our bus, plus get awarded your sponsorship certificate in person in Brazil, and you get to sponsor or lead a workshop for a community of students. Plus we'll take pics of everything for you to use in press releases, on your website or social media page.

All perks will be mailed as soon as they are ready, for most this will only take a month or two from the end of the campaign.  Shipping is not included, however depending on your item that cost may run from $1 to $10. Please see each perk for details.

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

This is a wonderful project with achievable goals. We already have a few vehicles in mind to choose from, we’ve contacted a well-known company that specializes in conversions and they have kindly run us through their process and a projected timeline.  We are giving ourselves 6 months from the end of the campaign to launch. Of course, if we are able to launch before that we definitely will.  To ensure the longevity of the Book Bus Project we will procure cooperate sponsorship and host paying workshops to offset our expenses.

Your support – whether by donation or word of mouth – can help this project reach its full potential.

So, lets do this!

Thank you!

-PJAE Team! 




****************************Versão  Português******************************

"É aqui onde Alice no país das maravilhas encontra o Mágico de Oz. ... Quando as crianças veem aquele ônibus, é mágico." Instrutor - art Lynette Henry da Orange Show Art Bus”

Esta campanha é sobre colocar a educação sobre rodas e levá-la para áreas do Rio de Janeiro, onde não existe uma estrutura de biblioteca permanente ou linguagem suficiente, arte e aulas de redação nas escolas.

O ônibus será um micro-ônibus convertido que é parte biblioteca parte, estúdio de arte e escrita. Ele funcionará como parte pendente do nosso braço sem fins lucrativos da PJAE, que trabalha para encontrar e apoiar jovens artistas e escritores excepcionais no Brasil.

O ônibus literário irá nos permitir dar a milhares de crianças o acesso à nossa equipe de professores, voluntários, centenas de livros (em quatro línguas diferentes) e aulas intrigantes. Seremos capazes de apoiar as escolas e as comunidades com instalações de biblioteca, sessões de contação de histórias, os clubes do livro, poesia, leituras encenadas, oficinas de arte e aulas de línguas. Vamos trabalhar junto às escolas para determinar quais livros e atividades são apropriadas. Como nosso ônibus também funcionará como uma sala de aula, poderemos convidar instrutores para conduzir aulas criativas da arte, astronomia  até vários outros assuntos.

Vamos colocar um Ônibus Literário aqui

QUEM SOMOS

Somos Lesa, Talita, Katia, Evandro, Millicent and Stacey, alguns dos nomes por trás deste projeto. Alguns de nós vivem no Brasil, no Canadá e nos EUA, mas o que nos une é a nossa crença em como a educação pode transformar e este projeto. Somos educadores, artistas, pais, cuidadores, voluntários e empresários. Coletivamente, temos mais de quinze anos de experiência de ensino e incontáveis experiências de voluntariado em todo o mundo.

Ao fazer uma pesquisa sobre as artes nas escolas brasileiras e desenvolvendo a PJAE, descobrimos que muitos estudantes não estavam recebendo a oportunidade de explorar, as artes em sala de aula, especialmente nas áreas rurais e pobres. Como iriamos encontrar os melhores jovens artistas e escritores, se alguns eram excluídos com base na economia e acesso? Assim, foi necessário encontrar uma solução de inclusão e é isso que este ônibus pretende ser, a primeira de muitas salas de aula e bibliotecas móveis em todo o Brasil, que oferece um espaço que incentiva a leitura, a aprendizagem e partilha nas artes visuais e de linguagem.

O QUE NÓS PRECISAMOS?

Nós já temos uma boa coleção de livros e equipamentos artisticos para. De modo que só resta o micro-ônibus. Estamos pedindo, pelo menos, $ 4.700 para comprar um velho micro-ônibus, no certificar que ele está em condições de circular (reparado, licenciado e segurado) e transformá-lo em uma divertida biblioteca móvel em sua forma mais simples. Quanto mais você contribuir, melhor o ônibus ficará esteticamente e funcionalmente, por exemplo, se nós levantamos $ 15,750 seremos capazes de instalar itens importantes - como um aparelho de ar condicionado, iluminação, um toldo acoplado(para aulas ao ar livre) feito sob encomenda, cadeiras dobráveis, mesas, um kit de gás natural (GNV) (para que possamos economizar em custos de transporte), painéis solares (para energia), um computador, software da biblioteca, alto-falantes e um projetor. Para conseguir qualquer ou alguns desses extras lembre-se que precisamos para levantar mais do que o nosso objetivo $ 4.700.

O QUE VOCÊ GANHA?

Se você ir para a barra lateral direita há algumas vantagens incríveis esperando por você. camisas, postais, o seu nome no ônibus, até mesmo o seu retrato no ônibus !! Além disso, estamos convidando você ao Rio de Janeiro, para ser voluntário conosco por um dia. Vantagens serão enviadas assim que estejam prontas, para a maioria levaria um ou dois meses a partir do fim da campanha.

$50 Face Estampada - Tenha sua imagem ilustrada como parte da pintura de uma multidão que será colocada no Ônibus Literário(Book Bus). Veja as atualizações de como a ilustração está sendo feita. Receba um cartão colorido com a imagem da pintura final e uma fotografia digital de alta resolução através do e-mail. + Dollar Dreams + Shout Outs! + Postal + Name on It 

Certificado de Colaborador Fundador - Se você escolher qualquer vantagem igual ou superior a $ 75 você obterá um certificado de colaborador fundador. Sim! Não financiador, mas Fundador. O certificado reconhece que você: 1) está ajudando a financiar e está investindo na educação de estudantes em comunidades carentes, e 2) que você acredita neste projeto que está ajudando a criar. Aqui você pode emoldurar o certificado e mostrá-lo ao mundo.

$75 Camisa Exclusiva – Ganhe uma camisa exclusiva dos membros do Book Bus somente disponível aqui, + um Certificado de Colaborador Fundador desse projeto. Depois de recebê-los não se esqueça de tirar fotos com sua camiseta, com o certificado em mãos e postar na página do Facebook. +Realizando Sonhos + Agradecimentos! + Cartão Postal + Seu Nome No Book Bus + Face off

$75 Miniatura do Book Bus – Ganhe uma miniatura de argila feita à mão do Book Bus. Nós enviaremos para você uma miniatura feita por nossos alunos na primeira série de aulas de Arte. Eles terão a chance de fazer duas esculturas do Book Bus um para o próprio aluno e outra para você. Cada aluno artista será fotografado com suas criações escreverá uma pequena nota de agradecimento para você(esses itens serão inclusos no seu pacote enviado). Cada miniatura do Book Bus será cuidadosamente embalada em caixas de papel feito à mão e enviada do Brasil. + Certificado de Colaborador

$100 Na Estrada! – Venha nos visitar e ser voluntário no Book Bus por um dia! Venha em 2016/2017!(Enviaremos os detalhes e ajudaremos você a planejar-se. Apenas saiba que terá que cobrir suas despesas com passagem aérea, transporte, alimentação, estadia etc.) Faremos até um tradicional almoço à brasileira juntos. Gostaria de passar uma semana? Adicione $25 para cada dia adicional. Esta vantagem não estará disponível após a campanha. + Certificado de Colaborador + Realizando Sonhos+ Agradecimentos! + Seu Nome No Book Bus 

$100 Bus Print - Receba um monoprint do Book Bus. Um monoprint é uma impressão única de uma imagem feita a partir de um bloco impresso por pressão. Cada impressão será uma obra de arte original sobre papel de fina arte, assinada pelo artista. Tamanho: 8.5x11 polegadas. + Certificado de Colaborador + Realizando Sonhos+ Agradecimentos! + Seu Nome No Book Bus 

$200 Realize Workshops! – Venha nos visitar e organize um workshop! Nós ofereceremos tradutor e ajudaremos com o planejamento do workshop. Venha em 2016/2017(Enviaremos os detalhes e ajudaremos você a planejar-se. Apenas saiba que terá que cobrir suas despesas com passagem aérea, transporte, alimentação, estadia etc.) Gostaria de passar uma semana? Adicione $25 para cada dia adicional. + Certificado de Colaborador + Realizando Sonhos+ Agradecimentos! + Seu Nome No Book Bus 

$325 Receba tudo! - Realizando Sonhos+Agradecimentos! +Cartão Postal + Seu Nome No Book Bus + Face off + T-CERT + Road Trip +Bus Print + teeny mini bus Sculpture = Você recebe tudo! Basta ler as vantagens acima mencionadas para obter detalhes. Se você optar por obter suas recompensas pessoalmente, será ótimo! Quando você vier, elas estarão aqui. Se você optar para que elas sejam enviadas para você adicione apenas US $ 10 a sua contribuição.

$500 Book Bus movimentado – Tenha seu Logo em nosso Book Bus! É simples assim! E mais, enviaremos uma figura em alta resolução e todos os clipes de reportagem de TV onde o seu Logo apareça.

$1,000 Book Bus das estrelas! – Tenha seu Logo no Book Bus e mais receba seu certificado de patrocinador pessoalmente no Brasil, você poderá ministrar um workshop para a comunidade de alunos, iremos fotografar tudo para uso na mídia, em nosso site ou em páginas de sites de mídia social.

Todas as recompensas, assim que estiverem prontas, na maioria dos casos levará um mês ou dois a partir do final da campanha. O envio não está incluso, entretanto dependendo do item o custo de ver ir de $1 a $10. Por favor, veja cada vantagem para detalhes.


RISCOS E DESAFIOS

Este é um projeto maravilhoso com metas alcançáveis. Nós já temos alguns veículos em mente para escolher, nós contatamos uma empresa bem conhecida que se especializa em conversões e eles gentilmente nos incluirão no processo e no cronograma projetado. Estamos planejando 6 meses a partir do final da campanha para o lançamento. Claro que, se formos capazes de lançar antes o faremos definitivamente. Para garantir a longevidade do Projeto ônibus literário vamos procurar por patrocínio e realizar oficinas pagas para compensar nossas despesas.

Seu apoio - seja por doação ou de boca em boca - pode ajudar este projeto a atingir seu pleno potencial.

Então, vamos lá!

Obrigado.
story_txt:
(Versão  Português está abaixo)
"This is where Alice in Wonderland meets the Wizard of Oz. ... When the kids see that bus, it's magic." -Art Instructor Lynette Henry of the Orange Show Art Bus




This campaign is about putting education on wheels and bringing it to areas in Rio de Janeiro, where there is no permanent library structure, or sufficient language, art and writing classes in schools. 
The bus will be a converted short bus that’s part library, part art and writing studio. It will work as a part of our pending non-profit arm PJAE, which works to find and support exceptional young artists and writers in Brazil.The Art and Writing Library Bus, Book Bus for short, will allow us to give thousands of kids access to our team of teachers, volunteers, hundreds of books (in four different languages) and intriguing classes.  We will be able to support schools and communities with library facilities, storytelling sessions, book clubs, poetry and play readings, art workshops and language classes. We will work alongside schools to determine what books and activities are fitting.  As our bus will also work as a classroom we will be able to invite guest instructors to lead creative classes from art to astronomy to you name it. WHO WE ARE
We are Lesa, Talita, Katia, Evandro, Millicent and Stacey, some of the names behind this Project. One half of us live in Brazil, the other half in Canada and the USA but what bonds us is our belief in how education can transform and this project.  We are educators, artists, parents, caregivers, volunteers and entrepreneurs.  Collectively we have over fifteen years of teaching experience and countless volunteer experience around the world. 
While doing research on the arts in Brazilian schools and developing PJAE, we found that a lot of students weren’t getting the opportunity to explore them in the classroom, especially in rural and poor areas. How were we going to find the best young artists and writers, if some were being excluded based on economics and access?  So we needed to find an inclusion solution and that is what this bus aims to be, the first of many mobile classrooms and libraries across Brazil, that provides a space that encourages reading, learning and sharing in the visual and language arts.WHAT’S IT GONNA TAKE?
We already have a good collection of books, and we have a bunch of art equipment to start.  So that just leaves the bus.  We're asking you for at least $4,700 USD to purchase an old mini-bus, ensure that it is roadworthy (repaired, licensed and insured) and to transform it into a fun mobile library in its simplest form. The more you contribute, the better the bus will be aesthetically and functionally, for example if we raise $15,750 we will be able to install important items – like an air conditioner, lighting, a built-in awning (for outdoor classes), custom folding chairs and tables, a natural gas (NGV) kit (so we can save on transportation costs), solar panels (for power), a computer, library software, speakers and a projector.  To accomplish any or some of these extras remember we need to raise more than our $4,700 goal. WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?  
If you check out the right sidebar there are some awesome perks waiting for you.  T-shirts, postcards, your name on the bus, even your portrait on the bus!! Plus we are inviting you to Rio de Janeiro, Brazil to volunteer with us for a day.  






$50 Face off - Have your picture illustrated as a part of a crowd painting that will be placed on the bus. View updates as the illustration is being made. Receive a color postcard with the image of the final painting and a high res digital photograph through email.  + Dollar Dreams + Shout Outs! + Postal + Name on It 
Crowd Founder Certificate - If you choose any perk at or above $75 will get you a crowd founder certificate. Yes! Not funder but Founder. The certificate recognizes that you: One, are helping to found and are investing in the education of students in underserved communities, and Two, that you believe in this project you are helping to create. Here you can frame your certificate & showcase it to the world. 


$75 T-CERT - Get a Members only Bus T-shirt, only available here, + an official Crowdfunding Certificate naming you a Crowd Founder of this Project.  Once you’ve got them, don’t forget to take a pic in your TEE, with cert in hand and post it on our Facebook  page. +Dollar Dreams +Shout Outs! +Postal + Name on it + Face off
$75 Teeny Mini Bus - Get a mini handmade clay sculpture of the Book Bus. We will send you a minibus sculpture made by our students at our first set of art classes.  They will get the chance to make two minibus sculptures one for them and one for you. Each student artist will be photographed with their creations and will write you a little note of thanks (these items will be included in your shipped package).  Each bus will be carefully packaged in handmade paper boxes and sent from Brazil. + Crowd Founder Certificate + Dollar Dreams + Shout Outs! + Name on It 
$100 Road trip! - Come visit us and volunteer on the bus for a day! Come in 2016 /2017!  (We’ll send you the details and help you make arrangements. Just know that you’ll have to cover all your own expenses, airfare, transportation, stay etc.) We'll even have a traditional Brazilian lunch together. Want to spend a week add an additional $25 for each additional day. This perk at this value will not be available after the campaign. + Crowd Founder Certificate + Dollar Dreams + Shout Outs! + Name on It 
$100 Bus Print - Receive a painted monoprint of the Book Bus. A monoprint is a single impression of an image made from a reprintable block. Each print will be an original work of art on fine art paper, signed by the artist. Size: 8.5 x11 inches.  + Crowd Founder Certificate + Dollar Dreams + Shout Outs! + Name on It 
$200 Work it! - Come visit us and host a 1 day workshop! We'll provide the translator and help you plan the workshop. Come in 2016 /2017! (We’ll send you the details. Just remember you’ll have to cover all your own expenses, airfare, transportation, food etc.). Want to spend a week add an additional $25 for each additional day. + Crowd Founder Certificate + Dollar Dreams + Shout Outs! + Name on It 
$325 I want it all! - Dollar Dreams +Shout Outs! +Postal + Name on it + Face off + T-CERT + Road Trip +Bus Print + teeny mini bus Sculpture = You get it all! Just read the afore mentioned perks for details. If you choose to retrieve your perks in person then great! When you come to spend the day, they'll be here. If you choose to have them shipped to you just add $10 to your contribution.
$500 Busy Bus - Get Your Logo on our bus! It’s that simple. Plus we'll send you a hi-res pic and every clipping or T.V. report about the bus where your logo appears.
$1,000 Star bus! - Get your logo on our bus, plus get awarded your sponsorship certificate in person in Brazil, and you get to sponsor or lead a workshop for a community of students. Plus we'll take pics of everything for you to use in press releases, on your website or social media page.



All perks will be mailed as soon as they are ready, for most this will only take a month or two from the end of the campaign.  Shipping is not included, however depending on your item that cost may run from $1 to $10. Please see each perk for details.
RISKS AND CHALLENGES
This is a wonderful project with achievable goals. We already have a few vehicles in mind to choose from, we’ve contacted a well-known company that specializes in conversions and they have kindly run us through their process and a projected timeline.  We are giving ourselves 6 months from the end of the campaign to launch. Of course, if we are able to launch before that we definitely will.  To ensure the longevity of the Book Bus Project we will procure cooperate sponsorship and host paying workshops to offset our expenses.
Your support – whether by donation or word of mouth – can help this project reach its full potential.
So, lets do this!Thank you!-PJAE Team! ****************************Versão  Português******************************"É aqui onde Alice no país das maravilhas encontra o Mágico de Oz. ... Quando as crianças veem aquele ônibus, é mágico." Instrutor - art Lynette Henry da Orange Show Art Bus”
Esta campanha é sobre colocar a educação sobre rodas e levá-la para áreas do Rio de Janeiro, onde não existe uma estrutura de biblioteca permanente ou linguagem suficiente, arte e aulas de redação nas escolas.
O ônibus será um micro-ônibus convertido que é parte biblioteca parte, estúdio de arte e escrita. Ele funcionará como parte pendente do nosso braço sem fins lucrativos da PJAE, que trabalha para encontrar e apoiar jovens artistas e escritores excepcionais no Brasil.
O ônibus literário irá nos permitir dar a milhares de crianças o acesso à nossa equipe de professores, voluntários, centenas de livros (em quatro línguas diferentes) e aulas intrigantes. Seremos capazes de apoiar as escolas e as comunidades com instalações de biblioteca, sessões de contação de histórias, os clubes do livro, poesia, leituras encenadas, oficinas de arte e aulas de línguas. Vamos trabalhar junto às escolas para determinar quais livros e atividades são apropriadas. Como nosso ônibus também funcionará como uma sala de aula, poderemos convidar instrutores para conduzir aulas criativas da arte, astronomia  até vários outros assuntos.Vamos colocar um Ônibus Literário aqui
QUEM SOMOS
Somos Lesa, Talita, Katia, Evandro, Millicent and Stacey, alguns dos nomes por trás deste projeto. Alguns de nós vivem no Brasil, no Canadá e nos EUA, mas o que nos une é a nossa crença em como a educação pode transformar e este projeto. Somos educadores, artistas, pais, cuidadores, voluntários e empresários. Coletivamente, temos mais de quinze anos de experiência de ensino e incontáveis experiências de voluntariado em todo o mundo.
Ao fazer uma pesquisa sobre as artes nas escolas brasileiras e desenvolvendo a PJAE, descobrimos que muitos estudantes não estavam recebendo a oportunidade de explorar, as artes em sala de aula, especialmente nas áreas rurais e pobres. Como iriamos encontrar os melhores jovens artistas e escritores, se alguns eram excluídos com base na economia e acesso? Assim, foi necessário encontrar uma solução de inclusão e é isso que este ônibus pretende ser, a primeira de muitas salas de aula e bibliotecas móveis em todo o Brasil, que oferece um espaço que incentiva a leitura, a aprendizagem e partilha nas artes visuais e de linguagem.

O QUE NÓS PRECISAMOS? 
Nós já temos uma boa coleção de livros e equipamentos artisticos para. De modo que só resta o micro-ônibus. Estamos pedindo, pelo menos, $ 4.700 para comprar um velho micro-ônibus, no certificar que ele está em condições de circular (reparado, licenciado e segurado) e transformá-lo em uma divertida biblioteca móvel em sua forma mais simples. Quanto mais você contribuir, melhor o ônibus ficará esteticamente e funcionalmente, por exemplo, se nós levantamos $ 15,750 seremos capazes de instalar itens importantes - como um aparelho de ar condicionado, iluminação, um toldo acoplado(para aulas ao ar livre) feito sob encomenda, cadeiras dobráveis, mesas, um kit de gás natural (GNV) (para que possamos economizar em custos de transporte), painéis solares (para energia), um computador, software da biblioteca, alto-falantes e um projetor. Para conseguir qualquer ou alguns desses extras lembre-se que precisamos para levantar mais do que o nosso objetivo $ 4.700.
O QUE VOCÊ GANHA?
Se você ir para a barra lateral direita há algumas vantagens incríveis esperando por você. camisas, postais, o seu nome no ônibus, até mesmo o seu retrato no ônibus !! Além disso, estamos convidando você ao Rio de Janeiro, para ser voluntário conosco por um dia. Vantagens serão enviadas assim que estejam prontas, para a maioria levaria um ou dois meses a partir do fim da campanha.

$50 Face Estampada - Tenha sua imagem ilustrada como parte da pintura de uma multidão que será colocada no Ônibus Literário(Book Bus). Veja as atualizações de como a ilustração está sendo feita. Receba um cartão colorido com a imagem da pintura final e uma fotografia digital de alta resolução através do e-mail. + Dollar Dreams + Shout Outs! + Postal + Name on It 
Certificado de Colaborador Fundador - Se você escolher qualquer vantagem igual ou superior a $ 75 você obterá um certificado de colaborador fundador. Sim! Não financiador, mas Fundador. O certificado reconhece que você: 1) está ajudando a financiar e está investindo na educação de estudantes em comunidades carentes, e 2) que você acredita neste projeto que está ajudando a criar. Aqui você pode emoldurar o certificado e mostrá-lo ao mundo.
$75 Camisa Exclusiva – Ganhe uma camisa exclusiva dos membros do Book Bus somente disponível aqui, + um Certificado de Colaborador Fundador desse projeto. Depois de recebê-los não se esqueça de tirar fotos com sua camiseta, com o certificado em mãos e postar na página do Facebook. +Realizando Sonhos + Agradecimentos! + Cartão Postal + Seu Nome No Book Bus + Face off
$75 Miniatura do Book Bus – Ganhe uma miniatura de argila feita à mão do Book Bus. Nós enviaremos para você uma miniatura feita por nossos alunos na primeira série de aulas de Arte. Eles terão a chance de fazer duas esculturas do Book Bus um para o próprio aluno e outra para você. Cada aluno artista será fotografado com suas criações escreverá uma pequena nota de agradecimento para você(esses itens serão inclusos no seu pacote enviado). Cada miniatura do Book Bus será cuidadosamente embalada em caixas de papel feito à mão e enviada do Brasil. + Certificado de Colaborador
$100 Na Estrada! – Venha nos visitar e ser voluntário no Book Bus por um dia! Venha em 2016/2017!(Enviaremos os detalhes e ajudaremos você a planejar-se. Apenas saiba que terá que cobrir suas despesas com passagem aérea, transporte, alimentação, estadia etc.) Faremos até um tradicional almoço à brasileira juntos. Gostaria de passar uma semana? Adicione $25 para cada dia adicional. Esta vantagem não estará disponível após a campanha. + Certificado de Colaborador + Realizando Sonhos+ Agradecimentos! + Seu Nome No Book Bus 
$100 Bus Print - Receba um monoprint do Book Bus. Um monoprint é uma impressão única de uma imagem feita a partir de um bloco impresso por pressão. Cada impressão será uma obra de arte original sobre papel de fina arte, assinada pelo artista. Tamanho: 8.5x11 polegadas. + Certificado de Colaborador + Realizando Sonhos+ Agradecimentos! + Seu Nome No Book Bus 
$200 Realize Workshops! – Venha nos visitar e organize um workshop! Nós ofereceremos tradutor e ajudaremos com o planejamento do workshop. Venha em 2016/2017(Enviaremos os detalhes e ajudaremos você a planejar-se. Apenas saiba que terá que cobrir suas despesas com passagem aérea, transporte, alimentação, estadia etc.) Gostaria de passar uma semana? Adicione $25 para cada dia adicional. + Certificado de Colaborador + Realizando Sonhos+ Agradecimentos! + Seu Nome No Book Bus 
$325 Receba tudo! - Realizando Sonhos+Agradecimentos! +Cartão Postal + Seu Nome No Book Bus + Face off + T-CERT + Road Trip +Bus Print + teeny mini bus Sculpture = Você recebe tudo! Basta ler as vantagens acima mencionadas para obter detalhes. Se você optar por obter suas recompensas pessoalmente, será ótimo! Quando você vier, elas estarão aqui. Se você optar para que elas sejam enviadas para você adicione apenas US $ 10 a sua contribuição.
$500 Book Bus movimentado – Tenha seu Logo em nosso Book Bus! É simples assim! E mais, enviaremos uma figura em alta resolução e todos os clipes de reportagem de TV onde o seu Logo apareça.
$1,000 Book Bus das estrelas! – Tenha seu Logo no Book Bus e mais receba seu certificado de patrocinador pessoalmente no Brasil, você poderá ministrar um workshop para a comunidade de alunos, iremos fotografar tudo para uso na mídia, em nosso site ou em páginas de sites de mídia social.
Todas as recompensas, assim que estiverem prontas, na maioria dos casos levará um mês ou dois a partir do final da campanha. O envio não está incluso, entretanto dependendo do item o custo de ver ir de $1 a $10. Por favor, veja cada vantagem para detalhes.

RISCOS E DESAFIOS
Este é um projeto maravilhoso com metas alcançáveis. Nós já temos alguns veículos em mente para escolher, nós contatamos uma empresa bem conhecida que se especializa em conversões e eles gentilmente nos incluirão no processo e no cronograma projetado. Estamos planejando 6 meses a partir do final da campanha para o lançamento. Claro que, se formos capazes de lançar antes o faremos definitivamente. Para garantir a longevidade do Projeto ônibus literário vamos procurar por patrocínio e realizar oficinas pagas para compensar nossas despesas.
Seu apoio - seja por doação ou de boca em boca - pode ajudar este projeto a atingir seu pleno potencial.
Então, vamos lá!
Obrigado.

story:
I have been accepted and will be attending a host University in Florence Italy in the winter ( January 7- March 19, 2016).  In my studies I will be examining how the  African diaspora shows up in different parts of the world. I am reaching out to all family & friends to help me raise 3000.00 towards my abroad expenses. These expenses include, transportation, room & board, books  & campus materials. 

Thank you

story:
Our campaign is: to help the vibrant youth of Children's Garden Home Orphanage and School to make the most of their lives. 

Many of the children at the home have had violent and abuse filled pasts. Some of them have lost one or both of their parents. The founder of the orphanage, Moses Ndungu, is in the process of seeking out therapists and counselor for the children to confide in.

"I have been here for 7 years from 2004. My home was in Rwanda and my parents died in the Rwanda genocide when I was very young. I lived with my grandmother until she passed away. My aunt brought me to Nairobi, Kenya to get an education but I when I got here, I was made to do household chores, to cook and clean. One day, I was told to leave the house and not to return. I walked out and met Mr Marcellus, the manager of Children's Garden Home. I asked him where can an abandoned child go to for help and he brought me here. I'm so happy to have many brothers and sisters here in the home and to have an education. I want to be a nurse after I finish school so that I can take care of suffering children. I also want to come back to help the young ones just like I was helped. I will bring them clothes and food and teach them too." 

-Stella Nirere, 18 year old


Meet Regina, a vibrant and active seven year old girl that calls the Children's Garden Home orphanage and school her home. Regina comes from a two family home and is fortunate to have both of her parents alive. She was taken from her home by a Kenyan child services officer when her neighbors heard her screaming. Why was she screaming, you ask? Her father would regularly beat Regina and her elder brother and torture them by putting itch-inducing plants on their skin for his own enjoyment. Regina and her brother now live at The Children's Garden Home and are grateful to live in a peaceful and productive environment.

We know that the children at the home deserve everything we can give them. With your contribution, we can make life better for the children at the home through improving standards of education and infrastructure.



We appreciate your help, and we know that together, we truly can #sparktheglobe
For more information you can check out our social media or contact us through email:
Facebook: The Global Spark Foundation
Instagram: @sparktheglobe
Twitter: @sparktheglobe
Email: theglobalsparkfoundation@gmail.com

story:
What is Water Tanks Kenya

Water Tanks Kenya is a month long project being undertaken by The Three Musketeers Children's Fund in October of 2015 in which I will be travelling to Kenya in order to carry out the installation of water tanks and rain water harvesting for local communities.

  • 17 Million people in Kenya don't have access to safe water.
  • Over 10,000 children die every year from diarrhoea caused by unsafe water and poor sanitation in Kenya.


Project Outline (2 Phases)

1) Refurbishment of 20 concrete 55,000L tanks in the Mwingi area north of Nairobi.

Each of the tanks are attached to schools in the area and all have either developed leaks over time and also had the roof plumbing fall into disrepair and so are no longer collecting water from the roofs.

We have purchased and shipped Polyethylene liners to be fitted into these tanks http://www.heritagetanks.com.au/premium-residential-water-tanks/liners/ there are also protective pads to be installed on the base of the tanks prior to lining which will give 20 years of operational use from the tanks once re-commissioned.

Total installed capacity will be 20 x 55,000L all of which will be available for children at the school location in a region where walking up to 30 KM a day for 20-80L of water is not unusual. The job of collecting water is commonly assigned to the children and how can they be at school if they are humping water.


2) Installation of 3 complete round sectional steel tanks.

The Three Musketeers have purchased and shipped three complete round sectional steel tanks  http://www.heritagetanks.com.au/premium-residential-water-tanks/

Two will be installed at Medical Clinics run by Doctors Worldwide Kenya and the other will be installed attached to a church in a Masai Community on the edge of the Rift Valley. Each tank is 100,000L and the two installs at the clinics will provide clean water for the patients and the tanks will have a life span of a minimum of 20years.

The clinics are in Malindi (north of Mombasa) and one is out by Lake Victoria in the west of Kenya.

The tank to be installed in the Rift valley will provide a community with a water source for small scale irrigation of a plot of land next to the church where the water will be harvested from.

The church is the biggest building in the area and the roof area provides us with sufficient capacity to fill the tank. We have irrigation piping and pumps so that water can be delivered to an area approx. an acre to grow vegetables for the community.


How You Can Help

We have successfully funded the purchase of the tanks and have shipped them to Kenya.

We still however need a small amount more to cover the transport costs within Kenya of the tanks and associated installation equipment.

  • If we do not reach our funding goal all collected funds will still go towards the installation costs.
  • If we exceed our funding goal all collected funds will be used towards the cost of purchasing further tanks.

Some people can't contribute financially and we fully understand that but you can still help by:

  • Following The Three Musketeers on Facebook 
  • Sharing this project on your social media accounts.

We will regularly update our social media accounts to keep people updated on the installation progress!

Thank you in advance to everyone who supports this project. You have no idea of the difference this will make to a single person, their family and community.


Who are 'The Three Musketeers Children's Fund'

The Three Musketeers Children's Fund has been set up by Brian and Maria O’Shea to honour the memory of their beloved children, Søren, Saoirse and Connor who died tragically on the 16th of July 2013 in a car crash in Denmark.

The fund’s aim is to support projects run by already established organizations with a view to improving health, education, safety and education for children in countries where no other alternatives are available to them. All organizations we work with and support have to be charitable by law.

Website: http://3Musketeers.net.au

Facebook: https://facebook.com/3Musketeerskids

We still however need a small amount more to cover the transport costs within Kenya of the tanks and associated installation equipment.

If we do not reach our funding goal all collected funds will still go towards the installation costs.
If we exceed our funding goal all collected funds will be used towards the cost of purchasing further tanks.

  


Some people can't contribute financially and we fully understand that but you can still help by:

Following The Three Musketeers on Facebook 
Sharing this project on your social media accounts.



We will regularly update our social media accounts to keep people updated on the installation progress!
Thank you in advance to everyone who supports this project. You have no
 idea of the difference this will make to a single person, their 
family and community.

Who are 'The Three Musketeers Children's Fund'

The Three Musketeers Children's Fund has been set up by Brian and Maria O’Shea to honour the memory of their beloved children, Søren, Saoirse and Connor who died tragically on the 16th of July 2013 in a car crash in Denmark.
The fund’s aim is to support projects run by already established 
organizations with a view to improving health, education, safety and 
education for children in countries where no other alternatives are 
available to them. All organizations we work with and support have to be
 charitable by law.
Website: http://3Musketeers.net.au
Facebook: https://facebook.com/3Musketeerskids

story:
What if... there was a trusted and direct way for you to help children in Haiti?

For over 15 years, the What If? Foundation and its Haitian partner, Na Rive, have effectively and compassionately provided food and educational opportunities to some of Haiti’s most vulnerable children. The key to our success is two‐fold:

1) Haitian‐led, community‐based programs combined with a shared vision grounded in mutual respect, trust, and the belief that taking small steps at a grassroots level is essential to lasting change, and

2) Generous donors who know that their dollars actually reach the children through these programs, directly impacting their lives.

Through political and economic instability, multiple hurricanes, and the earthquake in 2010, the courage and determination of our partner Na Rive, combined with the support of our donors, have brought relief and hope to thousands of children who have endured much suffering.

And now, we are so close to completing construction on a desperately needed neighborhood school that will bring quality education to impoverished children and positively impact the entire community.

We have raised the majority of the total costs of construction (approximately $700,000). But we do not have complete funds for the final payment, which will be due late this Fall. This is why we are reaching out to you.


Please help us reach our campaign goal of $30,000 to ensure that this life-changing project is successfully completed.

Why a school:

  • Our partners have told us that education is critical to changing the cycle of poverty in the Ti Plas Kazo community.  
  • Building a neighborhood school has been a part of our shared vision for over a decade.
  • Haiti’s public school system accommodates very few children (only 10% of the schools in Haiti are public) and most families in Ti Plas Kazo cannot afford the tuition required to send their children to “private” school.

The school’s multiple uses:

The school building includes six large classrooms, as well as a kitchen/cafeteria, and community space. The vision for this space is:

  • To provide quality education emphasizing strong academics, entrepreneurial skills, and leadership development.
  • To house the current food program. A daily hot meal will be served to students and other hungry children in the neighborhood. For most, it will be their only meal of the day.
  • To house the current after‐school and summer camp programs, providing a space to teach practical vocational skills that will allow students and other neighborhood children to earn income after graduation–a pressing need expressed by the community.
  • To serve as a positive, safe hub for people of all ages in the community to come together, to learn, and to solve problems.

Status of construction:

  • The construction is almost 75% completed and is on schedule and on budget!
  • The architect, Chuck Newman, of Schools for Children of the World, has designed many schools in developing countries--including 14 in Haiti--and is working with the Port‐ au‐Prince based construction company to reach their goal of completing the school’s construction by the end of the year.
  • The majority of the construction crew has been hired from the local Ti Plas Kazo neighborhood.  This is a huge benefit for the community, as the majority of Haitians (almost 70%) are not formally employed.

Mesi Anpil (“Thank you so much" in Creole) for your support!

                                    

Thank you for helping us bring this long held dream to reality. We are truly grateful for donations of any size. Every dollar has an impact and brings us closer to our $30,000 goal.

Please help us spread the word about this campaign by forwarding a link to this campaign (http://igg.me/at/BTDHaiti) to your family and friends.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

To learn more about this school building project and how What If has helped thousands of children in Haiti, please visit www.whatiffoundation.org.  

To learn more about the success of our food program, in particular, watch the following PBS NewsHour story: http://www.pbs.org/newshour/bb/weather-jan-june10-haiti_05-18/.

story:
Families fleeing war zones arrive in large numbers every day in Greece having lost everything, the lucky ones have a tiny backpack with them. These refugees have long journeys ahead to northern Europe, usually walking for miles and standing for hours on the frontiers. They even have to sleep at night out in the open.  Keeping as dry as possible is not only a comfort but can also be a matter of life or death.  On compassionate grounds we need to alleviate their immediate suffering as much as possible, whatever our own particular opinion is about giving these people permanent refuge in Europe.

I have just come back from delivering clothes and medicines, donated by friends here in France, to a refugee center in Greece (see photo).  I was wondering how I could continue to contribute in a useful way from my home in France. The violent rains the day I left Greece and the distressing photos of refugees in the rain helped me decide !  I have since been in touch with volunteers and the mayor on Leros, a small island close to Turkey, where very many refugees are arriving all the time.  My suggestion to supply lightweight rain-ponchos for adults/rain jackets for the kids was greeted with enthusiasm as these could not only be of immediate use but could be taken on the long journeys northwards.

So please help me raise money to be able to buy as many cheap but solid ponchos  as possible. Remember, it's just the price of one Greek salad needed to protect one adult or child from the rain !  I will be sending the clothes to a volunteer group working on the island to distribute and I will be financing the sending of some immediately. 

Together we can ease the life of some people who have lost everything. Please donate as generously as you are able, and please pass on this message to as many friends as possible. This is urgent !

     (All money raised will be used for ponchos and kids macs)

story:
Isa 46: 9 Remember the former things of old: for I am God, and there is none else; I am God, and there is none like me,  10 Declaring the end from the beginning, and from ancient times the things that are not yet done, saying, My counsel shall stand, and I will do all my pleasure:

Moshe and Rivkah are your team on the ground in Israel.  

Moshe brings you Bible Prophecy and ties current events to Israel Bible Prophecy  that touch the world and Israel as they can be related to the bible.  He delivers to you understanding to the prophetic scriptures.  He explains the understanding of the signs in the heavens also known as the Mazzaroth.

Rivkah's heart is for the foundation of the faith once contended for by the Jewish Apostles and early believers (Jude 1:3)   Many people who would know YHVH and His Messiah have had the truth of YHVHs Gospels locked away from them. They follow erroneous men's doctrine rather than YHVH.  She brings out the Torah, the Torah principles, and the Feasts of YHVH in the New Testament from where they are often over looked.  "Behold here is the Lamb of God who came to take away Torah" is not the Gospel. Restoring the Old Testament and the New Testament as a seamless continuous story; from cover to cover as a single story.

May YHVH prosper you in spirit and body you as you give as unto HIM.  

Moshe & Rivkah


P.S. This time we used a not so serious photo of the two of us.  I hope you enjoy seeing it as much as we were having fun!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Lama Obeid and I am an English teacher from Palestine. I have been planning on opening a school in Palestine to provide quality education for students from difficult socio-economic backgrounds for the past few years. I finally want to put this plan into action and aim on having the school fully functioning by the beginning of 2017. The school will begin as a primary school also including preschool and KG, further on, I am planning on expanding it, so that we can accompany our students until they reach high school, so that we can provide guidance and counselling for the next step of their lives. This school will be based in the West Bank. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our main current goals are getting the Palestine School of Hope registered as a non-profit organization in Palestine, and developing a curriculum suitable for both emotional and cognitive needs of the students. The funds we receive will be used to obtain a school building ensuring all health and safety requirements, school materials and technology requirements, basic school supplies and a uniform for each student, and pay stipends to volunteer teachers to cover basic living costs.
There will be recognition throughout the school to those who have contributed through the various perks available to appreciate your contribution and thoughtfulness. I would also like to thank those who have contributed generously within the past couple of days and shared the fundraiser. 


The Impact

Education is a hope for a better future that children from difficult socio-economic and political backgrounds rarely get. These children deserve the same education that the children of the elite receive.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help this campaign by sharing and spreading the word! Please use the hashtag #PalestineSchoolofHope . You can also help by designing a logo for the school, launching a website, social media sites or anything else you may think of! I would like to thank all those who have volunteered by offering their services such as translation and business advice!  In the near future we will need volunteers to help set up the school and prepare it for students, so that will range from preparing learning materials to painting classrooms.

story:
Short Summary

Miskitu villages are under siege. Drug traffickers, invaders, and Colonos, under government  protection and orders, have managed to run the Miskitu villagers out of their homes in the mountains to the polluted Wasban River where they are dying from drinking parasite infested waters.  People are dying from severe dysentery, vomiting and starvation. Once a thriving fishing community, the people have no source of protein from the once abundant river. The fish no longer thrive in these contaminated waters caused by drilling, mining, and deforestation. The lethal impact of greed and corruption have left the Miskitu people without even a means to plant the simplest of grains.  The ecosystem has been robbed of it's vivacity yielding it a wasteland and mass graveyard. Foreign companies are  reaping from the land and waters. 
The Miskitu People are characterized by their communal nature, varied languages, and love for nature and education. The nation once spanned the entire coast of Central America but has since been diminished to just a strip of land along the Nicaraguan and Honduran coasts. The Miskitu citizens are becoming sick from the dirty water infested with parasites and lack of food, not to mention the immense violence they face. What is left is a group of very vulnerable people who just want to be respected and want to live among everyone in peace.  However, these attributes are being compromised by militant external operatives. 
What We Need & What You Get

What You Get?:

  • You get to see your money at work, we will keep you up to date with the progress!
  • Helping rebuild a once vibrant community and make the world aware of the Miskitu people and the land. We want to help them to help themselves once again
  • Local goods unique to Miskitu people such as recipes, jewlery, toys, music, etc. A people rich in culture have so much they want to share with the world!
  • Professional photos, book from Miskitu political refugee, Josephine Robertson, download and/or tickets to premier of documentary, and invitations to future dinners and fundraisers. 

We need at least 15,000 dollars, to buy:

  • Clean water, emergency water kits, water tanks to collect rain
  • Sanitary/ Health products such as tampons, toilet paper, etc
  • Dried and non perishable foods and vitamins
  • Books, pencils, shoes for the children

The Impact

Our campaign is to assist an ancient civilization about which very few people know about. Yet even in their present, starved and sickly, they find joy and continue to persevere. The need is URGENT. 

Children and the elderly are most vulnerable to hunger, the parasite infested water (causing dysentary) that once was abundant with fish, they are forbidden to utilize their own land (home to hundreds of fruit trees, vegetables, and other beneficial plants and fauna) by the national government. 

Before the next trip back to the Miskitu Coast, it is imperative that the people of the world join and help us. We have a team working tirelessly who managed to document their struggle and deliver 25,000 pounds of food and supplies (which has since been commandeered by the government). The Miskitu people are open to change and want to share their wealthy land but ethically. The Miskitu Nation is an autonomous nation but not treated as such - their land has been ransacked by foreign companies and local governments. Violence has put the Miskitu in a very vulnerable situation. 

Rather than saying and wearing relics from the past of nations that were exterminated and remembered, we can live among them and learn from them. 

The Miskitu people do not have a problem trading, exchanging/selling their riches, for education and finance. The only demand they have and will die for is that others show respect for the earth and their life. 

Risks & Challenges

The risk is that the national government has unleashed the troops on the humanitarian effort. A 20 foot container of food and supplies has since been detained by the Department of Health and Agriculture in Managua, Nicaragua (the Pacific side, Miskito land is on the Atlantic side).   It's been there since August 11th 2015 and only a small fraction of the 25,000 lbs of goods has made to the people. 

To combat this, goods will be bought in Nicaragua and sorrounding countries and taken DIRECTLY to the people.

As of early September, in the towns of Santa Clara and Esperanza, the  Miskitu Territory is being routinely sneak attacked by vigilantes, Colonos. In addition to imposing the strict laws of not allowing them to utilize their own land. During the most recent trip down there,the Colonos came into town and took anything they deemed dangerous (forks, knives, machetes used for cutting coconuts) in danger of the Miskitu rising up.  


Other Ways You Can Help

The needs are obvious. The Miskitu are facing starvation, disease, and personal affronts and terror. Funds are needed to bring these people the most basic necessities of life. It is through the generous support of donors like you to maintain and improve services. This caring support is essential and timely. Charitable contributions are the only way to assure the Miskitu people are not left to struggle alone. Won't you please give generously?
You can also educate yourself on The Miskitu people, spread the word, come to our events (in the SF Bay Area). Research and speak up about indigenous rights! We are all one people after all. Have a blessed day and much love!

story:
Update:

Thanks everybody for supporting us, we will contact everybody that purchased a perk personally per email! 

What if there was a school where you weren't judged on your ability to sit still and wait for your turn? But instead you were encouraged to take responsibility and action? What if there was a place that helped you find your true dream instead of force-feeding you a set of old ideas inherited from a world that no longer fits our needs? 


What if there was place that helps you create a business or organization based on true sustainability and innovation for people who want more than money or status. This place already exists and it is called Knowmads Business School. We need your help  for our school to flourish. Allow us to explain why. We believe our fast evolving world calls for a new kind of education. This requires change.

At Knowmads students don’t have to choose a standard program and take standardized tests. We support our students in finding their passion and provide them with the mindset and tools to bring their passion to the world.  For five years Knowmads Business School has  created an environment which has supported over 80 international students in their quest to discover themselves, their own way of learning and their dreams.



We believe in responsible entrepreneurship, personal leadership and social innovation. We believe the best ideas spring forth from a human mind
unburdened by fear, status or shortage. We believe in people.

Knowmads is for

Dreamers, visionaries, those who imagine a whole different reality.

Changemakers, troublemakers, passionate to make a difference.

Warriors, fighters, those who stand their ground.

The insecure and wavering as well.

The artists who are just discovering their talents and want to move something with it.

But also for

Clowns, fools and misfits.

Hosts, the facilitators.

And finally the gardeners, with lots of care, love and passion for the little things.


The current tribe 11 consists of wide variety of students from all over the world. We have artists, clowns, changemakers and troublemakers. After their year at Knowmads, students embark on a wide variety of career paths. Some start their own business, others find their path within an existing organization. Knowmads creates vibrant people, facilitators, visual harvesters, design thinkers, crazy creatives and spatial and behavior professionals. Below in the Graduates section you will find some real-life examples of the individuals and businesses that have emerged out of Knowmads

How is life after Knowmads?


- Meaningful Meetings - 

An organization which aims to help bring clarity into the 

meetings of businesses
and organizations. Neža, Tribe 5, founded Meaningful meetings in 2013
 in response to being bored of so many useless meetings and a desire
to contribute to creating working environments where honesty,
effectiveness, and enjoying your work can coexist.
 www.meaningful-meetings.com


- Follow your passion -

Duy, from Tribe 4, followed his passion and has become a highly sought after photographer and videographer (check our awesome promo video:D!!). "During my year at Knowmads I learned how to stand up again after I fell down. I gained the confidence to bring something into
 the world with all my love and passion. Photography is for me a way
to share my perception of beauty."
 www.vudinh.nl


- Logic Locks - 

Elles from Tribe 9 started an highly rated Escaperoom in Amsterdam
hosting groups of people who must find their way out of a locked room
by solving 63 puzzles in the room.
www.logiclocks.com



does a Knowmad build their year?

With care, connection, creativity, playful exploration, chaos and slowing down, students share and build their stories. They discover their entrepreneurial selves and gain confidence in who they are, enabling their ability to bring change to their environment. Knowmads Business School is a place where ‘the promise of learning for life,’ is actually kept.

Our program is based on action learning within a tribe setting.Our tribes are groups of international students that start and end their program together. The school created a basic frameof tools and workshops for tribe 11 comprised of essential knowledge for leading social businesses in the 21st century.


After the first period of getting to know each other and learning about the different passions and qualities of the students, it is now time to co-create the rest of the program. Together with staff and external trainers students will choose the specific methods and tools they want to learn.


Over the past half year, students have had workshops about: Deep Democracy, Non-Violent Communication, Project-Management, Visual Harvesting, Aberkyn Leadership Journey, and Storytelling.


These workshop where an amazing journey about how working together with people in businesses is also possible. But it was not enough. Let us explain below why we need your help.



What we need your money for:

We want to organize and get more workshops/lectures, hosted by experienced professionals. First,to deepen the knowledge we have gained so far and expand it to get the knowledge we need for our projects.

-

 Secondly, to also provide open workshops for you and all other professionals who want to learn in a Knowmadic way. If you want to know more about the workshops that are organized for externals by students see the Knowmads Experience project and our free WTF lectures (the goal of these lectures is to turn your world upside down; look at your neighbour and say: What the F**k??)

-

Thirdly, at this moment the students and volunteers are running. organizing and financing the school. We need a paid day-to-day manager to guide the students in their process and facilitate events and workshops. So students have more time and energy to focus on their learnings and projects.

-

What will you get for your contribution?

When you give to Knowmads you will become part of the higher education revolution! And you can also select some awesome perks that will help you tell others about what we are doing so they can join us too. Listed below you will see all the amazing perks.


ADDITIONAL WAYS YOU CAN HELP

  • Share this campaign with other people that care about the re-invention of education and are interested in a more human-centered education.

  • We are on Facebook and Twitter. Find us there. Follow us. Like us. Invite your friends to do it too.

Support our students, support our mission to make a difference.
Support the educational revolution.Support Knowmads Business School.


if you´re interested in one of the perks, please contact us via jelle@knowmads.nl.

Always yours Knowmads!
story_txt:
Update:Thanks everybody for supporting us, we will contact everybody that purchased a perk personally per email! What if there was a school where you weren't judged on your ability to sit still and wait for your turn? But instead you were encouraged to take responsibility and action? What if there was a place that helped you find your true dream instead of force-feeding you a set of old ideas inherited from a world that no longer fits our needs? What if there was place that helps you create a business or organization based on true sustainability and innovation for people who want more than money or status. This place already exists and it is called Knowmads Business School. We need your help  for our school to flourish. Allow us to explain why. We believe our fast evolving world calls for a new kind of education. This requires change.At Knowmads students don’t have to choose a standard program and take standardized tests. We support our students in finding their passion and provide them with the mindset and tools to bring their passion to the world.  For five years Knowmads Business School has  created an environment which has supported over 80 international students in their quest to discover themselves, their own way of learning and their dreams.We believe in responsible entrepreneurship, personal leadership and social innovation. We believe the best ideas spring forth from a human mind unburdened by fear, status or shortage. We believe in people.Knowmads is forDreamers, visionaries, those who imagine a whole different reality.Changemakers, troublemakers, passionate to make a difference.Warriors, fighters, those who stand their ground.The insecure and wavering as well.The artists who are just discovering their talents and want to move something with it.But also forClowns, fools and misfits.Hosts, the facilitators.And finally the gardeners, with lots of care, love and passion for the little things.The current tribe 11 consists of wide variety of students from all over the world. We have artists, clowns, changemakers and troublemakers. After their year at Knowmads, students embark on a wide variety of career paths. Some start their own business, others find their path within an existing organization. Knowmads creates vibrant people, facilitators, visual harvesters, design thinkers, crazy creatives and spatial and behavior professionals. Below in the Graduates section you will find some real-life examples of the individuals and businesses that have emerged out of Knowmads






How is life after Knowmads?

- Meaningful Meetings - 
An organization which aims to help bring clarity into the meetings of businesses and organizations. Neža, Tribe 5, founded Meaningful meetings in 2013 in response to being bored of so many useless meetings and a desire to contribute to creating working environments where honesty, effectiveness, and enjoying your work can coexist. www.meaningful-meetings.com




- Follow your passion -




Duy, from Tribe 4, followed his passion and has become a highly sought after photographer and videographer (check our awesome promo video:D!!). "During my year at Knowmads I learned how to stand up again after I fell down. I gained the confidence to bring something into the world with all my love and passion. Photography is for me a way to share my perception of beauty." www.vudinh.nl














- Logic Locks - 

Elles from Tribe 9 started an highly rated Escaperoom in Amsterdam hosting groups of people who must find their way out of a locked room by solving 63 puzzles in the room.www.logiclocks.com

story:
Ons verhaal

In de zomer van 2014 kwamen wij samen met mama op het idee om kinderen te helpen in Cambodja die als slaven worden verkocht om seks te hebben met mannen of vrouwen.Vaak verkopen hun ouders ze, of worden ze ontvoerd.  Veel kinderen worden gered uit deze verschrikkelijke situaties door onder andere de Amerikaanse organisatie, Agape International Missions. Die meeste kinderen die worden gered  zijn  meisjes. Kinderen worden zelfs al wel op 2 jarige leeftijd verkocht.
De kinderen die zijn gered uit deze situaties moeten natuurlijk herstellen en dat kost een heleboel geld. En dat is juist de reden waarom wij geld hebben verzameld. 
We zijn toen begonnen met geld te verzamelen door loom armbandjes te maken en te verkopen (dat was toen helemaal in de rage).  We hebben op 1 dag wel 50 euro opgehaald en in totaal hebben we daar 150 euro mee opgehaald. We hebben dit geld na verdubbeling van onze ouders per bank verzonden naar de organisatie. 
We hebben meerdere leuke acties verzonnen om opnieuw geld op te halen; we gingen bijvoorbeeld lege flessen ophalen en hebben daar 20 euro mee opgehaald.
 Vervolgens hebben we  smootie's gemaakt en verkocht voor 1,00 euro per stuk en daar haalden we 30,00 mee op. Ook hebben we nog broodjes knakworst verkocht. Veel mensen vonden het zo leuk dat we dit deden en gaven meestal iets meer geld voor het goede doel.  We hebben in totaal opnieuw 150 euro opgehaald die onze ouders hebben verdubbeld. 
We zijn zo dankbaar dat wij in vrijheid kunnen leven! Daarom willen we nog meer geld ophalen namens deze fantastische organisatie. We houden geen enkele cent voor onszelf, en zullen alles geven aan deze te gekke kinderredders!

vragen

ga naar de mail Cambodia.gd@gmail.com

Ik Evie ben 11 jaar en woon in Nederland, Ik Eden ben 10 jaar en woon ook in Nederland. We zijn zussen en zijn zeer blij dat we andere meisjes kunnen helpen en kunnen delen in hetgeen we hebben opgehaald.

 English Translation:

Our Story

In the summer of 2014 we and our mom came to the idea of helping children in Cambodia. And especially children who were previously forced to have sex with men or women in order to supply for the financial needs of their parents. A lot of the children are actually getting saved by a great American organisation. And we have decided to financially support that organisation performing such an amazing job. 

Most of the children that fall victim to these practises are girls. After they are set free, they need our support to recover from the trauma that they have faced, and that requires a lot of money. 

We first came up with the idea to create loom bracelets that we have made and have sold. We were able to collect about 150,- euro in 2 weeks. We have collected empty bottles worth 0.25 cent per bottle gaining 20 euro in total. Additionally we came up with the idea to create smoothies and sell them for 1,- per piece, allowing a total profit of 30,- euro. Our last fundraise activity was selling bread roll sausage. In total we have gained another 150,- euro with all the efforts we put into it. 

The summer is over, and we would like to ask you to help us donate too. We are not asking much! Out of our gratitude of being able to live freely and in peace we want to continue to support this great work of saving and taking care of children who deserve the same free life. 

Our parents doubled the amount we fundraised. Will you help us maybe even quadruple that amount and help more girls in need?

Question? Email us @ cambodia.gd@gmail.com
My name is Evie and I am 11 years old, I am from the Netherlands. I am Eden and I am 10 years old.
We are sisters and very happy to be able to help girls who are less lucky then us.

story:
What would the world look like if we awakened our youth?


WHO WE ARE & OUR SHARED VISION

We're out to Re-Design Education. The current system is broken and that broken system has been trying to fix itself for decades.

We're utterly bored of waiting for an Education Revolution, so we figured we'd put our money where our complaints are and revolutionize the potential of youth development.

By removing the arguing administrations, the policies, the controlling unions, the broken pieces and allowing the passion of educating youth to flourish to the top again, we are #Ed[U]Hacking learning and we're doing it with leaders just like you.

We've been trying to fix this scenario inside the broken system for decades, taking the exploration and development phase outside that disaster zone is key to innovative new model development.

We are business leaders, teachers, parents and students who are re-designing learning through a novel model of learning called [U] Labs.

We're "Uber-i-fying" education. Exposing youth to a diverse and ever growing set of labs that entice them through their interests and then sneak in core skills. Ya, we're sneaky like that.

The purpose of this campaign is to invite you to get dirty with us,  to co-create  possibilities in educating our youth into a thriving generation of purposeful, passionate legends.

ULABS:   PASSION, TALENT, PURPOSE

How many of us struggled with what we wanted to be when we grew up? How many of us are in jobs we hate?

Imagine if we refocused our time on this planet with passion, talent and purpose?

Imagine if we stopped underestimating the potential of youth and actually gave them the opportunities they need to develop who they are?

Imagine if we re-invented education outside the system?

Imagine learning being so much fun, you aren't aware you’re being taught?

[U] Labs is a diversity of developmental labs that offer experiential scenarios that cultivate real world skills by enabling youth to navigate who they are, discover and sculpt their innate, "unique to them" talents and begin to create a happy, purposeful and successful life. Our ultimate goal is to provide youth with the opportunities to discover what thrills them, build skills and find themselves in careers that they love waking up to. People ecstatic to go to work? Mind blowing, we know.

[U]Labs not only provides youth with the ability to discover who they are, what matters to them and what their gifts are,  we help them "do", we help them "execute" by offering funds to youth for their projects and ideas of purpose and connecting them to mentors if needed.

Youth will finally be able to not only discover who they are but try their hand at all sorts of talents, industries and skills: graphic design, marketing, coding, fashion, cooking, start ups, finance and more with core personal development skills interwoven into their learning. Youth will get to explore this NOW, not in their twenties after they've forked out cash for higher education.


UPCOMING EVENTS

We are unleashing the [U]Labs potential upon Canadian rebels, change makers and leaders. We are hosting our first Youth Development event in Canada Nov 14 & 15th at CJ SkateBoard Park and School.  More info can be found here.

We are also galvanizing people to join our Think Tank in Toronto, where we will be re-inventing education outside the broken system with business leaders, teachers, parents and students. The date for this event will be released shortly after completion of campaign and will be held on either Saturday or Sunday in the GTA.


We are coming to city near you. The amount of requests we have coming in is ASTOUNDING. Do let us know where you want us!

HOW YOU CAN HELP

By joining us, you will help radically change the future.

CONTRIBUTE

Funds contributed will specifically empower the #Ed[U]Hack movement by generating funds available to youth projects and ideas, supporting our Think Tank Event and empowering the diversity of [U] Labs offerings. 

SPREAD THE WORD

Use the hashtag in your social media, #Ed[U]Hack and join the conversation - how would you hack learning? Lay it on us, we can hack it;)

COME SHAKE SOME SHIZZLE UP WITH US!!
