story:
Let's work together to bring Generation Citizen's Action Civics programming to a neighborhood of new schools in Boston this fall!

With $7,500, Generation Citizen can:

  • Cover the full costs of 3 student-led action projects--helping 3 student groups in one neighborhood tackle 3 pressing neighborhood issues.
  • Provide a life-changing Action Civics experience to 75 Boston middle and high school students, enabling them to develop the skills and knowledge to be lifelong active citizens motivated to lead change in their communities.
Read below to learn more about Generation Citizen and its work in Boston.

Generation Citizen empowers youth to lead change in their communities.

  • Generation Citizen offers an innovative "Action Civics" educational program in local schools.
  •  In our classes, led by trained college volunteers known as "Democracy Coaches," classroom teachers and middle and high school students take real action on issues impacting their communities and neighborhoods.
  • First, students choose a local issue they care about. Past projects have included gang violence, public transit, and teen jobs.
  • Next, Generation Citizen students learn to take effective community action. Students analyze the root causes of the issues they’ve chosen, set specific goals for affecting those issues, identify discrete influencers who can aid them in their efforts to create change, and employ a variety of tactics to achieve their goals. In the past, our students' efforts have included meeting with legislators about specific bills, writing opinion articles, and hosting coalition meetings.
  • Generation Citizen’s curriculum is academically rigorous and aligns to district and Common Core standards.  Generation Citizen classrooms emphasize work with underserved low-income and minority populations.

Generation Citizen is reviving the American democracy through young people.

  • Of 172 democracies around the world, the US ranks 139th in voter participation. We are combating this trend by educating youth about the many ways they can not only participate in their democracy, but also effect change in their local communities!
  • Through our Action Civics educational approach,  young people gain the skills, knowledge, and motivation to become involved with important issues in their communities.
  • We teach our students that their voices matter, and we encourage them to take charge by becoming leaders of a new American democracy in which citizens engage actively and collaborate to solve problems.

    Generation Citizen is already changing Boston communities.

    • A classroom of Boston 10th graders took action on waste, collaborating with their city council to introduce single-stream recycling across all of Boston Public Schools.
    • A 9th grade classroom saved school music programs in Massachusetts by working with state legislators to avoid severe budget cuts.
    • A group of 8th graders addressed high school dropout rates by helping to pass a bill that provided more services to at-risk students.

    Don’t talk about change. Lead it.
    • Elizabeth Warren’s keynote address to students at Generation Citizen’s Civics Day noted that: “By participating in Generation Citizen, [students] had a chance to learn about government and public service in a hands-on way and a chance to make a real difference in [their] communities.”
    • De'Anthony Robinson, a Generation Citizen alum, describes how the program taught him the power of advocacy: “I never understood that my problems and the problems of friends really mattered to the rest of society. I just assumed that nobody cared. Working with Generation Citizen has helped me recognize that I not only could, but SHOULD be an active and engaged citizen. When I met with Senator Jehlen, she made me realize that I have power in my voice. I could express my own ideas about the struggles I have witnessed and experienced. I learned that my voice will be heard and my opinion matters to people in power.”
    • Anthony Mendez, a Generation Citizen alum, experienced the inspiration of Action Civics: “All my life I just dreamed of changing the world. I never realized how possible that can be. . . . I have never felt so confident that anybody can make a difference regardless of age or race. I went from knowing nothing at all about politics to realizing that I want to be an activist, and knowing that with Generation Citizen my journey is just beginning."
    • Richard Chang, a former Democracy Coach, explains Generation Citizen’s value to students: “Students developed their sense of citizenship and of communicating with government. Through GC, our students visited the State House (for most of them, their first visit), and GC offered them their first opportunity to be involved in a community issue. They drafted letters to school administrators and Boston school district officials; they sent emails and made phone calls. This not only supported our curricular goals for civics but also provide authentic and genuine opportunities for students to develop their communication and literacy skills. The GC curriculum helped our students with critical thinking, teamwork, and efficacy.”
    • Colin Murphy, former Democracy Coach and current Chair of the Boston Associate Board: “Based on my experience, I see youth civic engagement as the most organic means for long-term social change. Young people, so often discounted, have the best ideas and the most energy. And more importantly, they have the most at stake. To work with them on a daily basis, creating a healthier democracy and better society, is inspiring.”

story:
About Us

Organize 2020 is the social justice caucus of the NC Association of Educators. Formed in response to ongoing right-wing attacks on public education, we recognize the need to build grassroots, democratic power focused on the needs of students and community first.

We are engaged in a statewide strategy to defend and transform public education, activating and training educators and parents across NC to address systemic racism and poverty not just in schools, but in our society as a whole.

In a right-to-work state, we have successfully fought off terrible teacher contracts, engaged in numerous solidarity actions with the Moral Monday movement, allied with the Fight for $15, and grown our internal membership through a series of Dismantling Racism trainings. Our fight is unique; we are building a teachers union in the South rooted in our communities. 

We Need Your Help
This membership and fundraising campaign will significantly help us amplify our message.

We know $20,000 is a lot of money. But the reality is that corporations and the politicians in their back pockets are spending millions to dismantle public education. The money we raise will help us to:

  • Expand our infrastructure and grow our membership through a series of seven regional trainings across the state of NC through 2016

  • Pay a part-time grassroots organizer 

  • Fund more Dismantling Racism trainings for educators


The Cold Reality

We're not going to lie. This is a tough fight. North Carolina is at the epicenter of corporate political influence and a huge part of our opponents' strategy is to destroy unions and dismantle public education for private profit.

We relish a challenge.
But also...we're winning.  

As tough as this fight is, our growing resistance has already caused big problems for our opponents. We started the "Decline 2 Sign" campaign to turn down awful teacher contracts that went viral and sent politicians packing. We are turning up the heat with our each one, teach one work ethic and have steadily kept public education as a front and center issue in North Carolina.

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course we want you to contribute. Every bit counts. But we would also love for you to share this campaign. If you would be so kind as to post this link to Facebook and Twitter, say a good word about us and share through email, and contact us if you are in NC and would like to host an in-person event.

story:
Phase 2 of the campaign: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/books-to-ken...


Can be seen at: www.edexam.org

For two years, Beatrice Mbai, a Redd School teacher (in Houston, Texas), originally from Kenya, has been doing small book drives for the small village of Nduriri, in central Kenya where her grandfather and father grew up.  

It is an extremely impoverished area. Children walk miles to school, often without shoes or food for lunch.  The two schools (about 600 students) in the area are barely funded by the government so the families must pay tuition, and buy uniforms. Most families barely make it. Books are a luxury, even at school, so we started out just trying to help  Beatrice by hosting a book drive. 

Redd school has done many giving things over the years. This year alone they have run two food drives, a campaign for Toys for Tots and donated some books to a poor school in Houston. Because Beatrice is a teacher there and everyone knows her, the kids were touched and motivated to help make a difference.
"Books are being donated by students and their families and from the "archives of gently used text books" at Redd School.  The students have embraced this drive with a vigor I haven't seen in years.  I think it's partly because they have a familiar face to associate with the cause." said Ellen LeBlanc, Redd School Administrator.

"Our students are learning geography, economics, government and a host of other unplanned lessons and because the children are engaged, it is truly a win-win."

Since the book drive began, we've added another element.  There is a definite need for teacher training.  We are planning to send a team of teachers to this small village to help their teachers learn some of the current and standard teaching practices.  Many of the teachers are not trained or have a teaching degree.  We can change that!

Your donations will help us ship the books, establish a library and send a team of teachers to this village to work with their teachers.  This work will have a life-time effect on the future of these families in Kenya, and will open up the world and the minds of our students. Let's invest in educational opportunities so that these kids can learn to help themselves. 

A great teacher can change the world.

Let's help them change their world!!


Everyone can do something. If you can't donate today, please help spread the word. Use the Indiegogo share tools to send out this link to your friends and everyone you know on face book and twitter to let them know you care. 

Thanks,

Will LeBlanc

Educational Excellence In America

story:
Hi!

We are secondary 4 students at Collège Sainte-Anne in Lachine in the DéfiMonde program. During our final year of high school (January 2016) we will be travelling to Atenas, Costa Rica to volounteer in an orphanage. The main focus of our project is to spread good health habits to the children of the community. Our project is divided into 3 subgroups: sports, dental hygiene and nutrition. Since the children of Atenas enjoy playing soccer, we will be collecting and donating used soccer shorts and jerseys. We will then organize soccer games in hopes that the children benefit from the exercise of playing soccer and experience being part of a sports team, which we often take for granted. We will also be bringing tooth brushes and tooth paste to the orphanage and to families in Atenas to teach them how to maintain good oral hygiene. Last but not least, we will teach the children the basics of good nutrition.

How to help us out: 

Our project would not be possible without your help! with that being said, we accept anything you have to offer! The money we raise will help us ship the dental hygiene supplies as well as the second hand soccer uniforms to Costa Rica. Every penny means so much to us! If you are looking to put your child’s old soccer uniforms to good use, we would highly appreciate your donation. Please feel free to contact us or visit our website for more information on ways to help!



Bonjour! 

Nous sommes trois étudiantes de 16 ans qui, dans le cadre du programme DéfiMonde au Collège Sainte-Anne de Lachine, avons décidé d'aider les enfants d'une communauté éloignée du Costa Rica, Atenas. Nous visiterons des orphelinats et des centres d'enfants de la rue, notamment «Hogarcito de Palmares», afin de guider les enfants en manque de figures parentales vers une vie heureuse en santé.

Notre projet se divise en trois aspects; le sport, l'hygiène dentaire et la nutrition. De ce qui est du sport, nous amènerons des uniformes  usagés de soccer, leur sport préféré selon notre contact,  afin d'organiser des parties et des tournois au sein de la communauté. Pour l'hygiène dentaire, ayant suivi une formation d'une dentiste, nous offrirons des ateliers dans les orphelinats et multiples centres qui porteront sur la façon de bien brosser les dents et passer la soie dentaire. Faisant équipe avec Oral-B, nous  amènerons aussi  énormément de brosses à dents et de pâtes à dents pour ensuite les fournir à la communauté d'Atenas. De ce qui est ensuite de la nutrition, ayant aussi suivi une formation d'une nutritionniste, nous offrirons des cours sur la bonne alimentation, adaptés aux enfants costa ricains. 

Pour nous aider:

Notre projet sera malheureusement impossible si nous ne pouvons pas envoyer les uniformes de soccer usagés et les brosses à dents et pâtes à dents. Nous amassons donc des dons monétaires afin d'expédier tout le matériel dont les enfants d'orphelinats et de centres d'enfants de la rue bénéficieraient énormément.  Vous avez des uniformes de soccer usagés qui traînent? Visitez notre site web pour savoir comment procéder aux dons. Soyez généreux!

story:
Short Summary

Bullying is a massive problem in ALL schools world-wide. At least 1 out of every 2 kids is bullied at school. And the impact can be devastating - socially, emotionally, low self-esteem, poor academic performance, and even suicide. In fact, the latest research has even shown that bullying at school is worse for kids than being abused at home, in terms of depression and committing self-harm. And studies show that the damage due to bullying is long-term.

My husband Gavin and I have seen first-hand the effects of bullying on both of our two young kids. We’ve also seen how ineffective the traditional solutions have been – from useless posters and rubber bands creating awareness, to SMS lines that don’t achieve results. And the biggest problem is that most bullying goes unreported. Face-to-face conversations are difficult and embarrassing, and kids are afraid the bully, their friends or other kids will find out that they’ve told an adult. And on top of that, they don't know how that adult will react.

So we’ve created BeatingBullies, a technology solution that works. It enables kids to report and discuss bullying anonymously with authority figures at their school (such as the principal or school counsellor), to upload evidence such as pictures or videos to support their claim, and to get the issues resolved.

We need your help to put a stop to the global bullying epidemic, to give as many kids as possible the opportunity to live without the stress of a bully ruining their lives. 


What We Have Done

When we came up with the BeatingBullies concept, there were lots of unanswered questions: 

  1. Would kids use it?
  2. Would kids abuse the anonymity? (by making up stories about other kids to get them in trouble)
  3. Would the authority figures (principal or school counsellor) engage with the kids?
  4. And most importantly, would stuff get resolved?


So we ran a pilot project at our kids’ school for over a year, and the results were fantastic. It turns that kids did use it, not one kid abused it (and it would be pretty easy to identify this if it happened anyway), the authority figures engaged really well with the kids, and issues did get resolved. So we’ve proved that it works, and it works well. The challenge now is to scale the solution and get as many kids using it as possible.

Here are some screenshots of the BeatingBullies tool:




As Dr. Phil says in the CBS video below: "So often we see these kids become isolated, withdrawn, they stop going to school, and they can even, as we have seen so tragically with situations like Phoebe Prince, wind up actually taking their lives. This is a terrible burden on these kids and we've got to give the educators the tools they need to prevent this, to intervene in this."



What We Need and What You Get

We need your help to achieve our goal of putting a dent in the global epidemic of bullying. We’re going to use your funds for 4 purposes:

  1. To create awareness of the value that our solution provides, and to get our solution helping as many kids in as many schools world-wide as possible;
  2. To complete the mobile app, which complements our existing web-based application;
  3. To hire a full-time child psychologist, who will provide ongoing advice to principals and counsellors using the system, and who will engage with kids at schools where the principal or school counsellor doesn’t feel comfortable engaging with the kids themselves;
  4. To roll out the BeatingBullies solution in as many under-privileged schools as possible, where affordability might otherwise be a problem.

We’ve got a range of perks on offer, so please choose the one that speaks to you the most (or contribute whatever amount you’re comfortable with). 

If your own kid is being bullied, you can choose a perk which gives him or her (and you) access to the BeatingBullies solution, or alternatively you can give access to the whole school.

If you were bullied in the past, and you know the effect it had on you, you can choose a perk which prevents other kids from having to go through the same pain that you went through.

If you’d like to give access to the solution to under-privileged kids and schools that otherwise wouldn’t be able to afford it – and who might need it even more than others – there is a perk for you.

And finally, if your business would like to have a meaningful impact on kids and schools in your community – and get feel-good marketing at the same time – then there is a perk for you.

And even if it’s just a simply note of support and encouragement that we’re doing something meaningful, we’d really appreciate it!

Other Ways You Can Help

We’d love you to be part of the journey to a bully-free future for all schoolkids world-wide. If you can take one of the perks on offer (or contribute any amount you'd like), that would be awesome – your contribution will go a long way. And if you can’t, then we’d appreciate all the help we can get in spreading the word about our solution and our Indiegogo campaign (please use the Indiegogo share tools if you do).

Thanks for making a difference!

PS If you'd like to get in touch, you can email me on colette@beatingbullies.com
story_txt:
Short Summary 
Bullying is a massive problem in ALL schools world-wide. At least 1 out of every 2 kids is bullied at school. And the impact can be devastating - socially,
emotionally, low self-esteem, poor academic performance, and even suicide. In
fact, the latest research has even shown that bullying at school is worse for
kids than being abused at home, in terms of depression and committing self-harm.
And studies show that the damage due to bullying is long-term.
My husband Gavin and I have seen first-hand the effects of bullying on
both of our two young kids. We’ve also seen how ineffective the traditional
solutions have been – from useless posters and rubber bands creating awareness,
to SMS lines that don’t achieve results. And the biggest problem is that most bullying
goes unreported. Face-to-face conversations are difficult and embarrassing, and
kids are afraid the bully, their friends or other kids will find out that
they’ve told an adult. And on top of that, they don't know how that
adult will react.
So we’ve created BeatingBullies, a technology solution that works. It
enables kids to report and discuss bullying anonymously with authority figures at their school (such as the principal or school counsellor), to
upload evidence such as pictures or videos to support their claim, and to get
the issues resolved. 
We need your help to put a
stop to the global bullying epidemic, to give as many kids as possible the
opportunity to live without the stress of a bully ruining their lives.

When we came up with the BeatingBullies concept, there were lots of
unanswered questions:

to get them in trouble)

mobile app, which complements our existing web-based application;

child psychologist, who will provide ongoing advice to principals and

kids themselves;

BeatingBullies solution in as many under-privileged schools as possible, where

And finally, if your business would

get feel-good marketing at the same time – then there is a perk for you. 

And even if it’s just a
simply note of support and encouragement that we’re doing something meaningful,
we’d really appreciate it! 
    Other Ways You Can Help 



We’d love you to be part of the journey to a
bully-free future for all schoolkids world-wide. If you can take one of the

– your contribution will go a long way. And if you can’t, then we’d

story:
Project Summary

The schools water project is aimed at providing clean water access to children in rural communities across Africa. We believe that every child deserves the right to have access to clean water supply. As C&J Accounting, we are offering professional project management. We have over 40 years operational experience in Africa and  we decided to come up with a solution to help rural children have access to clean water. 

It involves the drilling of boreholes that can supply water all year round, installation of solar panels, tank stand and in addition to that a hectare of drip irrigation equipment, so that the children can as well get a good diet from produce harvested from the school garden.

 We could not let our children continue to die of water borne diseases as well as a malnutrition, we then decided to offer a solution to that by introducing the schools water project. The project has so far benefited over 5 000 children in the schools that we have done.

What We Need & What You Get

The schools project is aiming to raise USD 500 000. This money will benefit a minimum of 65 000 children per year. This means with your help we have provided a lifetime solution of clean water access and provision of a stable diet to children and generations to come.

The funds will be used for 30 rural schools and each school getting the following:

  • Borehole to supply water all year round
  • Solar Panels and Water pumps
  • 10 000 Litre water tank and stand
  • Drip Irrigation Equipment for 1 hectare
  • Seed and fertiliser for the first crop
By donating to this project we have a range of benefits for you from newsletter updates, personalised thank you notes and videos from children, a personalised tweet to a trip to one of the Schools in Africa.

The Impact

The project is going to ensure a minimum of 65 000 children have access to clean water in rural communities across Africa. Your donation means that you have significantly contributed to the reduction of deaths resulting from water borne diseases amongst children.

Not only will this provide clean water access but it provides a solution to food security in rural communities and globally. We are also equipping the children with knowledge on the modern ways of agriculture which can be adopted by the communities. Additional benefits from the project include the fact that we will be providing employment to women and youth from the local rural communities as they will work on the school plot as the children learn.

Risks & Challenges

The major risk is that of having a dry hole when drilling a borehole. The risk has been mitigated by working hand in hand with reputable water diviners, and we have so far recorded a 100% success rate in the pilot projects we have already done.

The major challenge is accessibility of the schools due to poor road network but the partners have proven their willingness to make this make this project a success and have drilled borehole in the most remote parts of Africa.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help the project by donating, sharing to others, liking on Facebook, following on Twitter and liking on YouTube.  Please help in any way you can. Thank you.

story:
Lesen Sie mehr über das Projekt auf Deutsch weiter unten auf dieser Seite!


The project provides art education for 260 children and adolescens, from poor economical and social background, in the Education Center Tarrafal, run by Delta Cultura, a local NGO since 2004. 

Two artists, Ulli Seidel and Alejandro García will lead the daily art programmes and at the same time train an adolescent to continue the art education after the end of their stay. 
The programm will run from September 2015 until August 2016 and will guarantee that the art education will become a permanent part of the programmes of the Center.


We will use your help to ...

  • Give art education to 260 children during one year.
  • Organize an exhibition with the children’s work in the Tarrafal and other parts of the island.
  • Provide the Center’s employees with further education about creation as an      educational method.
  • Train a local to be the future art teacher starting from 2016.
  • To provide the children with all the necessary materials. 
  • Support the artists so they can stay until August 2016

16.900 USD total costs mean 61 USD per child, means 260 donators ...

However, we are thankful for all contributions, no matter how small.




Read more about the art education


The art for education project provides art as a way to improve self-awareness and environmental consciousness. It puts the focus on the promotion of the children's potentials as a key to a free and self-determined life and as creation as a way of gaining and expressing knowledge. 

We use arts for the stimulation of all the senses and thus a sensible and intellectual experience.

We understand creation as a way of expressing out thoughts and feeling and the opportunity to speak in pictures.

    The three main features that will be developed in the art education - curiosity, the ability of percipience and creativity - will build the base for the wide range of social, practical and theoretical skills the children will need in their future lives as free, independent persons. The children will learn to:

    • detect problems and find alternative solutions
    • think in an independent and alternative way
    • perceive their environment & themselves
    • work on their own and in groups


      Information about Cape Verde 


    Cape Verde or Capeverdean Islands are 15 islands on the west coast of Africa. They are  independent from Portugal since 1975.

    Cape Verde and the population suffer from many different problems:

    • lack of mineral resources
    • bad agricultural conditions and therefore more than 90% of its products imported
    • one of the world's highest emigration rates (brain drain)
    • rising living costs
    • very high youth unemployment
    • increasing division between the rich and the poor
    • growing rate of criminality

    Improving education by art and more is a promising way to help the children to a better future.


    Read more about the Arts for education in Cape Verde project on www.deltacultura.org and www.auladearte.wordpress.com


    Kunst für Bildung

    Das Projekt bietet künstlerische Erziehung im Bildungszentrum Tarrafal, für rund 260 Kinder und Jugendliche aus schwachen finanziellen und sozialen Verhältnissen, an. Das Zentrum wird seit 2004 von Delta Cultura betrieben.   
    Zwei Künstler, Ulli Seidel und Alejandro García Rosado werden die täglichen Programme leiten und einen Jugendlichen ausbilden der die künstlerische Erziehung nach dem Ende ihres Aufenthaltes weiterführen wird.
    Der Kunstunterricht wird von September 2015 bis August 2016 stattfinden und wird garantieren, dass die künstlerische Erziehung ein permanenter Teil der Bildungsprogramme des Zentrums wird.



    Was gelingt mit eurer Hilfe

    • 260 Kinder bekommen ein Jahr lang künstlerische Erziehung 
    • eine Ausstellung mit den Arbeiten der Kinder in Tarrafal oder einem anderen Orten der Insel Santiago wird stattfinden. 
    • die Betreuerinnen und Betreuer des Zentrums werden zum Thema “Kunst als Bildungsmethode” weitergebildet. 
    • eine Person aus Tarrafal wird zum Kunstlehrer ab 2016 ausgebildet
    • die beiden Künstler werden unterstützt, damit sie bis August 2016 bleiben können

    16900 USD bedeuten 61 USD pro Kind, bedeuten 260 Spender…

    Wir sind dankbar für alle Beiträge, egal wie klein oder gross.



    Mehr über die künstlerische Erziehung


    Kunst für Bildung verwendet Kunst als eine Möglichkeit, die Selbstwahrnehmung und das Umweltbewusstsein der Kinder zu verbessern. Es setzt auf potenzialfördernde Bildung als Schlüssel zu einem freieren und selbstbestimmteren Leben, sowie auf Kreation als Methode zum Wissenserwerb und zum Ausdruck von Wissen.

    Wir nutzen die Kunst um alle Sinne anzuregen und damit Lernen zu einer sensiblen und intellektuellen Erfahrung wird.

    Wir verstehen die Kreation als eine Möglichkeit Gedanken und Gefühle auszudrücken und als Möglichkeit, in Bildern zu sprechen.

    Die drei Haupteigenschaften, die in der künstlerischen Erziehung entwickelt werden – Neugierde, Wahrnehmungsfähigkeit und Kreativität – werden die Basis für eine Fülle an sozialen, praktischen und theoretischen Fähigkeiten sein, die die Kinder in ihrem Leben als freie, unabhängige Personen benötigen werden.

    Die Kinder werden lernen:

    • Probleme zu entdecken und alternative Lösungen zu ersinnen
    • alternativ und frei zu denken
    • sich selber und ihre Umwelt wahrzunehmen
    • selbstständig und in der Gruppe zu arbeiten


    Information über die Kapverden


    Kapverde oder die Kapverdischen Inseln sind 15 Inseln an der Westküste Afrikas. Sie sind seit 1975 unabhängig von Portugal.

    Kapverde und ihre Einwohner haben mit vielen verschiedenen Problemen zu kämpfen:

    • Das Fehlen an Bodenschäzen und schlechte Bedingung für Landwirtschaft verursachen eine Importrate von 90% aller Produkte
    • Eine der höchsten Emigrationsraten der Welt (brain drain)
    •  Steigende Lebenskosten
    • Sehr hohe Jugendarbeitslosigkeit
    • Immer weiter auseinanderklaffende Schere zwischen Reich und Arm
    • Steigende Kriminalitätsrate

    Bildung durch Kunst zu verbessern, ist ein vielversprechender Weg, den Kindern zu einer besseren Zukunft zu verhelfen.


    Lest mehr über Kunst für Bildung in Cape Verde auf www.deltacultura.org und www.auladearte.wordpress.com

story:
Why are we doing this?


Have you ever wanted to get started with Free and Open Source Software but couldn't find clear easy to follow documentation to get you started?  The end goal of the project is to create easy to follow videos and documentation that will be freely available to the community to help get you started with Free and Open Source Software.


Many Free and Open Source tools are fantastic tools but have a lack of easily accessible materials to help get people started with them.  We plan to try to help correct this by primarily producing video content that users will be able to use to help get them started in using these tools.  The videos will be released under a Creative Commons license to allow the community to use them widely.


Examples of what we will cover.


We hope to cover many topics that will be of interest to a new user but some of our initial plans for releases will be.

  • Installing Linux inside of VirtualBox
  • Howto update a Linux System
  • Howto install new software
  • Removing software
  • Command Line system updates
  • Command Line software installiation


Who are we?


We are a group of long-time Linux and Open Source users who have benefited from the Free Software movement and want to give back to the community. With your help we can make this happen. To learn more about us, see http://openfosstraining.com/team/


What is needed for this project? 


For this we will need a hardware and software such as a high-powered workstation and audio/video capture and processing equipment, as well as web hosting fees. All of the money we raise will go supporting this project, and none of it will go to any of us as individuals. 


The Impact


The impact we hope to have with these video's is to help improve access to these tools through education.  Also to help improve documentation primarily via video content.  This is a educational project to help show people who need the most help in getting started with different projects.  If we can improve the access to educational material people need to use these tools then we can help improve the experience for everyone.


Release Plan


There will be a combination of how-to videos and documentation that will be released. Videos will be released via YouTube and other video sharing platforms so that people can watch them from anywhere but they will also be made available from the website planned to go along with this project in several formats.  Also they will be made available via Archive.org.  Documentation will be released on the openfosstraining.com website.  All Video's and Documentation will be released under free licences so that people can share them freely and so that they can be used in any manner that people see fit. We have not fully settled on a license for this and would like your feedback on which license(s) would be the best choice.



Other Ways You Can Help


If you can't donate financially to this project one thing you can do to help is to help spread the word.  Word of mouth is key in  projects like this to get the word out far enough so that we they can reach our goal. Posting about this in your social media accounts such as Twitter, Facebook, and Google+ is always appreciated.


Also, suggestions of content to cover is another way you can help!  Send in your thoughts on areas that you believe could benefit from this educational series.  We welcome any and all suggestions that will make this project successful.

Examples of what we will cover.

We hope to cover many topics that will be of interest to a new user but some of our initial plans for releases will be.


Installing Linux inside of VirtualBox
Howto update a Linux System
Howto install new software
Removing software
Command Line system updates
Command Line software installiation


Who are we?

We are a group of long-time Linux and Open Source users who have benefited from the Free Software movement and want to give back to the community. With your help we can make this happen. To learn more about us, see http://openfosstraining.com/team/

What is needed for this project? 

For this we will need a hardware and software such as a high-powered workstation and audio/video capture and processing equipment, as well as web hosting fees. All of the money we raise will go supporting this project, and none of it will go to any of us as individuals. 

The Impact

The impact we hope to have with these video's is to help improve access to these tools through education.  Also to help improve documentation primarily via video content.  This is a educational project to help show people who need the most help in getting started with different projects.  If we can improve the access to educational material people need to use these tools then we can help improve the experience for everyone.

Release Plan

There will be a combination of how-to videos and documentation that will be released. Videos will be released via YouTube and other video sharing platforms so that people can watch them from anywhere but they will also be made available from the website planned to go along with this project in several formats.  Also they will be made available via Archive.org.  Documentation will be released on the openfosstraining.com website.  All Video's and Documentation will be released under free licences so that people can share them freely and so that they can be used in any manner that people see fit. We have not fully settled on a license for this and would like your feedback on which license(s) would be the best choice.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate financially to this project one thing you can do to help is to help spread the word.  Word of mouth is key in  projects like this to get the word out far enough so that we they can reach our goal. Posting about this in your social media accounts such as Twitter, Facebook, and Google+ is always appreciated.

Also, suggestions of content to cover is another way you can help!  Send in your thoughts on areas that you believe could benefit from this educational series.  We welcome any and all suggestions that will make this project successful.

story:
What's FIRST Robotics? What will the fund go towards?

We are FRC Team 1711 from Central High school. We are involved in FIRST (For Inspiration and Recognition of Science and Technology) and compete in an annual challenge in which we must design and build a robot that completes a game. You can learn more about FIRST and the championship event here.

This year, we qualified for the Michigan State Championship. For the first time ever, we WON. And also for the first time ever, we qualified for the world competition.

But our challenges do not end there. We now need YOUR support to help us get there!

What We Need, and Why We Need It

We need at least $5000 dollars to get to St. Louis for Championships.  We are renting a charter bus to travel which will cost us thousands of dollars. The team will also have to pay for food. Our goal is to make this trip completely free for all team members so that everyone has the financial ability to attend. 

If we do not reach our goal, we may only be able to send a few team members. This is to be avoided at all costs, since everyone had a role in our victory. We should be able to borrow enough money for the trip, but we will need campaign money to replenish our program's funds so that we can continue our outreach and compete next year. 

If by some miracle we exceed our goal and funding for the event, additional money will go towards funding next years' robot and our numerous outreach programs. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want us to receive the full donation without Indiegogo taking a cut, please donate to

Newton's road, C/O Bill Myers, 1513 N. Orchard Drive, Traverse City MI 49686

Spread the word!


About the Team and STEAM

Why do we inspire STEAM in students and in our community?

Just as steam powers a locomotive, STEAM drives us to empower our school and community.

Science is critical to our broad understanding of tasks and goals. We find Technology companies in our community and our mentors help us apply the newest technology to our projects. Engineering is at the heart of all we do. From designing a robot or building our pit area to making a sign for a local festival, we approach every project as an engineering design challenge. Our media, public relations, and outreach rely on Art. We are proud to have talented student writers and artists who are a critical part of our team. Mathematics lies behind everything. It is the means by which we create a well-oiled team. We don’t stop at building. We use calculus to calculate stress on a support truss and to measure a vector on a logo design.

Through STEAM we positively influence our team members and those around them to do pursue great things. 

As part of FIRST, the RAPTORS offer an experience that goes above and beyond other high school activities. Our FIRST program to includes all kinds of learning, from CAD design to public relations. By teaching lifelong skills like how to creatively solve a problem, work within deadlines, and work together to mutually achieve a goal, we develop well-rounded world-ready individuals. Our team is structured to promote Gracious Professionalism and Coopertition as well as to inspire students to take leadership and responsibility. Even though we are a ‘robotics team’, our goal is to inspire students to do great things. The robot is the robots though: for ten years now we have been instilling the drive to serve our school and community in our members. By participating in countless volunteering events and advancing awareness for engineering in our community, our team has turned into a community presence. This team is about what you learn, not what you win. We are the varsity sport of the mind, and always put teamwork over competition. Our team is built on the foundation of putting others first, creating a community of world-ready people.

story:
Approximately three hours from the center of Kathmandu, is the Himalayan district of Sindhupalchowk and Lalitpur, the death toll from Saturday's 7.8 magnitude earthquake has exceeded that of the capital. 


Let's ride together to raise money to re-build homes

We are raising funds by coming together as bikers across the city and country to re-build lost homes for people distraught across our border.  We can make a difference - simply by doing it together!


BUMSONTHESADDLE requests bikers, family and friends to donate a minimum of $10 towards the fundraising. You are welcome to donate as much as you can to the cause. We are joining hands with NYEF to help with the rehabilitation of a villages in the various district of Nepal. Identification of where rehabilitation is required most is underway.  Rehabilitation takes immense planning, effort and months on end to complete to bring back normalcy for people who have lost families and homes.

Please share this link with your loved ones as well and get them to join in on our collective effort.

What we need

We are aiming to raise USD 15,000 so we can contribute towards 

  • Re-building houses in the effected areas of Nepal including villages of Sindhupalchowk and Lalitpur districts
  • Each house takes 2 lakh rupees to build - a village in Sindhupalchowk alone has 1000 houses to build ground up. At the moment 4 houses are standing up after the Earthquake.


We have a direct point of contact in Nepal

 Abhinav Churiwal is a friend and native of Nepal working extensively on ground with his team and many other's who are reaching out to remote areas. Abhinav is a member of Nepalese Young Entrepreneurs’ Forum (NYEF). After studying and working abroad, he has returned to Nepal to become an entrepreneur. Abhinav is a Certified Public Accountant (CPA). He graduated from Shri Ram College of Commerce, Delhi University with a Bachelor’s degree in Commerce. 

NYEF is a membership based non-profit organization, established by the Federation of Nepalese Chamber of Commerce and Industries (FNCCI) on September 26, 2003 with a vision of empowering positive business thinking. It is an apex body of Young Entrepreneurs in Nepal. It aims at creating outstanding entrepreneurs through idea exchange, fellowships, education, training and advocacy among the Nepali youth.

More information can be found on http://www.nyef.org.np

Transparency

Over the next few weeks and months Abhinav will update us with the ongoing rehabilitation work and the usage of funds we raise. Our aim is to be transparent in the deployment of 100% of funds collected. He will provide regular updates on how our contribution is being utilized on the ground in the effected districts towards rehabilitation work

We are reaching out to you to ask for your support after the devastating earthquake in Nepal that has killed thousands of people. Rehabiliation work in underway and from what we hear it's going to take months if not years to re-build Nepal. Every penny we raise goes towards making this a tiny bit easier for the poeple in Nepal. Let's ride and raise money, because together we can.

story:
Short Summary

Mosaic Therapy was started in 2011 by Chicago Public School counselor and special education teacher, Veronica Vyazovsky,who saw a need for quality, affordable and multiculturally competent mental health services for Chicago's diverse communities. 
  • Since 2011 Mosaic Therapy has served over 1000 clients who speak at least 10 different languages, providing close to 10,000 hrs of clinical therapy services. 
  • In 2014, Mosaic Therapy became a 501c3 organization and also became qualified to provide professional development services for occupational therapists, teachers, counselors and social workers.

What We Need

  • Your donations pay for a Master's level therapist to work with kids one-to-one in local Chicago schools and provide much needed mental health support 
  • Our swag rocks! check out our creative prizes such as bubbles, DIY therapy kits and free online counseling sessions
  • Every $$$ counts
  • $50 = 1 hr of therapy, so every dollar received will be use to provide therapy to kids and families in our school based programs. 

What makes our treatment philosophy unique?

  • We believe that culture and language are very important. We strive to serve clients in their native language and understand their cultural perspective from the very first session.

  • We believe in teaching families and school staff about what we do and including them in the therapeutic process in order to increase long term success of our clients.

Since 2011 Mosaic Therapy has served over 1000 clients who speak at least 10 different languages, providing close to 10,000 hrs of clinical therapy services. 


In 2014, Mosaic Therapy became a 501c3 organization and also became qualified to provide professional development services for occupational therapists, teachers, counselors and social workers.


   What We Need  Your donations pay for a Master's level therapist to work with kids one-to-one in local Chicago schools and provide much needed mental health support  Our swag rocks! check out our creative prizes such as bubbles, DIY therapy kits and free online counseling sessions Every $$$ counts

We believe in teaching families and school staff about what we do and including them in the therapeutic process in order to increase long term success of our clients.

story:
Summary

Six months ago, I received a friend request on Facebook from a man in Uganda, named Senyange Semion. Little did I know, this friend request would end up being much more than that. Semion was already friends with a colleague of mine, Dave Brown, so I asked Dave about their relationship. Known to most as Super Dave, he said that he met Semion on a mission and that he is a school teacher. Being a teacher myself, I soon realized the potential that this connection could hold for my students at Boonville Middle School. 

Semion and I began to communicate on a daily basis by sharing blessings and talking about our daily lives. This friendly exchange developed into much more when we decided to have our students exchange letters. This exchange is on its third round and all of our students are really enjoying it! The friendships and cultural awareness are just a sample of the amazing outcomes for my students.

Following the success of our letter exchanges, Semion and his colleagues decided to change their school name to match ours. They are now called the Boonville Parents School Maanyi (be sure to explore their website at www.maanyiparentsug.org). We now have a special bond between our schools and the students of Boonville Middle School want to help Semion and his students continue their success. 

What We Need & What You Get

Many of Semion's students are orphans and live at the school. Their current need is to build a hostel for their female students (see video for tour of current hostel). They are currently building this hostel but have run out of finances to complete the construction. Semion has expressed that they will need $8000 to finish the construction. A fellow teacher, Beth Farrand, and I have already secured $500 through a grant from GenerationOn and my students raised nearly $300 in the last week of school. One students collected over $100 from her softball teammates!

If the project video is unable to convince you then, perhaps Semion himself will personally share with you the impact this hostel will have for his students. I would be glad to put anyone in touch with him. He has promised to send updates of the construction and has already sent photos of the progress they have made with our recent $800 donation. 

If we do not reach our goal, we will still donate all money raised to help with the construction of the girl's hostel. On the other hand, if we are able to raise more money than our goal, I would like to put that towards a trip that will bring Semion to visit our school in November. We are already preparing arrangements for this journey and I believe it would be a nice surprise for this great man. 

Perks for our donors are as follows: 

  • $1 donation will receive email updates with pictures and video to show progress of the construction of the girl's hostel.
  • $25 donation will receive a "thank you" email from Semion. 
  • $50 donation will receive a "thank you" letter from Semion. 
  • $100 donation will receive email updates and a personalized "shout out" in a thank you video. 
  • $500 donation will receive email updates and a "school applause" from the entire school along with your "shout out." See the campaign video for example. 
  • $1000 donation will receive email updates and a personalized video from the Boonville Parents School Maanyi. 

Risks & Challenges

There are no risks to this campaign. My students already raised $800 and we have sent that money safely to Semion. The campaign photo album has pictures of the materials invoice and progress resulting from this donation. The work was done immediately and evidence of their progress was returned promptly. 

Any money raised in this campaign, no matter the amount, will help this school build a girl's hostel. The school is worried about potential storm damage to the already completed portions if the construction is not completed soon. 

The best way to make an impact is to raise this money as soon as possible and help them finish the construction and avoid further setbacks.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our campaign with friends and family. Getting the word out is just as important as your donation. Thanks for your interest in our campaign and any support you are able to give!

story:
Making Waves Winnipeg

Making Waves Winnipeg, founded in 2011, is a charitable organization that provides affordable one-on-one swimming instruction to children with special needs. 

Ten of our private swimming lessons cost $20. Here's why: 

Disabled children are at high risk of drowning - it's the second most common cause of injury-related death in children, with disabled children being ten times more likely to drown. Families supporting a child with special needs are more likely to be living in poverty.  Group-structured swimming lessons, while financially accessible for many families, do not allow children with special needs to get the attention they need to swim to the best of their ability. Private swimming lessons, while giving these children the attention they need, are not financially accessible for many families. 

Children who are most in need of private swimming lessons face many financial barriers to obtaining that swimming instruction. 

This is why we're making waves. 

Financial Information

So where does your money go? 

Making Waves is primarily a volunteer-run organization. We're students who believe in making a difference in our community and we need your help.  

Your donation will go towards pool rentals and swimming equipment to provide the best lessons we possibly can. Our swimmers sometimes require adapted equipment so that they can all perform to the best of their ability - this equipment will be covered by your generous donations. 

We are also running a two-week summer camp this August! This will allow 62 children to have a one-on-one camp experience. Our incredible summer staff are ready to create the best possible camp that we can, while still maintaining our goals of accessibility and affordability. Our camp costs $50 for one week, but costs us $550 per child to run. We need the support of donors like you to make this project a reality! 

Our Impact

Making Waves Winnipeg began in 2011 with ten swimmers and ten volunteers. Today, we have over 200 swimmers and 100 volunteers and operate out of three pools in the city of Winnipeg, as well as in the rural communities of Brandon, Dauphin, and Carman. 

Making Waves Winnipeg has made an impact in each swimmer, volunteer, and parent's life. These are some of their comments: 

"Thank you for helping me learn to jump in the pool!" -Sean B.

"I can swim soon!" -Evelyn W.
"Ever since Michael joined the swimming program with Making Waves he is not afraid to shower and get his hair wet. The instructors are so great to him. My wife calls the instructors 'Angels to our kids!'" -Eddie (Michael's Dad)
"Making Waves inspires me to be more inclusive in my everyday life. I love volunteering with Making Waves." -Kendra (Making Waves Volunteer) 

Support Us

If you're not able to donate, you can still help out in the following ways: 

Spread the word! Share our campaign to your friends and family, and in your community. 

Volunteer! If you live in the Winnipeg area, we'd love to have you volunteer with us. Head on over to our website to learn more.

story:
From a young age, I aspired to explore the world and all it had to offer. Now, as a declared Environmental Studies and Economics major at Bucknell University, I have learned not only about the importance of the Earth's natural resources, but the vital need to preserve them, and the natural systems that sustain all life today. As a result of making the Dean's List the past two semesters at Bucknell, I have been selected by the Arcadia Program to study Environmental Sciences and Sustainability Management at one of the top institutions in Australia. It is time to more forward and give back.

I have decided to take this opportunity and enroll at the University of Queensland, in Brisbane. In this subtropical climate, I will have access to various rare ecosystems, including the Great Barrier Reef, the Brisbane River, areas of dense vegetation and extensive mangrove forestry. I will be enrolled in four rigorous courses over the semester, where I will be able to participate in hands-on field work, and apply the skills of sustainability management to conserve these extremely threatened ecosystems.

What do I need?

Through loans, grants, etc., my Bucknell tuition will cover the corresponding tuition costs at the University of Queensland. However, I am responsible for transportation expenses, including: roundtrip airfare, all ground transportation, and any other traveling costs. The Arcadia program requires that I must also cover all other outside expenses while I am in Australia.

I hope to integrate my abroad experience into my plans for the future by obtaining a greater worldly knowledge in Australia, which I can utilize in the future of my professional career in the geographically diverse field of Environmental Studies. Through your generosity, it is possible for students like me to live out their dreams of studying abroad in a foreign country, while at the same time gaining valuable experiences that will help sustain the future of our planet.

Thank you.
story_txt: From a young age, I aspired to explore the world and all it had to offer. Now, as a declared Environmental Studies and Economics major at Bucknell University, I have learned not only about the importance of the Earth's natural resources, but the vital need to preserve them, and the natural systems that sustain all life today. As a result of making the Dean's List the past two semesters at Bucknell, I have been selected by the Arcadia Program to study Environmental Sciences and Sustainability Management at one of the top institutions in Australia. It is time to more forward and give back. I have decided to take this opportunity and enroll at the University of Queensland, in Brisbane. In this subtropical climate, I will have access to various rare ecosystems, including the Great Barrier Reef, the Brisbane River, areas of dense vegetation and extensive mangrove forestry. I will be enrolled in four rigorous courses over the semester, where I will be able to participate in hands-on field work, and apply the skills of sustainability management to conserve these extremely threatened ecosystems. What do I need? Through loans, grants, etc., my Bucknell tuition will cover the corresponding tuition costs at the University of Queensland. However, I am responsible for transportation expenses, including: roundtrip airfare, all ground transportation, and any other traveling costs. The Arcadia program requires that I must also cover all other outside expenses while I am in Australia. I hope to integrate my abroad experience into my plans for the future by obtaining a greater worldly knowledge in Australia, which I can utilize in the future of my professional career in the geographically diverse field of Environmental Studies. Through your generosity, it is possible for students like me to live out their dreams of studying abroad in a foreign country, while at the same time gaining valuable experiences that will help sustain the future of our planet. Thank you.

story:
From an early age I wanted to help improve the world - and I loved technology. After I got my MA in Educational Psychology I started to work on the intersection of education and technology. I saw a future where intelligent computer tutors would personalize education – get us away from the big classroom experience, and provide a more effective learning environment! I built my ideas with two successful education and technology ventures.

Today Knowledge Avatars™ is the evolution of intelligent digital tutors.

Imagine this! What if you could go to a digital tutor and immediately find out what you need to know to solve a problem? What if the tutor helped you build on your previous knowledge, could provide as many examples and interactive experiences as you liked, challenged you with appropriate tasks, and told you exactly where your knowledge gaps are?


We need your help to jumpstart Knowledge Avatars with lots of knowledge. The more knowledge it has, the better it will be at helping students fill those knowledge gaps.


Quality, universal education is a challenge throughout the world. 

Globally, one in five adolescents is excluded from the classroom. Forty-three percent of children, (58 million of 134  million children), will never enter school. 

“Business as usual strategies based on more teachers, more classrooms and more textbooks are not enough to reach the most disadvantaged children,” 

– UNESCO Director-General Irina Bokova


The distribution platform exists to deliver quality, adaptive education! Worldwide internet penetration is at around 40% and growing according to the Worldbank and Internet World Stats.



Internet users (per 100 people)

We have an educational opportunity that is unparalleled in history. The future of education is that students should be able to easily access intelligent content on the Internet and learn what they need to solve problems. 

This is what we will do with your support: 

  1. Create educational content in school concepts where the greatest need exists.
  2. Translate content into other languages for greater accessibility.
  3. Promote Knowledge Avatars™ worldwide.

The amount of content that we develop depends on how much money we raise. We will build it concept by concept until all school subjects are covered.

Funds will be used to pay for content experts, artists, and technology. 


"Your masterly art of striking the right chord  in the learner's mind resonating in deep understanding was  utterly lacking in most of the content produced by multitude of content creators world wide."

Amarjit Singh Rana, Jaipur, India.


Knowledge Avatars is also an online platform where anyone can create and publish their own digital tutor. 

Knowledge Avatars™ can be used today by content experts to create their own Knowledge Avatars.

College professors can use it to create virtual teaching assistants. Teachers can use it to provide their students with homework help. Tutors can use it extend their availability and provide 24/7 tutoring. 


“I’m developing a Knowledge Avatar to help my students by filling in those knowledge gaps that they start my class with. They will be able to go in, see which concepts they need to tackle the next class that I will be teaching,
and review and learn the concepts before class.” 

Kevin Walters (college professor)


“I am building a Knowledge Avatar to show people the best nutritional practices across cultures. Users will be able to see which lifestyles lead to greater longevity.”

Marilyn Jess (dietitian, wellness coach, and public speaker)


You can be a Knowledge Avatar Expert.

Your knowledge is valuable! Go to Knowledge Avatars and register to start creating your own Knowledge Avatar. When you are done you can publish it and share it with the world.

Share

Please share this project with your friends! The larger our community the smarter Knowledge Avatars becomes! Knowledge Avatars’ value increases as we all add our collective knowledge to it!

Thank you for your contribution.

CHECK THE UPDATES TAB FOR MORE EXAMPLES AND INFORMATION!

story:
Love for the sea and sailing boats

My name is Dan Poljsak, I am 18 years old, young captain, constructor and painter, a student of the High School, Electro and Maritime School Piran. I was born into a sailing family, so the sea means life to me and I have sea stories to tell every day.

I have decided to build a wooden sailing boat named Cassiopeia when I was 16. This is the story about the construction process of Cassiopeia, unique 8 m long schooner.  Cassiopeia was a mythological queen of Ethiopia whose outstanding beauty still overwhelms sailors today who observe the northern skies.

I am halfway through the works. Another year is needed to finish the wooden schooner and I can't wait for the day to sail away and discover new horizons.


What I need to finish Cassiopeia?

To continue with works I will have to:

  • buy teak wood to finish the deck,
  • install the motor
  • paint the boat,
  • install 2 masts,
  • make new sails,
  • buy and install onboard equipment.

I am kindly inviting you to help me realize my dream. Even the smallest donations will make a difference. If you feel you cannot contribute financially at this time, sharing this page with others will help spread the word to those who can.


Overall project impacts

Besides construction of the unique wooden schonner other goals will be achieved:

  • active role of young people and experiential education - Cassiopeia will become High School training boat
  • preservation of special skills for the construction of wooden barques
  • contact with nature -energy of the sea, wind and natural materials
  • intra-generational networking, creativity and prosperity

  • promotion and preservation of maritime cultural traditions


THANK YOU

My sincere thanks for your contribution. Let the sea inspire us and connect us into the circle of life nad love.

oil canvas - Dan Poljsak, October 2014
 
More about me

Dan Poljsak, born on 14th February 1997, a student of the High School, Electro and Maritime School Piran, orientation navigation technician

  • sports sailor and multiple-time national champion, member of the Slovenian team in the Optimist class
  • two solo art exhibitions - models, sketches, plans and oil canvases
  • design and construction of the sailing boat called Schkrga at 12 years old
  • maintenance of Schkrga and sailing with the young; teaching young people the basics of maritime skills
  • 1st prize winner at the international art competition Volvo Ocean Race Art Competition for the drawing of the sailing boat of the future
If you have any question please send email to dan.poljsak@gmail.com
http://www.cassiopeia.si

story:
- Censored local advertising campaign against settlement products goes nationwide in Denmark.

---------------------------------------------

- Censureret reklamekampagne mod bosættelsesprodukter går landsdækkende.


We need your help to take this campaign to the next level after Movia, the Danish bus company censored it: A more powerful and this time, not only in Copenhagen, but nationwide campaign on busses and other advertising media. 

For the next phase of the campaign to succeed we need you, the conscious consumer, the conscientious citizen, a person of action. 

Support the campaign financially as an individual citizen, as a family, as a trade union, as a local unit in a political party, or as a company. Even small contributions can make a BIG impact. You can also help out by sharing the campaign and its message where ever it is possible for you to do so. 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Vi har brug for din hjælp, til kampagnens næste skridt efter busselskabet Movia's censur: Den udvidede reklamekampagne på busser og andre reklamemedier. Denne gang ikke bare i København, men over hele landet. 

En forudsætning for, at kampagnen vil lykkes, er støtte fra dig, den bevidste forbruger, den samvittighedsfulde borger, det handlingskraftige menneske. 

Støt kampagnen økonomisk som enkeltperson, som familie, som fagforening, som lokalafdeling i et politisk parti, eller som virksomhed.

Selv små bidrag svarende til 10, 20 eller 50 kroner tæller og kan gøre en STOR forskel. Du kan også støtte kampagnen ved at udbrede den, der hvor du kan.

----------------------------------------------------

Background
Monday the 27th of April 35 bus lines in Copenhagen drove out in the capitals streets with a new advertising whose purpose is to draw attention on the illegality of Israeli settlement products in Denmark, Europe as well as in international context. The campaign urges the consumers to avoid settlement products and it also urges food importers to abide by EU legislation concerning the labelling of settlement products.

Above is the campaign ad where Charlotte & Lizzie from Hellerup (one of the richest suburbs of Copenhagen) say;

“Our conscience is clear! We neither buy products from the Israeli settlements nor do we invest in the settlement industry”

Baggrund
Mandag morgen 27. april kørte 35 københavnske bus linjer ud på københavns gader, med reklamer for en ny kampagne, hvis formål er at gøre opmærksom på ulovligheden af Israelske bosættelser i dansk, i EU såvel som i international sammenhæng. Kampagnen opfordrer således forbrugerne til at undgå bosættelsesprodukter, samt fødevareimportører til at overholdelse EU-lovgivningen vedr. mærking af bosættelsesprodukter.

----------------------------------------------------

Movia shuts down the campaign
After 4 days and around 100 complaints, most of them in english and identical, the Israeli ambassador turning up in person the day of the board meeting and the far rightwing-politician Finn Rudaizkys personal approach to a board member, the board voted, except one member, to stop the campaign immediately starting May 1st this year.

Movia lukker kampagnen ned
Efter 4 dage og omkring 100 klager, langt de fleste på engelsk og enslydende, den Israelske ambassadørs troppen op samme dag som bestyrelsesmødet samt DF-politikeren Finn Rudaizkys personlige henvendelse til et medlem af bestyrelsen, stemte bestyrelsen, på nær et medlem, for at standse kampagnen med øjeblikkelig virkning fra og med 1. maj 2015. 

----------------------------------------------------

The reaction to Movia's censorship 

This has given rise to national and international concern and indignation along with massive media coverage. A protest web page established on Facebook is encouraging people to send Movia their complaints. The campaign is VERY content with all the publicity that money can't buy and the overwhelming support resulting from events. It is about freedom of expression and thus about getting the advertisements back on the busses in Copenhagen where they belong in accordance to the original agreement with Movia.

Reaktion på censuren 

Dette har vakt stor national og international undren og forargelse samt massiv mediedækning.  Der er blevet oprettet en protestside på facebook, der opfordrer folk til at klage til Busselskabet Movia. Kampagnen er MEGET tilfreds med al denne omtale, som eller ikke kan købes for penge, og har fået overvældende tilslutning som følge af begivenhederne. Det drejer sig om ytringsfrihed og således om at få reklamerne tilbage på de københavnske busser, hvor de hører til i overensstemmelse med den oprindelige aftale med Movia.

----------------------------------------------------

Our response is to intensify the campaign

These funds will pay for a more powerful and this time a tremendous nationwide campaign-boost, including other media than busses. Through this campaign you can be part of making this happen.

Vores svar er at intensivere kampagnen yderligere

Denne indsamling skal finansiere et langt kraftigere og denne gang landsdækkende kampagnefremstød, hvor forskellige reklamemedier vil blive taget i brug. Du kan via denne crowdfunding være med til at støtte, at dette bliver til virkelighed.


Other ways to support the campaign

----------------------------------------------------

Andre måder, at støtte kampagnen på

There are many other ways to support the campaign. You can help promote the campaign in your network, on social media, by commenting and liking. You can also write your own Facebook or blog posts about it linking to this campaign, the homepage and the Facebook page.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Det er ikke kun økonomisk støtte, du kan bidrage med. Vær med til udbrede kampagnen i dit netværk, deltag i kommentartråde, like, del og skriv egne indlæg med links til denne crowdfunding, hjemmesiden og facebook-siden. 


På hjemmesiden er der desuden en masse praktiske forslag, til hvordan du kan støtte kampagnen på andre måder.


More about the campaign

-----------------------------

Mere om kampagnen

Hjemmeside (Homepage):

http://nejtaktilbsp.dk

Facebook-side (Facebook page):

https://www.facebook.com/nejtaktilbsp

Et initiativ fra Dansk Palæstinensisk venskabsforening.

(Brought to you by The Danish Palestinian Friendship Association)

http://www.danpal.dk
