story:
Welcome to my world

 
Hi I am John, I am six years old. Besides my family I love 3 things in life:
  1. Chess
  2. Computer games
  3. Football
I play football once or twice every week in the local football club where I live. I play computer games to relax and explore other worlds. 

Last year I got started with chess and once I hit that chessboard I was lost in that game. So I have been playing ever since. I have played a lot!

I have been getting better and better. And I enjoy every moment of it.  I play online every day but I get a big kick from going to tournaments. 

Every game and every tournament is like a poker game except you have all the cards on the table all the time. For some it is very stressfull but for me it is like I am in the right place. I am a knight using my brain as my sharpest weapon.

Now I have been given a fantastic opportunity to go to the European Schools Chess Championship in Turkey. I really want to go there and show them how strong and skilled I have become. If I do well in this tournament I will also qualify for the World School Chess Championship in Tunesia.  So I HAVE to go.

I have already participated in a number of tournaments  against other children but lately I have mainly played against grown ups. It is really fun to beat somebody who is 10 times my age! I have won a number of trophees and medals, so naturally I have started to build my "hall of fame" wall at home.
 

What I Need & What You Get

My parents, my 3 brothers and 1 sister and the school I represent: Kornmod Realskole, all support and help me.

But I still need 1800 Eur. for hotel and living expenses for two people as I am not allowed to go alone, yet! Parents can sometimes be very strict.

If you want to make a difference and help me how can I give you something back?
  1. First of all I will off course do my very best at the Championship.
  2. At 5 Eur. I will send you an e-book about the event and what happened there.
  3. At 10 Eur. I will play a game of speed chess against you. (2 X 10 min.) Online
  4. At 20 Eur. I will play a game of classical chess against you. (2 X 45 min.) Online
  5. At 50 Eur. I will play 3 classical chess games against you. (2 X 45 min.) Online
Everybody that contributes will off course receive the e-book.

                                                          



The Challenge

You are also welcome to contribute and then invite another person to play for you against me, or even better I will play for you against them! I am willing to face anyone you can find on the battlefield of the chessboard.


If I do not reach my funding goal  100 % I will try to go anyway, Then I guess I just have to eat less.


If I get more than 100% I will be very happy because then I will have the chance to go to more tournaments and make you proud.  



The Impact

I have a dream to become Grand Master one day in Chess. This could be a lifechanging experience for me and it would help me establish a presence in international tournaments and gain the skills and know-how it takes to go all the way.

I have never made a campaign like this before. But I hope that this is the right way to get help, funding, feedback and support in the future. The road ahead of me to fullfill my goal is very long and very costly.
 

            

What Can Go Wrong?

My biggest concern regarding the Championship is the climate. The heat is said to be intense this time of year in the eastern Anatolia and I am concerned about getting flu from the temperature changes and of course stomach problems. I seem to share these concerns with my mother who always worries for me. My plan is to arrive a couple of days before to get used to the climate.  Knowing my mother I will be bringing half a pharmacy to protect me from all kinds of illnesses she can think of.

Other Ways You Can Help Me

Besides helping with contributions and challenges you can help me a lot by spreading the word about my campaign, tell others about me and the campaign, share, tweet, pin, like or anything else you can think of to spread the message. I NEED your help.
story_txt:
Welcome to my world

 
Hi I am John, I am six years old. Besides my family I love 3 things in life:


Chess


Computer games


Football


I play football once or twice every week in the local football club where I live. I play computer games to relax and explore other worlds. 
Last year I got started with chess and once I hit that chessboard I was lost in that game. So I have been playing ever since. I have played a lot!


I have been getting better and better. And I enjoy every moment of it.  I play online every day but I get a big kick from going to tournaments. 
Every game and every tournament is like a poker game except you have all the cards on the table all the time. For some it is very stressfull but for me it is like I am in the right place. I am a knight using my brain as my sharpest weapon.

Now I have been given a fantastic opportunity to go to the European Schools Chess Championship in Turkey. I really want to go there and show them how strong and skilled I have become. If I do well in this tournament I will also qualify for the World School Chess Championship in Tunesia.  So I HAVE to go.



I have already participated in a number of tournaments  against other children but lately I have mainly played against grown ups. It is really fun to beat somebody who is 10 times my age! I have won a number of trophees and medals, so naturally I have started to build my "hall of fame" wall at home.

    What I Need & What You Get
My parents, my 3 brothers and 1 sister and the school I represent: Kornmod Realskole, all support and help me.

But I still need 1800 Eur. for hotel and living expenses for two people as I am not allowed to go alone, yet! Parents can sometimes be very strict.

If you want to make a difference and help me how can I give you something back?


First of all I will off course do my very best at the Championship.


At 5 Eur. I will send you an e-book about the event and what happened there.


At 10 Eur. I will play a game of speed chess against you. (2 X 10 min.) Online


At 20 Eur. I will play a game of classical chess against you. (2 X 45 min.) Online


At 50 Eur. I will play 3 classical chess games against you. (2 X 45 min.) Online


Everybody that contributes will off course receive the e-book.

                                                          



The Challenge
You are also welcome to contribute and then invite another person to play for you against me, or even better I will play for you against them! I am willing to face anyone you can find on the battlefield of the chessboard. If I do not reach my funding goal  100 % I will try to go anyway, Then I guess I just have to eat less.

If I get more than 100% I will be very happy because then I will have the chance to go to more tournaments and make you proud.  


   The Impact
I have a dream to become Grand Master one day in Chess. This could be a lifechanging experience for me and it would help me establish a presence in international tournaments and gain the skills and know-how it takes to go all the way.

I have never made a campaign like this before. But I hope that this is the right way to get help, funding, feedback and support in the future. The road ahead of me to fullfill my goal is very long and very costly.
             
   What Can Go Wrong?
My biggest concern regarding the Championship is the climate. The heat is said to be intense this time of year in the eastern Anatolia and I am concerned about getting flu from the temperature changes and of course stomach problems. I seem to share these concerns with my mother who always worries for me. My plan is to arrive a couple of days before to get used to the climate.  Knowing my mother I will be bringing half a pharmacy to protect me from all kinds of illnesses she can think of.   Other Ways You Can Help Me
Besides helping with contributions and challenges you can help me a lot by spreading the word about my campaign, tell others about me and the campaign, share, tweet, pin, like or anything else you can think of to spread the message. I NEED your help.

story:
#LGBTQFerguson + #BlackLivesMatter

Legal reforms are not the only solution for the oppression faced by People of Color and the LGBTQ communities. Anti discrimination legislation has not narrowed the income and opportunity gaps faced by these communities. Despite increased visibility for these groups in American society, explicit harassment and implicit discrimination continue. BlackLivesMatter has brought the issues of oppression, systemic racism, and exploitation inherent in capitalism into the national discussion. 
Socialist Alternative St. Louis is sponsoring a community discussion with the Department of Gender Studies at University of Missouri-St. Louis (UMSL) - located on the edge of Ferguson, MO - on Friday, August 7th to discuss the limits of reform and ways forward for this powerful movement. 
The panel will be filmed and a video posted openly online following the event!

What We Need:

Funds will go to providing airfare, room + board for the Andrea Ritchie and Eljeer Hawkins to visit and participate in the #BlackLivesMatter activities over the weekend.  

In order to center Black leadership and direct resources to Black-led conversations, Dean Spade has graciously offered to pay for his own travel expenses. 

Discussants: 

Andrea Ritchie: 

is a Black lesbian police misconduct attorney and organizer and coordinates Streetwise & Safe (SAS), www.streetwiseandsafe.org, a leadership development initiative aimed at sharing “know your rights” information, strategies for safety and visions for change among LGBT youth of color who experience of gender, race, sexuality and poverty-based policing and criminalization. As such, she serves on the steering committee of Communities United for Police Reform (CPR), www.changethenypd.org, a city-wide campaign to challenge discriminatory, unlawful and abusive policing practices in New York City led by grassroots community groups, legal organizations, policy advocates and researchers from all five boroughs. She is the author of Violence Everyday: Police Brutality and Racial Profiling Against Women, Girls, and Trans People of Color and the co-author (with Joey L. Mogel and Kay Whitlock) of Queer (In)Justice. Her groundbreaking work charts new territory in the literature on mass incarceration. (from FeministWire)

Eljeer Hawkins: 

is a community and anti-police brutality activist, born and raised in Harlem, New York, and a member of Socialist Alternative for 18 years. He is a former shop steward with Teamsters local 851 and former member of SEIU 1199. He contributes regularly to SocialistAlternative.org and socialistworld.net. 

Dean Spade: 

is a member of the Sylvia Rivera Law Project, an collective that provides free legal help to trans and gender non-conforming people and works to build trans resistance rooted in racial and economic justice. He lives in Seattle and is involved with the Seattle chapter of Queers Against Israeli Apartheid and in work to oppose jail and prison expansion there. He teaches at Seattle University and is the author of Normal Life: Administrative Violence, Critical Trans Politics and the Limits of Law.

story:
Our Vision

Technology can't drown out the voice of the teacher - it should amplify it.

Education should be exciting and fun.


Learning should light a fire in a student.


Teachers must have the tools that let them customize their lessons,


Running with our Vision

Our vision is new way of learning, putting teachers and students in the center. Making it easy to create lessons without programming, and letting students play their lessons inside games.

We took our vision and ran with it. With our first version, you can already:

  • Create interactive lessons in minutes
  • Convert lessons to games and activities that students love
  • Students can create lessons too, that teachers can publish to the the class
  • Communicate on the internal social network
  • Get reports on student engagement and results
Then we gave it to teachers to try on Memarden. And they loved it!

Next on the Horizon

Our base $10K goal will help us start our marketing and sales effort. If we can surpass our initial target, we want you to help us vote on our stretch goals:

  • Inquiry Based Learning and Project Based Learning Module - so students can gain the critical thinking and deeper learning skills needed in the Information age
  • User-based Translation - so we can together translate lessons  into any language
  • Game Builder - so anyone can build a game, and we can have hundreds of games and activities for students to choose from
  • OnlineTutors and real-time question-answer sessions
  • More STEM and Langage Learning Lesson Types
  • Essay-style Lessons, in which students and teachers can interact over time on a problem

And we would love to hear from you on other ideas that may also work to put teachers and students in the center of education.

Who are we?

We are a small team of smart passionate people.

We know how to build great software - we've been doing it for decades and have helped to build some of the most widely used products in the world. If you use a credit card or have a mortgage, if you price a car or buy online groceries, if you make a telephone call or use the internet, you are using something one of us may have helped to build.

We quit our jobs and gave our time and money into making  Memarden something that would make the world a better place for teachers and students.

We can use your help

Contribute if you can - every dollar helps.

Tell everyone you know.

Share us on Facebook.

Tweet us on Twitter.

Share on LinkedIn

Join our HeadTalker. HeadTalker will send a single message to your social network, all at the same millisecond on Oct 14. When all these messages get sent at once it convinces social networks that the message is important, and they highlight them to everyone

Give your teachers a $5 Discount - they deserve it!

Above all tell all the teachers you know. Tell your school districts.

If we work together, we can do this!

story:
poster created by Alexandra DiFlorio


Our Vision

Alexandra DiFlorio and I (Michael Zbikowski) are two ambitious students who are looking to influence and change the world using our passion of music and art. Our love for the arts has inspired us to pursue our goals to educate individuals about political and social issues that are prevalent in our society. We hope to create an educated and respectable community through these arts to reach out to people and encourage the possibility for positive change. On May 15th, 2015 we are looking to enlighten people about mental illness, and alleviate any stigma associated with it by running a showcase featuring musicians and artists from Toronto and having a positive and open conversation on the topic. We strongly feel that mental health is of a huge importance, and we want to start making the right changes in order for it to be a more understood, supported and open issue.  This event has already been approved by CAMH (Center for Addiction and Mental Health), and if our goal is reached, 100% of the proceeds made from ticket sales will be donated to CAMH. Any contribution will help us create a large scale community that reaches beyond the peripheries of Toronto, and to realize our dream of making the world a better place one event at a time.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $500 to help us realize our vision! Here is what YOUR contributions will do:

- Paying our performers/participants! - We would like to be able to give back to anyone contributing to this event, including any help for the setting up and organizing, to gas and parking expenses, and of course, paying the performers for their contribution. We have 7 different bands playing that night, and we want to donate as much money as possible to CAMH, and still be able to pay the performers.

- Merchandise: we will be making t-shirts, posters, stickers, buttons, and pamphlets in order to help advertise the event

-Promotion: Social media, and advertisement 

-Projector : We will be running videos at our event, and we need a projector!

-Any remaining funds that have not been used will be donated to CAMH!

-If we do not reach our goal, the funds will still be allocated to the reasons mentioned above.

**You can follow what we have donated/will be donating on our Facebook page and event page.**


The Impact

Your contributions will help us create the educated and respectable community that we have envisioned. With your help we will be able to continue on our journey and reach out to individuals across borders.

We have organized a political event that is similar to this in the past with great success, however, we did not receive any funding and solely contributed to the cause from our own pockets. We would like to be able to contribute more in our next event to not only the organization we are donating to (CAMH), but to the musicians and artists, without having to go back into our pockets. 


Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk for us would be to spend our own non-existent money to make this event as successful as possible. We are looking for a little extra help to ensure that we do not accumulate the already large student debt that we both carry. 

However, we are both ready to embrace the financial burden ourselves, and contribute as much as we can from our own pockets to make our event, not only fun, but educational and have a lasting impact. 

We are saving money from the part-time jobs we both work (that only pays minimum wage), and we are looking for the help from our parents and friends who can contribute in any manner, whether its through sharing our event through social media, or help us run the event smoothly. If we cannot reach our goal, we will still do anything we can, even on a shoe-string budget, to achieve our goal.

We may not receive any funding, and if that is the case, IT WILL NOT STOP US. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cant contribute financially that is perfectly fine. Here is what you can do! You can visit:

Cerebral Arts Inc. on Facebook


OR

For The Love of Madness Event Page

LIKE THE PAGE, SHARE THE EVENT ON YOUR OWN PERSONAL PROFILES, SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN and use #fortheloveofmadness in any of your posts on Instagram, Facebook, or Twitter to help spread the world.


Thank you very much for your time and support.

story:
“Tell me and I forget. Show me and I remember. Involve me and I understand." - Chinese proverb


Introducing SeeBox

The interactive game console that help learners understand the fundamental concepts of Electronics and Electricity.

SeeBox can unlock your child's future in engineering. The child is engaged by watching short animated videos, then does experiments on real playboards, and learn by fun game play. It keeps track of every learner's progress and abilities while they work on it.  SeeBox doesn't require any teacher, can be used at home, and it supports groups of learners working together. 

Did you know that Electronic- and Electrical (EE) Engineers are on the list of high demand occupations in many countries around the world?

I've been an electronic engineer for 18 years and designed dozens of new products spanning many industries.  I saw how often the great engineers got exposure to engineering when they were young, learning by being curious.  So together with a team of engineers I set out to invent a device that will enable all schools and every parent at home to create the next generation of EE engineers.

SeeBox is an award-winning innovation, having been a finalist in the IPA, won 3 prizes at the SA Innovation Summit and is now a semi-finalist in the AEAward.

Everyone gets excited when a new tech device is created, but we get excited when a new engineer is created who will design that new tech device.


SeeBox featured on Edge Tech Show

What We Need & What You Get

SeeBox is ready for production, and you can enable us to go into production within the next six months.  We already have Playboards and videos to cover the basic concepts in electricity, but with more money we will be able to create lots and lots more of these.  We will also invest it to sponsor SeeBoxes for poorer schools, libraries and NGO's.

Depending on your contribution you could either:
  • Get a complete SeeBox package for yourself or your school.
  • Co-sponsor a SeeBox for your own school. The SeeBox comes with a unique locking mechanism so the school can install it in their computer lab or library and leave unattended for the learners to use.
    What if your school doesn't reach 10 co-sponsors? The school has the option to fund the balance or we will add your $35 toward a disadvantaged school. Remember to have your school’s contact details handy when you make the contribution.  After your contribution, go here to register you school. Or we will contact you for your school's details.
  • Co-sponsor a SeeBox for a disadvantaged school from our list.

The Impact

We believe that schools are still developing learners for jobs that will be replaced by technology in the near future, and at the same time failing to stimulate learners to become much needed engineers and scientists.  

This is especially true in Africa, where the focus is often on manufacturing to create jobs. This is temporary at best, because eventually automation, driven by Artificial Intelligence and Robotics, will make those jobs obsolete.

With SeeBox a child who has never been introduced to EE engineering can seamlessly cross that barrier of the unknown and the intimidating, and start thinking analytically, like an engineer - all while having fun playing a game.

How SeeBox works

The SeeBox combines 6 different electronic test instruments in 1 and present it to the user as a single all-encompassing instrument, that connects to a PC, Android phone or tablet.  

The Game Software

"If a child can’t learn the way we teach, maybe we should teach the way they learn" Ignacio Estrada


Children learn basic electronic principles while playing the SeeBox game.  The learner has to navigate their way through an obstacle course with many experiments on physical electronic circuits in the form of experiment boards, called a “Playboards”.  The SeeBox measures what the learner is doing on the circuit while they are doing it, and as soon as the learner achieves the objective of the experiment, they can enter the next experiment-door. Feedback is immediate, and the progressive nature of the game fosters a sense of accomplishment and thus confidence in their abilities.

Once the learner has successfully figured out all the experiments on one path, they can enter the "golden door", where they will receive the "secret code" to combine the knowledge of all they have learned, to build something tangible and cool.  Something they can show to their friends, like an electronic dice or cheap music box.

Video Learning

SeeBox comes with short animated videos to explain the different concepts of electricity and electronics in a simple and understandable way, that even learners as young as 10 years old can understand.


SeeBox's video map guides the learner to expand his/her understanding of electricity from the core concepts in the middle outwards.

Because the learner applies the knowledge immediately after watching a video, experiential learning ensures much better understanding than just classroom and textbook learning.

Learner Identification

SeeBox's patented Learner Identification (LID) system identify the learners and track their progress.  SeeBox gathers valuable metrics on the learner, like their practical problem-solving abilities and the concepts they’ve mastered.  This is fed into a learner management system and can be used to demonstrate the learner’s abilities to future employers or to apply for bursaries. Parents can also gauge from this data their child’s natural aptitude for engineering, and track their progress.

Finally

“It's a miracle curiosity survives formal education." - Albert Einstein

With SeeBox we want to change the way children learn about electronics and electricity, and so prepare the new generation to solve the future problems we can't even envision yet.

The SeeBox team hard at work on design review

_____________________________________________________________________________

FAQs

Who will benefit from SeeBox?

  • Children from 10 years and older
  • Electrical and electronic engineering students
  • Hobbyists and anyone who are curious and want to play around and learn about electronics
  • The professional model of the SeeBox will also be a very useful tool for professional electronic and electrical engineers.

What is inside the SeeBox console?

  • 6 Electronic test instruments combined into 1 (oscilloscope, logic analyser, waveform generator, pattern generator, spectrum analyser and power supply).
  • It comes with a video library to explain electronic concepts.
  • SeeBox comes with 2 software packages:
  • SeeBox Measure is software to use the SeeBox as an electronic test- and measure instrument.
  • SeeBox Play is the game where you must figure out problems on real electronic “Playboards” in order to progress to the next level in the game.
  • Also included are all the cables required to get going immediately.

How does SeeBox differ from other educational systems like robotics kits, low-cost single-board computers, and electronic simulation software?

  • Robotics kits and single-board computers focus only on software development, yet electronics is the basis that all software runs on.
  • SeeBox game is physical and tangible, which kids love.
  • Because it uses real-world components, the possibilities are endless.
  • It is not limited to a library of virtual components created for the software.
  • It creates a deeper understanding, which makes a person a better engineer.

What is the difference between the SeeBox’s way of developing engineers and scientists and the rest of the educational apps out there?
Problem solving ability cannot be taught from a book or by passively watching videos. It must be practiced until you become good at it.  So SeeBox puts the focus on engaging the learner and measuring while the problem-solving process is in progress.  This is different from presenting information in the form of a video or a text book and then testing that knowledge by having the learner recall it during an exam.

Will you release open code for the development community?
It is definitely the plan to release SeeBox with an open API to give developers total freedom to develop their own games or other software for SeeBox.

Why does SeeBox only work on Windows and Android - what about iOS?
Windows and Android will be supported as computer platforms at launch time, but it is high on our agenda to support iPhones and iPads soon thereafter.

handy when you make the contribution.  After your contribution, go here to register you school. Or we will contact you for your school's details. 

Co-sponsor a SeeBox for a disadvantaged school 
from our list.

The Impact

We  believe that schools are still developing learners for jobs that will be 
replaced by technology in the near future, and at the same time failing 
to stimulate learners to become much needed engineers and scientists.  
This is especially true in Africa, where the focus is 
often on manufacturing to create jobs. This is temporary at best, because eventually automation, driven by 
Artificial Intelligence and Robotics, will make those jobs obsolete.
With SeeBox a child who has never been introduced to EE 
engineering can seamlessly cross that barrier of the unknown and the 
intimidating, and start thinking analytically, like an engineer - all while having fun playing a game.
  How SeeBox works



The SeeBox combines 6 different electronic test instruments in 1 and 
present it to the user as a single all-encompassing instrument, that connects to a PC, Android phone or tablet.  
The Game Software
"If a child can’t learn the way we teach, maybe we should teach the way they learn" Ignacio Estrada

Children learn basic electronic principles while playing the SeeBox game.  
The learner has to navigate their way through an obstacle course with 
many experiments on physical electronic circuits in the form
 of experiment boards, called a “Playboards”.  The SeeBox 
measures what the learner is doing on the circuit while they are doing 
it, and as soon as the learner achieves the objective of the experiment,
 they can enter the next experiment-door. Feedback is immediate, and the progressive nature of the game fosters a sense of accomplishment and thus confidence in their abilities.

Once the learner has successfully figured out all the experiments on one path, 
they can enter the "golden door", where they will receive the "secret 
code" to combine the knowledge of all they have learned, to
 build something tangible and cool.  Something they can show to their 
friends, like an electronic dice or cheap music box.


  Video Learning

SeeBox comes with short animated videos to explain the different 
concepts of electricity and electronics in a simple and understandable way, that even learners as young as 10 years old can understand.


SeeBox's video map guides the learner
 to expand his/her understanding of electricity from the core concepts
 in the middle outwards.


Because the learner applies the knowledge immediately after 
watching a video, experiential learning ensures much 
better understanding than just classroom and textbook learning.

Learner Identification


SeeBox's patented Learner Identification (LID) system identify the learners and track their progress.  SeeBox gathers valuable metrics on the learner, like their practical problem-solving abilities and the concepts they’ve mastered.  This is fed into a learner management system and can be used to demonstrate the learner’s abilities to future employers or to apply for bursaries. Parents can also gauge from this data their child’s natural aptitude for engineering, and track their progress.

Finally
“It's a miracle curiosity survives formal education." - Albert EinsteinWith SeeBox we want to change the way children learn about electronics and electricity, and so prepare the new generation to solve the future problems we can't even envision yet.

The SeeBox team hard at work on design review
_____________________________________________________________________________

FAQs

Who will benefit from SeeBox?

Children from 10 years and older
Electrical and electronic engineering students
Hobbyists and anyone who are curious and want to play around and learn about electronics
The professional model of the SeeBox will also be a very useful tool for professional electronic and electrical engineers.

What is inside the SeeBox console?

6 Electronic test instruments combined into 1 (oscilloscope, logic analyser, waveform generator, pattern generator, spectrum analyser and power supply).
It comes with a video library to explain electronic concepts.
SeeBox comes with 2 software packages:
SeeBox Measure is software to use the SeeBox as an electronic test- and measure instrument.
SeeBox Play is the game where you must figure out problems on real electronic “Playboards” in order to progress to the next level in the game.
Also included are all the cables required to get going immediately.

How does SeeBox differ from other educational systems like robotics kits, low-cost single-board computers, and electronic simulation software?

Robotics kits and single-board computers focus only on software development, yet electronics is the basis that all software runs on.
SeeBox game is physical and tangible, which kids love.
Because it uses real-world components, the possibilities are endless.
It is not limited to a library of virtual components created for the software.
It creates a deeper understanding, which makes a person a better engineer.

What is the difference between the SeeBox’s way of developing engineers and scientists and the rest of the educational apps out there?Problem solving ability cannot be taught from a book or by passively watching videos. It must be practiced until you become good at it.  So SeeBox puts the focus on engaging the learner and measuring while the problem-solving process is in progress.  This is different from presenting information in the form of a video or a text book and then testing that knowledge by having the learner recall it during an exam.


Will you release open code for the development community?It is definitely the plan to release SeeBox with an open API to give developers total freedom to develop their own games or other software for SeeBox. 
Why does SeeBox only work on Windows and Android - what about iOS?Windows and Android will be supported as computer platforms at launch time, but it is high on our agenda to support iPhones and iPads soon thereafter.

story:
Short Summary

At first we thought small:  a sculpture that could embody the purpose of the Geller Center.  But then we thought, wait!  There are millions of people around the world who long for peace.  Can we create a  work of art that brings all these people together?  Combine our intentions - our longings - into an expression that tangibly radiates the energy of PEACE!  

Yes! what about a worldwide art and book project, filled with messages of peace by the people of the world for the people of the world!  What if we invite a multitude of hopes and blessings to be placed in a time capsule in an international award-winning sculpture of PEACE!  and create a book that shares the project with the world?! 

So...  we invite you to join us as we create PEACE!   Be part of a time capsule to be placed inside the sculpture;  be published in a book where your insights, your inspiration, for the world will be heard. 

In the heart of Fort Collins, Colorado, is a special place that has always been about seeking the greater good - nurturing healthy individuals, a vibrant community, and a peaceful world.  (For over 50 years the Geller Center has put on thousands of programs that live out this mission and been the genesis of many crucial non-profit organizations in the community:  the Downtown Food Bank, the Women’s Crisis Center, the International Center, and the Center for Peace and Justice, to name just a few.) We have been guided by an understanding that peace grows from the ground up and from the inside out.

Now the Geller Center and Dream Big Sculpture team up in a powerful new project,  this time engaging people from all over the world.  Lorri Acott’s  12-foot award-winning sculpture, Peace, is the centerpiece for the project,  and offers a powerful and unique opportunity to proclaim your hopes and best wishes for the world.  With your participation and thousands of others, we can create a masterpeace that helps move our planet in a healing direction!


                 What We Need & What You Get

In addition to participation from all over the world, we are reaching for $15,000 to add to our local fundraising efforts to pay for the "centerpeace" of this project, the award winning bronze sculpture Peace.  The money that is raised above the cost of the sculpture will be used to produce the book, and to fund more wonderful projects at the Geller Center - perhaps even the new facility!  (visit the Geller Center website for more info:  www.gellercenter.org)

Your participation can earn you:   

  • A place in the book and your folded origami crane with your message to the world in the time capsule and opportunities to provide that for others. Here is a you tube link to folding an origami crane as well as a link to a pdf that can be printed.

  • A hand folded cast bronze bronze paper crane. You can fold it yourself if you'd like, or Lorri will do it for you.

  • A 25"  bronze Peace  that can be acquired in three different ways: Donation (see "Perks");  Essay Contest;  or by using your indiegogo share tools to spread the word about the campaign.


  • 5'4" "Arc of Peace" sculpture by Lorri Acott     
  •          
  • An ebook on the making of "Peace"



                                                     The Impact

     Where we focus our attention      becomes the direction we move.  

It is a known truth that when we focus on the positive in the world, we actually bring more positive energy to it. When we focus on peace, we literally create peace.  When we focus on hope, we bring hope.  And when we join together in this creative process, the result is an exponential multiplication of positive energy with world-wide impact.

Remember Anne Frank?  Her powerful words of peace were heard because her words were published.  Just think how powerful it will be to read notes of peace, insight, and inspiration from all over the world!

                          

                            Risks & Challenges

Our plan is to install the permanent bronze sculpture, Peace, along with the time capsule on September 12th (not only is this the date of the Geller Center's Xaniscape festival, but it also honors the anniversary of 9/11).  Our hope is to fill the time capsule with over a thousand folded origami paper cranes that will hold insights, inspirations and hopes for the world.  ( If we don't have a thousand cranes by installation time, we will hold all the cranes and information for the book until we do, but with your help, we know we can do this!)  

Once the sculpture is installed, we will create the book that contains our messages of peace by the people of the world for the people of the world.

  • If some unforeseen circumstance should delay the installation in September, all  perks will still be delivered. 
  • Please note:  sculpture perks may take 3-6 months to deliver.


                        Other Ways You Can Help

Some people can't contribute financially but can still help (and you might even win a special prize)!

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about the campaign. 
  • Email and talk to friends - and other people or groups - that might want to participate.
  • Help us engage international participation!
  • There will be special perks for people who raise money for the project  (even if they have no ability to donate themselves).  Most notably, you can receive one of two bronze sculptures for FREE.   Just use the indiegogo share tools to spread the word, and we'll be able to track the donations that come from your email. Raise $5,000 and get a bronze hand folded origami crane. Raise $10,000 in donations and get a 25" limited Bronze edition of the Peace sculpture!

  • Sculptor  Lorri Acott is a member of

story:
Arts Fulshear is...

Remember that imaginary friend you had when you were little, or the plays you put on in the backyard? Remember the worlds you created with just a crayon and a piece of paper?

At Arts Fulshear we're passionate about encouraging creativity and creative play for all children. Our classes allow children from Kindergarten on to learn to express themselves creatively, letting imaginations run wild!

A group of educators and artists with a passion for the visual and performing arts started Arts Fulshear in 2011, and we've been growing since, providing classes for young and old.

We need space for theater classes and productions and for art classes. We've been begging and borrowing, and we're ready for a real space! With your help, we can acquire temporary space and then build a visual and performing arts center that serves children from all over South Texas.

Arts Fulshear needs...

We need $7,000 a month for theater and classroom space to adequately serve our community.

You'll get...

  • $1,000 or more--An art print by one of our adult artists and all the perks below;
  • $500 or more--All the perks below;
  • $100 or more--Two coffee mugs with Fulshear Heart logo or "The Sweet Life";
  • $50 or more--An Arts Fulshear t-shirt;
  • $25 or more--Five greeing cards with prints of children's art, and
  • $10 or more--Our undying gratitude and the knowledge that you helped bring art to a child!

 If we don't reach our goal of raising enough money for space, all money raised will fund our programs for children, so more deserving children will receive art and theater lessons.

Your impact...

  • $100--supplies for a six-week art class for twenty children, or tuition for one child.
  • $500 will fund one "Meet the Masters" unit for an entire elementary school!
  • $1,000 --will fund an outdoor sculpture or a mural!
  • $7,000--rent on four classrooms, an office and a theater space for one year, helping us keep our tuition affordable and allowing us to offer more scholarships.

We're challenged by...

 Finding good people is always a challenge. Our focus over the past month has been to recruit talented and qualified teachers. We're fortunate to have found teachers who love to work with young children, and have the background to know how.

You can help by...

Just because you can't contribute doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about Arts Fulshear and our campaign;
  • Volunteer if you're in the area; and
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Short Summary

Hello All, My name is Dr. Duane C. Scott Founder and CEO of C&S Financial Education. C&S is a subsidiary of Christopher & Scott LLC a company focused on the financial betterment of investors and those wanting to learn more about wealth management, credit management, and consumer behavior.

Dr. Duane C. Scott has a DBA in Marketing and International Business and has focused on consumer behavior since the financial crisis of 2008 and 2009. What he has learned since 2008/2009 is that the wealth gap between the middle class and lower and those that we would consider rich has gotten wider. Now there are a lot of reasons for this but there is a direct correlation between consumer behavior, credit management, and investment management and that of wealth or the lack thereof. Our campaign is in the beginning stages of trying to change this widening gap.

We need to raise about $250,000.00 dollars to continue our product development and marketing of the product at hand. Any additional capital that might be raised would go towards development of more advanced training products that would be rolled out at a later date.

Our goal is to at least sell 1 million units once the training products are ready for distribution and the capital goal that we have set for ourselves will go a long way in marketing that these training products are available and that they will make a superior difference for the consumers that buy them. We are a firm believer that poignant straight forward training that is relative and concise for those who will purchase them will make a difference in their lives.

To sum up we are a firm believer that most American consumers do not realize how important their consumer behavior is in determining their wealth future. Our training products are designed to teach the consumer that there is a better way for them and we thank you for your time and contributions.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $250,000.00 dollars to:

  • Product development training dvd's and digital downloads along with supporting materials to help consumers take control of their financial future. We estimate that the cost for each unit would be about 6 to 9 dollars these of course are just estimates these numbers are likely to change. For our first campaign we will need at least $3000.00 to get started on our video segments in product development and we will update all of you on our progress.
  • There are several levels of support that we would like from you, these consist of the bronze, silver, gold and platinum levels. 
  • Bronze support is a $50.00 dollar contribution and for your support you will get a free copy of the financial training product to use for yourself or to give as a gift.
  • Silver support is a $100.00 dollar contribution and for your support you will get two copies of the financial training product to not only use for yourself but also give as a valuable gift.
  • Gold support is a $200,00 dollar contribution where you will get 4 copies of the financial training product and lifetime support through our  free phone network we we can assist you with your financial journey or who you deem as someone in need of these services.
  • Finally the Platinum level support is a $300.00 dollar contribution or more where you will get 6, count them 6 copies of the financial training product to give as gifts and keep for yourself along with the free phone network services to helps those along their financial journey, yes we will hold your hand along the way!
  • If we do not meet our goal and there is a possibility here, we are looking for funding elsewhere to perhaps make up the shortfall. However, this (loans) are a last resort. We would like to use this platform as our source of funding and the reason for this is because we are firm believers of the crowdfunding way. This is the funding way of the future!

The Impact

Our products are going to truly address the problem of the wealth gap, income gap and true independence for American consumers. i will also argue that these products can also be rolled out globally as well since the wealth gap has also become global.

  • If you want a more equitable impact on the consumer at large both in the United States and abroad you should contribute to this campaign.
  • We have been doing what is going to be rolled out in these educational products in live seminar format and they have been extremely successful. We know this will work for everyone.
  • We will also upload segments of the seminars onto www.youtube.com and this platform for you to see its impact on our students.

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest risk is building a great distribution network and an effective marketing campaign. We have a goal of 1 million units to be sold in our first year to two and a great distribution network along with effective marketing will get us there.

  • Since I have a doctorate in Marketing and a certificate in International Business I believe we will overcome these risks and challenges with a great team and funding.
  • Speaking of the team we are putting together a product development team and a distribution network as we speak we will have more details on this as we progress.
  • In terms of marketing we are going to market locally and expand nationally via social media, radio, a home shopping network, TV (infomercial) and some strategically placed print (limited print).

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you may not be able to contribute but that still does not mean that you cannot help us out and believe me every bit helps. Here is what you can do for us:

  • Get the word, the more people we can can touch with our message the better the chance to raise the money we need and the biggest network we can get to guess what? Raise more money!
  • We are going to drive as many people as we can to the Indiegogo platform so please send all that you know to this same page.

And that's all there is to it.

In terms of marketing we are going to market locally and expand nationally via social media, radio, a home shopping network, TV (infomercial) and some strategically placed print (limited print).    Other Ways You Can Help Some of you may not be able to contribute but that still does not mean that you cannot help us out and believe me every bit helps. Here is what you can do for us:  Get the word, the more people we can can touch with our message the better the chance to raise the money we need and the biggest network we can get to guess what? Raise more money! We are going to drive as many people as we can to the Indiegogo platform so please send all that you know to this same page.   And that's all there is to it.

story:
Help Build a School for Children in Uganda

Project Lydia has empowered abandoned widows by providing economic opportunities. When widows and women are empowered, the whole village economy changes for the good. Children can go to school.

The school project is a passion of Project Lydia's founders, Cliff and Julie Pash. They have lived and worked in remote villages in Uganda for 8 years as founders of Advancing The Kingdom. Project Lydia is a successful creator of jobs for women. Now Project Lydia wants to provide a school for children.

  1. Existing schools are far (1-2 miles in distance)

  2. The facilities available are of a poor quality

  3. Poor educational opportunities cause family fractures

  4. Too many children do not attend school.

  5. Poor education leads to delinquent behaviors

  6. English and/or Swahili are needed for inter-regional mobility and work opportunities, yet, language skills are very poor.

  7. Lack of education causes people to join rebel extremist & radical groups:

  8. These radical/extremist groups are currently recruiting in Busoola.

With your gift, you will launch a child from poverty to possibility with an education.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's what we need to launch construction of the school:

  • We need $30,000 to start building the foundation of the school. We need a total of $130,000 to complete the school but since this is our first campaign, we wanted to aim for $30,000.
  • Donors to the Busoola School Campaign will receive gifts ranging from a shout out on our social media sites to a name on the building.
  • The funds will go into an account designated for the school construction if we don't reach our goal

Change a Child's Life

Busoola Village has a population of about 1000 households.  The level of poverty is higher than average. Most farming is done with a hand hoe, although an occasional oxen plough can be seen. Cultivation by tractor is very rare. The principle crops are maize, cassava, Irish potatoes, native potatoes, beans and rice. Incomes are supplemented by growing coffee for export.

By investing in a school, you're empowering children to be set free from poverty. Project Lydia has a successful record of empowering women with economic opportunity. More than 60 women are earning incomes. Four of the women have built new houses this year, and many more have improved their housing by adding new roofs. The women have increased their gardening space to grow more food and added goats, cows, and chickens to their small farms. I’m told even their families are healthier because they eat better and can afford medical care. As the Project Lydia women spend their incomes within their villages, others have started new businesses which is helping the community at large to prosper. As we travel down the dirt road from village to village there are so many shiny new roofs and houses being built as a result of the impact Project Lydia women have made. 

60 women working with Project Lydia are able to send 200 children to school.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please share this campaign on your social media sites. Join us as a partner! Use Indiegogo share tools to help us get the word out.
story_txt:
Help Build a School for Children in Uganda Project Lydia has empowered abandoned widows by providing economic opportunities. When widows and women are empowered, the whole village economy changes for the good. Children can go to school.
The school project is a passion of Project Lydia's founders, Cliff and Julie Pash. They have lived and worked in remote villages in Uganda for 8 years as founders of Advancing The Kingdom. Project Lydia is a successful creator of jobs for women. Now Project Lydia wants to provide a school for children.


Existing schools are far (1-2 miles in distance)
The facilities available are of a poor quality
Poor educational opportunities cause family fractures
Too many children do not attend school.
Poor education leads to delinquent behaviors
English and/or Swahili are needed for inter-regional mobility and work opportunities, yet, language skills are very poor.
Lack of education causes people to join rebel extremist & radical groups:
These radical/extremist groups are currently recruiting in Busoola.

With your gift, you will launch a child from poverty to possibility with an education.   What We Need & What You Get Here's what we need to launch construction of the school:

We need $30,000 to start building the foundation of the school. We need a total of $130,000 to complete the school but since this is our first campaign, we wanted to aim for $30,000.
Donors to the Busoola School Campaign will receive gifts ranging from a shout out on our social media sites to a name on the building. The funds will go into an account designated for the school construction if we don't reach our goal    Change a Child's Life Busoola Village has a population of about 1000 households.  The level of poverty is higher than average. Most farming is done with a hand hoe, although an occasional oxen plough can be seen. Cultivation by tractor is very rare. The principle crops are maize, cassava, Irish potatoes, native potatoes, beans and rice. Incomes are supplemented by growing coffee for export.
By investing in a school, you're empowering children to be set free from poverty. Project Lydia has a successful record of empowering women with economic opportunity. More than 60 women are earning incomes. Four of the women have built new houses this year, and many more have improved their housing by adding new roofs. The women have increased their gardening space to grow more food and added goats, cows, and chickens to their small farms. I’m told even their families are healthier because they eat better and can afford medical care. As the Project Lydia women spend their incomes within their villages, others have started new businesses which is helping the community at large to prosper. As we travel down the dirt road from village to village there are so many shiny new roofs and houses being built as a result of the impact Project Lydia women have made. 
60 women working with Project Lydia are able to send 200 children to school.

    Other Ways You Can Help If you can't contribute, please share this campaign on your social media sites. Join us as a partner! Use Indiegogo share tools to help us get the word out.

story:
Peace and Love Friends...

Skai here along with an amazing group of people who are interested and ready to get this farm really moving! We represent the Luquillo Farm Sanctuary...a program of Muevete Puerto Rico Inc....the only ecological educational farm of its kind on the island. We have been working this 80 acre farm on funds in pocket and its time that we take this project and push it out into the atmosphere. Our goals this year is to get more tools, develop our Permaculture curriculum, establish a cash crop to keep the farm sustainable and start our main programs Campo Boriken. and Mi Escuela Natural which afford students opportunities to learn about growing food, the importance of this task, how fun it can be, and most importantly its relationship with our health.


What We Need

Honestly we need thousands and thousands of dollars.  To develop a farm of this magnitude the amount is a bit intimidating. We have applied for several big and small grants to no avail which is why we are implementing this campaign through Indiegogo.  At this time we are working on raising $10,000.  This will help us get more tools...better tools, establish the cash crop...we are going with Mint...because Mint is a major ingredient in Mojitos used by the more than 18,000 restaurants on the island. This will help us fund the farm for our projects, staffing, and growth. Mint grows fast, and spreads. Not to mention Iguanas which are all over the place dont eat mint.  YAY!


We also want to set up better facilities for our volunteers. Last year we hosted more than 30 people from around the world. They actually camped out on the farm without running water or electricity. We fed them 3 square a day and they were able to enjoy the Puerto Rican beaches and rainforests too. We have recently added running water to the farm...now we need fully functioning bathrooms and a kitchen would be ideal so that we can make the actual meals on the farm. This will also enable us to host events on the farm like Jazz Nights, etc which also would be a great fundraiser for the farm.


Like I said in the video we also need people.  We need people working on the farm, staying on the farm, and supporters all around the island and off.  People is what will make this project successful and we invite you to participate in any way.


The Impact

We all eat. We eat at the dinner table with our families, in the dining hall with our academic community, in restaurants, in the car, at the computer, in front of the TV, and on the phone. We eat Caesar salad, bagels and cream cheese, hamburgers, pesto pasta, chicken wings, and coffee ice cream. Although we have a vast array of foods available to us nearly all the time, we rarely stop to ponder where our food comes from, and the effects from the choices we make. 


Eating is an agricultural act. ~Wendell Berry

When we look at a plate of food, we don't think about the thousands of miles it probably traveled to reach us. We don't think about the energy (oftentimes fossil fuels emitting greenhouse gases) consumed in its transportation, or in its harvesting, processing, refrigeration, and packaging. We dont think about the chemicals and carcinogenic pesticides sprayed on the fields where our food was grown, nor do we think about all the people and jobs involved from start to finish.Though it may not be obvious to the majority of human beings,eating a banana produced by the current corporate agricultural means may contribute to global warming and the exploitation of the working class in Guatemala. In this rapidly dynamic world, it is of ultimate importance to think about the web of food production.


To forget how to dig the earth and tend the soil is to forget ourselves.  ~Gandhi

In a predominantly and increasingly urbanized world, we are losing the vital connection between humans and land, along with it, the simple joys, the warmth of the sun on one's back and the earth under one's bare feet; watching a plant grow and mature over several months; and sensing a profound power in the creation of life, sustenance, and interconnectedness. 


The Luquillo Farm Sanctuary is a non-profit organization located in the foothills of El Yunque Rainforest in Luquillo, Puerto Rico that exists to create an environment that allows for the whole person to heal and learn through our holistic and sustainable farm education program. Food as Nutrition, Healing, Lifesource, the Earth.

We hope that you connect with this message and vision of creating this ecological farm on 80 acres of farmland located in the Villa Angelina area of Luquillo, Puerto Rico. The farm will include facilities for seasonal vegetable and fruit production, institutional composting, greenhouse sprouting, retreat cabins for clients and accommodations for Energy Exchange Volunteers.

story:
Mud Creek Central is a 1/8th scale model railroad in Lockport, New York. Each year, we invite the public to take rides on our model trains.

In the past, the members at Mud Creek have set up tents as temporary loading platforms.

We would like to have a permanent steel structure professionally installed to shade passengers from the sun while they wait for the train.

  • The price for the complete structure is $1,582.00 including taxes and installation. 
  • If you contribute $100.00 or more, your name will be displayed on a plaque at the club as a contributor.
  • If you contribute $1,582.00, you may name the station after your family or business. The name must be family-friendly and is subject to approval by the board of directors.
  • If we do not reach our goal, the funds will go toward infrastructure improvements at Mud Creek.

Impact

We want to make waiting for the train as pleasant as possible! 

Risks & Challenges

The installation window for the structure can be as wide as six months. While the structure may not be installed in time for the 2015 run, if funded, it will be ready for 2016.

story:
Learn to create cross platform mobile apps using Intel XDK and Ionic Framework. You will learn these technologies by creating 6 different complete apps:
  • Chat APP
  • Music and Video Playing APP
  • Password manager APP
  • RSS Reader APP
  • Photo Sharing APP
  • To Do List APP

You don't need any MAC to take this course because Intel XDK lets you create and test iOS Apps without Mac.

Using Intel XDK you don't have to write separate code for iOS, Windows and Android. The same works works everywhere.

I want to create a full course to teach a novice (or indeed an experienced coder!) how to create iOS, Android and Windows Phone apps using HTML5 and JavaScript. The course will be entirely project based, so the user will start by building Hello World, go on to building advanced apps. I will include a full guide on running as well as submitting your apps to the app store.

The full price of the course will be $149 and will be put on Udemy. This course will be launched by the end of August.

How is this course different to others?

  • Students will get full lifetime access (including video downloads) for a single one-off fee
  • The tutor is a qualified and experienced teacher, so is able to explain complex concepts clearly, as well as entertain along the way
  • The tutor has already produced a highly successful, popular and highly rated course in mobile and web development
  • The course is project-based, so students will not just be learning dry programming concepts, but applying them immediately to make real apps

Who is this for?

  • Anyone who wants to learn to build apps: HTML5 and JavaScript are fantastic languages to learn how to code with, and it enables you to make production-quality apps for the App Store using only free software. 
  • Anyone who wants to be an app developer: It will teach you how to make money from your apps as well as how to code. 
  • Anyone who wants to understand how computers work: Learning to code is so much more than being able to make apps - knowing how computers work is the key to a hugely powerful world. 

Why Intel XDK and Ionic Framework?

You may wonder why to build cross platform apps using Intel XDK and Ionic. Well Phonegap is an Intel XDK alternative and jQuery Mobile is an alternative to Ionic.
The main benefit of creating apps using Intel XDK is that you don't need a MAC and also you don't need to install eclipse, XCode and Visual Studio to test apps. Intel provides its own cross platform emulator and also a cloud binary build.
Ionic framework is the most trending topic among developers at present. It provides the best UI for creating mobile apps. 

Who am I?

Hi! I’m Narayan. I have a degree in Computer Science, and am a web and app developer based in India. I am the Founder of QNimate and QScutter.

I'm passionate about teaching people to code. I also run the popular blog.

 

I have created the most popular Apache Solr and Search Engine courses. These course were recognized officially by Solr. These courses have great reviews. 

I want to offer the same quality of course to potential mobile developers. If you want to try out the solr course here's a $15 discount code:

https://www.udemy.com/learn-apache-solr-with-big-data-and-cloud-computing/?ccManual=&dtcode=b6qV6nj2MqYY&couponCode=qscutter

Why Should You Learn Intel XDK and Ionic From Me

I have been teaching and writing about Intel XDK from almost a year and half now. I also give guest lectures on Intel XDK and Ionic on many schools and universities. My articles on Intel XDK. I am recognized as the best XDK trainer in India by XDK officially. 

Risks & Challenges

There are relatively few risks here. I will not be spending your money up front, so in the very unlikely circumstances that I am unable to complete the course, I will refund everyone.

I also promise to refund anyone if they do not think the course is fully awesome.

story:
Andrew's 50th Birthday Wish

I'll be turning 50 on September 19th. I decided from the beginning that I didn't want this time of celebration to be all about me. I wanted to use my life to make a positive impact on the world. 

For my 50th birthday, I want one thing: to raise the roof for a cause I hold dear.

I am a member of the Almas Shrine Temple in Washington, DC. You may know us for our fezzes and our philanthropy. The Shriners Hospitals for Children provide the highest quality care to children with neuromusculoskeletal conditions, burn injuries and other special healthcare needs within a compassionate, family-centered and collaborative care environment. And all of that regardless of the children's family's ability to pay.

Almas Shriners volunteer their own time, money, and resources to drive children in need of medical treatment from the Washington DC Metropolitan Area all the way to the Shriners Hospitals for Children in Philadelphia. Every month, I hop in my car, pick up a child and their family, and drive six hours round-trip to make sure they get the care they need without having worry about how they will get to the hospital. 

I love what I do, but the cost adds up very quickly. Between gas, tolls, food, and car maintenence, it costs a Shriner volunteer at least $100 out of pocket to pay a child's way.

Therefore, I'm trying to raise at least $3000 in 30 days to cover the cost of food, gas, and tolls, and I'm doing this in two ways:

  1. Through this Indiegogo campaign...
  2. ...and through a rockin' concert.

Almas Shriners Transportation Fund Concert - September 19th

Come rock the house on September 19 at the historic Sphinx Club in Downtown DC to raise awareness for the great work that the Almas Shriners do for kids in the Metro Area.

This is a free event! Yes! FREE! If you are in the DC area, come rock out with us for a cause.

Two bands will ROCK THE HOUSE.

Fuzzy Match will get you up on your feet with Funk, Soul, and Motown with incredible original songs mixed with legendary covers.


Fellowcraft will bring it on with rugged simplicity; overdriven amplifiers, fuzzy bass lines and blisteringly loud drums. They're part blues, part funk, part rock, and 100% loud. Bring your Doc Martins.

We'll have delicious food and a cash bar. $1 from every food and drink item sold will be donated. There will also be a silent auction with cool stuff from local partners.

So rock out, dance, party, and crowdsurf - and definitely bring your friends.


Donation Details

  • The shrine doesn't let individuals do "official Shrine fundraisers," so I'll say here that this is not an official fundraiser for the Almas Shrine Temple Transportation Fund. I will be donating the lump sum collected from the concert proceeds and crowd funding campaigns. I will be keeping track of individual donors. After the event, you will receive a receipt from the Almas Shrine for your records. 
  • Donations to this organization are tax - deductible!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't come to our event, please feel free to just donate. A little goes a long way. 
  • If you are a local DC Area business selling goods or services, we would love to feature you in our silent auction. Message us for more information on how to participate. Your donations will be tax deductible! 
  • Use Indiegogo share tools to spread the word!

story:
Current Situation:

Before the earthquakes and aftershocks of spring/summer 2015, the village of Suri in Dolakha had a primary elementary school providing education for one hundred children. Virtually all of the school was destroyed in late April and early May’s quakes, and the rest rendered unusable.

Currently, five teachers have been conducting class in a temporarily constructed windowless wooden shelter without a kitchen, indoor lavatories, and administrative offices to which they are accustomed. About one hundred school-aged children attend grades one through six, walking for up to an hour six days per week to continue their education.

 

Fundraising Goal:

If we want to help build a brighter, stronger future for Nepal, children’s education is the most effective and efficient means of helping.  A rough, preliminary estimate
for the reconstruction of the school has been given at about $12,000 (USD).  Additional, funds will be used to reconstruct a public school serving the poor in the historical town of Bhaktapur.

We plan to fundraise through August 2015.  With monsoon season on the horizon and a temporary government prohibition on construction, we anticipate construction of the new facility to begin in early autumn.

 

Oversight:

To avoid misappropriation of funds, two committees will be created.  A committee consisting of seven local members will manage the design and construction process on the ground.  A second supervisory committee consisting of seven regional members will function to review expenditures, oversee the construction process, and phasically disperse funds when goals of each stage are met.  The funds will be released in a step-wise manner to insure appropriate and effective use. We expect the construction of the school to be completed within 3 months of
groundbreaking.

We expect the construction of the school to be completed within 3 months ofgroundbreaking.

story:
A Couple of College Kids and an Idea


Mark Kilaghbian and William Harrison were somewhat of a match made in heaven. A big picture thinker and a computer wiz-kid. Our company now consists of members from nearly every Ivy League institution, the University of Chicago, Stanford, over ten state schools, and even a few community colleges. Dedicated students eager to redefine an industry. 

Mark and Will worked towards answering one question: how can mobile technology streamline the outdated, bloated education business?


                                                             "Tutor."
The app that pairs tutors with students in need. Our tutors are academically gifted highschool students, college students, TA's, and even professor and industry professionals. Customers wield the power to choose a tutor fitting their budget,  calendar, and academic needs. No more 200% up charges from brick and mortar establishments or awkward price renegotiations with seedy craigslist characters. Tutors are afforded the same freedoms and determine their desired schedule, hourly wages, and operational radius. Work when you want and pad your wallet teaching what you love. 

Stuck on a single homework problem? The "tips" system saves the day. Give tips to get them. Post the question to the feed, allowing qualified tutors from across the country to help. No annual subscriptions, no tokens or credits. Just a small one-time fee for when you need that extra boost. Our algorithm finds the right tutor for the problem, and if the answer isn't up to your standards, you'll get a refund.

A streamlined user experience is paramount to satisfaction. "Tutor." ensures customer convenience by fully integrating touch ID, Facebook Login, Apple Pay, Calendar Syncing, and even in-app GPS locational services, displaying nearby Wi-Fi enabled coffee shops as potential meeting places. The beauty lies behind the scenes  -nearly 18,000 lines of code facilitate all but the pencil in the tutor's hand. 

Tutors retain the convenience to work when they want, for a price worth their time. Accept or Decline sessions at will, or login and answer "tips" in between classes. With our comprehensive tutor rating system, personalized profiles, .EDU verification, promotion algorithm, and secure payment system, we make finding the right tutor a safe -and simple- process. 


                              How you can help

The application itself is currently under App Store review and will go live within the upcoming few weeks. We need your help in raising the funds to advertise, and take on a bloated $10B industry. Even if you don't have the funds to invest, every free download is a huge step in building the Tutor network . 

                                   The Impact

Currently, tutors working for established tutoring firms earn a measly hourly wage of $12, with their contractors or employers charging 2-3x this rate. By removing the unwieldy, unnecessary middleman and granting universal two-tap access to education, we hope to help students struggling academically and financially. Doing so will help combat an increasingly competitive job market and more demanding college admissions standards, 

Looking at SAT/ACT/GMAT/LSAT/MCAT prep, tutoring centers like Kaplan offer these options; $4,500 for 32 hours ($140/hour), or $3,200 for their smallest 20 hour package ($160/hour). Why not employ that master's degree student at Harvard for $40/hour? You save money, and a bright mind is spared the drudgery of minimum wage retail work. Worried about his academic pedigree? Check his qualifications and past reviews all in-app. 

"Tutor." utilizes advanced technology to make your life easier. But don't take our word for it, sign up today and give it a try. It's free, what do you have to lose? Oh and here's what you have to gain:

                                  

So What's the Next Step?

  • First and foremost, we'd like to move into the up-loadable document space. Since many of our tutors will be students, they may have helpful supplementary material. Those worksheets, assignments, and practice tests could then be uploaded to allow universal access across the Tutor network . 
  • Secondly, we'd like to begin partnering with local coffee shops and national establishments such as Starbucks and Coffee Bean.
    • In exchange for encouraging students to patronize these establishments, a coupon for 30% off that cafe mocha could only only help both parties. 
    • This could also mean open sessions during finals weeks. If a student just needs to pop in for a quick question, they have a go-to place; think office hours for tutors (with in-app maps showing which course specialists are where). As soon as both members are present, a live meter would begin and only charge for the minutes necessary to answer the question.
  • Lastly, we'd like to integrate group sessions. Our most qualified and reviewed tutors could eventually teach pairs of students or larger groups. This shift significantly reduces hourly costs for students on a budget, and with most universities offering study space (private rooms for group work), reserving such a study space is simple. 
Expect most of these improvements within our first update.

                                  An Uphill Battle

Changing an industry is never easy. 

That's why we rely on the proven consumer allure of incentives. Launching a service of this size, is costly, time consuming and risky. For our network to gain viability, "the network effect" must be utilized. In other words, a user base large enough to actively attract users via verbal word of mouth. Our biggest hurdle is that of "the chicken and the egg". It will be difficult to register tutors before students, and vise versa. We hope our "tips" system provides tutors around the country a reason to work while we bring our marketing campaign to their locale. 

There's a reason the online tutoring niche only possesses a mere 7% of the market share. People learn best in person. The digital medium must be used to organize meetings, not replace them entirely. Since tutors can sign up and work their preferred hours, we hope that many full time or part time tutors working for our competitors will use the app for peripheral income (giving them time to appreciate the merits of our system) until our student user base is large enough for them to commit to a full-time switch. We realize the "Tips" system introduces "Tutor." into the online arena, putting us squarely in the middle of a two front war. We want to disrupt an industry not just a part of it. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Follow us on Social Media & Share!

instagram.com/tutor.app

twitter.com/thetutorapp

facebook.com/tutorapplication

If you do get a shirt or a pen, wear them around to spread awareness!

and Download the app here (we'll insert a link when we launch):
story_txt:
A Couple of College Kids and an Idea



Mark Kilaghbian and William Harrison were somewhat of a match made in heaven. A big picture thinker and a computer wiz-kid. Our company now consists of members from nearly every Ivy League institution, the University of Chicago, Stanford, over ten state schools, and even a few community colleges. Dedicated students eager to redefine an industry. 

Mark and Will worked towards answering one question: how can mobile technology streamline the outdated, bloated education business?





                                                             "Tutor."
The app that pairs tutors with students in need. Our tutors are academically gifted highschool students, college students, TA's, and even professor and industry professionals. Customers wield the power to choose a tutor fitting their budget,  calendar, and academic needs. No more 200% up charges from brick and mortar establishments or awkward price renegotiations with seedy craigslist characters. Tutors are afforded the same freedoms and determine their desired schedule, hourly wages, and operational radius. Work when you want and pad your wallet teaching what you love. 

Stuck on a single homework problem? The "tips" system saves the day. Give tips to get them. Post the question to the feed, allowing qualified tutors from across the country to help. No annual subscriptions, no tokens or credits. Just a small one-time fee for when you need that extra boost. Our algorithm finds the right tutor for the problem, and if the answer isn't up to your standards, you'll get a refund.

A streamlined user experience is paramount to satisfaction. "Tutor." ensures customer convenience by fully integrating touch ID, Facebook Login, Apple Pay, Calendar Syncing, and even in-app GPS locational services, displaying nearby Wi-Fi enabled coffee shops as potential meeting places. In exchange for encouraging students to patronize these establishments, a coupon for 30% off that cafe mocha could only only help both parties. 

This could also mean open sessions during finals weeks.
