story:
Short Summary

 

  • I am a Class of 2000 Finance Graduate from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania. I worked in tech related fields such as E-commerce at Tiffany & Co. and Weichert Realtors, before returning for an Accounting MBA at Rutgers Business School, where I received a Dean's Scholarship. I began teaching math and business college classes, and learning about how millennials and younger people prefer to approach their education. 
  • I think we can revolutionize the test prep industry, by venturing more into EdTech with a top test prep business and a top tech team.
  • We want to do a really good, amazing job, making this app viral and distributing it to the right clients and customers. We want to let them use technology that is user friendly to help them attend the school of their choice for college.
story_txt:
Short Summary
 

I am a Class of 2000 Finance Graduate from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania. I worked in tech related fields such as E-commerce at Tiffany & Co. and Weichert Realtors, before returning for an Accounting MBA at Rutgers Business School, where I received a Dean's Scholarship. I began teaching math and business college classes, and learning about how millennials and younger people prefer to approach their education. 
I think we can revolutionize the test prep industry, by venturing more into EdTech with a top test prep business and a top tech team.
We want to do a really good, amazing job, making this app viral and distributing it to the right clients and customers. We want to let them use technology that is user friendly to help them attend the school of their choice for college.

story:
Short Summary

AHREM was founded in July 2011 by Khaing Zaw Zaw and David Fisher with the goal of educating the impoverished youth of the Arakan State in Myanmar who were forced to abandon their education in Myanmar due to economic circumstances.  Before a student is accepted by us, they must complete an interview process during which we determine whether the student shows great enthusiasm for studying and giving back to their home community. If we recognize these qualities in a student, he is invited to study at the AHREM office in Mae Sot completely free of charge. AHREM provides students with the basic skills they need in order to continue their educations and live successful lives supporting their communities. More specifically, AHREM aims to give students the basic skills (typically English competency and basic computer skills) necessary in order to be accepted into higher education programs at other organizations. AHREM students are also taught human and environmental rights topics, as many of the students were not exposed to these issues in their native villages. When a student has completed all available higher education programs in Mae Sot and pursued university scholarship opportunities, AHREM sends the student back to the Arakan State in Myanmar to share their new skills with the students at our AHREM office in the Arakan State, which we opened in the spring of 2016. AHREM is 100% donation funded and taught completely by volunteers, with much of our funding coming directly from the organizations founders, so we are dependent on your generosity to continue our program's operations.

For further information, please visit us at www.ahrem.org

What We Need & What You Get

The AHREM Mae Sot office's weekly expenses are 4,088 baht ($116), which allows 13 students to live full-time in the office (we have another location in Myanmar as well). This money will be used to pay for our rent, food costs, teaching and school supplies, utilities, and other necessities. This is a small amount, but we struggle to provide for our weekly expenses. With your donation, AHREM will be able to educate more poor Arakanese students.

Even if don't reach our fundraising goal, your donation will still make a significant impact and help us to provide for our students' needs.

The Impact

AHREM is educating poor Arakanese students in Mae Sot, Thailand and now also directly inside of the Arakan State in Myanmar. AHREM has empowered many students from Myanmar, many of whom are now working in Thailand or inside Myanmar to support their families. Others are helping their communities through teaching or volunteering at AHREM offices and reach new students. Students leave AHREM with improved English and computer skills and an increased understanding of environmental and human rights issues. These skills increase their professional opportunities and the critical thinking skills they develop help them throughout their lives. Through AHREM's passionate and optimistic students we believe we can reduce poverty and increase educational and economic opportunities in rural communities in  Myanmar. Please help AHREM and Myanmar reach our goals by donating to our campaign!

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge for us is funding. With insufficient funds, we are unable to help all of the students who risk travelling illegally from Myanmar to continue their educations. For the students living in our offices, we cannot provide legal identification documents, which would allow the students to study legally in Thailand, so our students are constantly at risk of being arrested and deported. Because of this risk, students are not permitted to leave the school and unfortunately often feel a lack a freedom while studying in Thailand. With greater funding AHREM could provide students with proper legal documentation and offer students more freedom while they study. Please help us improve the lives of our students who work hard to better their communities and break the cycle of poverty that is sadly often found in Myanmar.

Other Ways You Can Help

AHREM is trying to provide the uneducated people of Myanmar with the skills necessary to improve their lives and communities. Moreover, AHREM would greatly appreciate if you could share this information with as many people as possible. The more people we can share our cause with, the larger the positive impact for the people of Myanmar. Thank you so much for your generosity! Every donation counts!!!

into higher education programs at other organizations. AHREM students are also taught human and environmental
rights topics, as many of the students were not exposed to these issues in their native villages. When a student has completed all available higher education programs in Mae Sot and pursued university scholarship opportunities,
AHREM sends the student back to the Arakan State in Myanmar to share their new skills with the students at our AHREM office in the Arakan State, which we opened in the spring of 2016.
AHREM is 100% donation funded and taught completely by volunteers, with much of our funding coming directly from the organizations founders, so we are dependent on your generosity to continue our program's operations. 
For further information,
please visit us at www.ahrem.org
  What We Need & What You Get
The AHREM Mae Sot office's weekly expenses are 4,088 baht ($116), which allows 13 students to live full-time in the office (we have another location in Myanmar as well). This money will be used to pay for our rent, food costs, teaching and school supplies, utilities, and other necessities. This is a small amount, but we struggle to provide for our weekly expenses. With your donation, AHREM will be able to educate more poor Arakanese students. 
Even if don't reach our fundraising goal, your donation will still make a significant impact and help us to provide for our students' needs.   The Impact


AHREM is educating poor Arakanese students in Mae Sot, Thailand and now also directly inside of the Arakan State in
Myanmar. AHREM has empowered many students from Myanmar, many of whom are now working in Thailand or inside Myanmar to support
their families. Others are helping their communities through teaching or volunteering at AHREM offices and reach new students. Students leave AHREM with improved English and computer skills and an increased understanding of environmental and human rights issues. These skills increase their professional opportunities and the critical thinking skills they develop help them throughout their lives. Through AHREM's passionate and optimistic students we believe we can reduce poverty and increase educational and economic opportunities in rural communities in  Myanmar. Please help AHREM and Myanmar reach our goals by
donating to our campaign! 
  Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge for us is funding. With insufficient funds, we are unable to help all of the students who risk travelling illegally from Myanmar to continue their educations. For the students living in our offices, we cannot provide legal identification documents, which would allow the students to study legally in Thailand, so our students are constantly at risk of being arrested and deported. Because of this risk, students are not permitted to leave the school and unfortunately often feel a lack a freedom while studying in Thailand. With greater funding AHREM could provide students with proper legal documentation and offer students more freedom while they study. Please help us improve the lives of our students who work hard to better their communities and break the cycle of poverty that is sadly often found in Myanmar.
  Other Ways You Can Help


AHREM is trying to provide the uneducated people of Myanmar with the skills necessary to improve their lives and communities. Moreover, AHREM would greatly appreciate if you could share this information with as many people as possible. The more people we can share our cause with, the larger the positive impact for the people of Myanmar. Thank you so much for your generosity! Every donation counts!!!

story:
Yoga App for Happy Children

At Aura Wellness Center, we have a 17 year history of developing educational Yoga courses and programs. Currently, we are designing an educational app for children and families worldwide. The life skills children gain from practicing Yoga teaches them how to deal with stress, peer pressure, modern family challenges, academic demands and educational cut backs due to the global economy.

My name is Paul Jerard, and over the past three decades, my passion has been teaching children, adults and thousands of Yoga teachers worldwide. During the past year, we have assembled a team of experienced artists, app designers and voice actors for the creation of the app: “Tiki’s Yoga Journey.”


Children and families need entertaining and wholesome information that is educational and reinforces family bonds. The seeds we plant today can improve the entire planet within one generation. Your children and grandchildren will have life skills that enable them to cope during the ups and downs of life.


Tiki's Yoga Journey Development

We have already paid for consulting, research, development, and Tiki’s character modeling, texturing, rigging and facial rigging: $3250

Development platform: Apple (iOS) - Universal App (Works on all iOS devices like iPhone, iPad etc)

We are currently developing a free beginner level version. 

Paid intermediate and advanced versions will be developed later.


Cost Breakdown for the Free Beginner Version:

Total tutorial videos: 23

Average length per video: 1 minute

Animation cost: $12,650 

$550 per minute x 23 =$12,650

App designing: $1500

- User Interface Designing

- App Icon

- Screenshots in 5-6 sizes

- App uploading to iTunes account

6 different background designs.

App development cost: $3000

Voice Actors:  $6,400

Total Cost: $23,500

Time frame: 6 months time to complete the app.


Your pledge allows you to choose perks from several products or combinations; all are geared toward giving you the experience  that works best for you - From personal packages to teacher packages.

At Aura Wellness Center, we are totally committed to this project. Production is ongoing; we are in the process of developing a prototype app and we are developing Tiki's 3D animation Yoga sequences, until we are ready to launch Tiki's Yoga Journey as a free app. Later, we will develop intermediate and advanced versions of Tiki's Yoga Journey.

We also have long-term plans for Tiki's Yoga Journey to be developed for Google Play after it is in the Apple Store. Additionally, we have plans to produce Spanish, Mandarin, Hindi, Russian, Arabic, Portuguese, and Japanese versions of Tiki's Yoga Journey.

Why are we Committed to this Project?

We want to raise awareness that will positively impact children's lives. Giving children emotional stability costs much less than repairing broken adults. One step forward toward character development will enhance a child's life ten-fold. Children who participate in Yoga excel academically and athletically. Children become empowered enough to think beyond peer pressure. With that said, we want to give every child on the planet the tools for a better quality life through mental and emotional stability. Throughout my life, I have personally witnessed Yoga make a huge difference in the lives of students from toddlers to seniors.

Tiki's Path

Tiki will evolve as a tutor and Yoga will continue to make positive social changes possible. At Aura Wellness Center, we expect to run into technical hurdles and we always find solutions - That is part of life, art, and app development. The team we have assembled is professional and experienced. At Aura Wellness Center, we provide Yoga education worldwide and we have a positive track record. 


You Can Help

We understand that some of you just can't make a pledge, but we really appreciate you sharing Tiki's story on your favorite social media network. Please feel free to use Indiegogo's social sharing tools. Thank you in advance for all of your help.

Namaste!

story:
The Vegan Information Project is an all-volunteer education group working in Ireland.


We are involved in a wide range of educational events and initiatives, such as our weekly and sometimes bi-weekly "Vegan Information Day" stalls (a 3x3m weatherproof gazebo with features such as literature [including a "zine library], video booths, plant-based food samples and portions, t-shirts, necklaces, and our unique "tea station" where people enjoy a free cup of tea, read the vegan and animal rights literature, and/or talk to some of the VIP volunteers), educational lectures, school talks, and more (see the 2014 review video).

We were so busy last year and the year before that we totally wrecked one of our volunteer's cars due to the weight of the ever-expanding equipment we use.

Since then, a wonderful vegan animal sanctuary in Ireland, with an equally wonderful name: Back Into Daylight, agreed to sell us a van. Our equipment transporting worries are over!

Better still, the sanctuary have allowed us to pay them in instalments, so we have taken delivery of the vehicles (now named Neville!), taxed him, put him through his vehicle test, and insured him.

We've also managed to pay just over half of the 2000 euro price. This appeal is to pay for the rest and really get the VIP - and Neville - back on the road for Summer 2015.

story:
Short Summary

L’Associazione Italiana Persone Down Sezione di Catania (AIPD Onlus) nasce a catania nel il 31 Maggio 1990 con l’obiettivo di favorire il pieno sviluppo sociale, mentale ed espressivo delle persone con Sindrome di Down. Per questo motivo, quest’anno, decide di dare vita ad un nuovo progetto denominato La Casa delle Arti. La Casa delle arti prevede la realizzazione di quattro laboratori sulle seguenti forme d’arte: fotografia e video, musica, biodanza, lettura e composizione. Le arti, attraverso percorsi laboratoriali permanenti (e di lunga durata), insegnano alle persone ad affidarsi a se stessi, a sviluppare una maggiore consapevolezza di se e quindi un maggiore senso di autonomia e responsabilità.

“La creazione di un sé adulto” rappresenta il presupposto indispensabile per poter vivere, relazionarsi e percepirsi come adulto, nella maggior misura possibile - scrive Silvia Maggiolini (saggio:Pedagogia speciale oltre la scuola. Edizioni Franco Angeli, 2011) -. È necessario che il percorso inizi  sia in famiglia, sia, soprattutto, all’interno delle istituzioni deputate alla sua formazione, e chiamate a sostenerlo nella costruzione di una realistica immagine di sé, e nell’apprendimento graduale delle capacità necessarie per poter agire, il più possibile, da soli”. 

In Italy there are more than 48 000 people with Down syndrome. If children with Down syndrome receive proper follow-up care, they can be self-sufficient and show great improvement in terms of personal and social independence. It is for this reason reason that the AIPD - Italian Association of People with Down syndrome (based in Catania) wants to raise public awareness and highlight the importance of a culture full of diversity, in order to tackle the many prejudices that still affect people with disabilities. So together, let’s build the AIPD “House of Arts”…

What We Need & What You Get

Per realizzare il progetto “La casa delle arti” abbiamo bisogno di raggiungere almeno 10.000€ . Questi soldi serviranno a coprire le spese di tutto il materiale dei quattro laboratori, Attrezzature fotografiche, strumenti, materiale di cancelleria, eventuali trasferte. Quando doni, ricordati che sei parte attiva del progetto e contribuirai a fare la differenza aiutando i nostri ragazzi verso la conquista di una autonomia vera.

Puoi scegliere tu quale cifra donare, ogni tuo contributo è importante

3€: un mattone per la nostra casa

10€: contribuisci all’acquisto del materiale per la biodanza

50€: contribuisci all’acquisto del materiale per il corso di scrittura creativa

100€: contribuisci all’acquisto/noleggio di strumenti musicali e attrezzature di fotografia

Oppure scegli di finanziare un intero laboratorio donando 2.500€

Per ringraziarti della donazione che effettuerai riceverai una o più delle seguenti cose:

-  Una lettera di ringraziamento del presidente dell’Associazione Italiana Persone down Sezione di Catania.

-  Una postcard elettronica di ringraziamento da parte dei ragazzi dell'Associazione Italiana Persone down

-  Un calendario 2016 dell’Associazione Italiana Persone Down

-  Un libro di fotografie teatrali dei ragazzi dell'Associazione Italiana Persone down

To realize “The house of arts” project we need to reach at least 10,000€.The amount will cover the costs of all the material for the 4lab i.e. photographic equipment , tools , supplies and transfers . When you donate, remember that you are an active member of the project and you will help us to make a difference helping our kids towards the conquest of a real indipendence

You can donate:

3€: a milestone for “the house of Arts”

10€: a contribute to buy bio-dance lab’s material

50€: a contribute to buy creative writing lab’s material

100€: a contribute to buy musical instruments or photographic equipment

If you want you can donate 2.500€ to realize a whole lab. Choose your favorite one!


The Impact

Perché quattro laboratori?

lo sforzo di attivare ben quattro percorsi laboratoriali nasce dalla convinzione che sia necessario, al fine di favorire l’apprendimento, rispettare le attitudini, gli interessi, ma anche le difficoltà motorie e/o verbali di ogni persona. Inoltre, li dove possibile, la partecipazione a più laboratori aumenta l’entusiasmo, l’aggregazione, la relazione all’interno e all’esterno del gruppo. L’obiettivo è quello di dimostrare come le persone con disabilità siano capaci di assumere un ruolo attivo nella società  che supera il concetto stereotipato dell’assistenzialismo, partecipando alla vita  culturale della collettività.

Ricercare il ritmo, suonare uno strumento, immortalare l’immagine del mondo coi loro occhi, percepire il proprio corpo in un fare armonico, trascrivere un pensiero e migliorare le proprie capacità espositive, questi i nostri orizzonti.

I singoli Progetti

-  Il corso di fotografia

Il corso di fotografia e video si propone di insegnare le tecniche di base e la strumentazione necessarie per le riproduzioni video e fotografiche.  Inoltre si prefigge l’obiettivo di stimolare la creatività in relazione alla capacità di “fermare” momenti, cose, persone in situazioni diverse.

-  Il corso di biodanza

Comunicare con il linguaggio corporeo integrando musica, movimento ed emozioni; sviluppare le capacità espressive; sviluppare le capacità immaginative; Accrescere la stima di sé; migliorare la qualità dei rapporti interpersonali.

-  Il corso di lettura e composizione

Il corso intende sviluppare le pregresse capacità e competenze linguistico-espressive, sia di scriventi che di lettori, in tre direzioni: veicolare le idee individuali al meglio; incanalare con soddisfazione personale la propria partecipazione alla comunicazione sociale; migliorare l’ascolto e la comprensione di contesti comunicativi istituzionali o ricreativi non orali.

-  Il corso di Musica

Il corso di musica ha come obiettivo lo sviluppo dell' orecchio interno, la competenza mentale fondamentale per la produzione di qualsiasi idea musicale; educare l' orecchio dei partecipanti al riconoscimento consapevole del singolo suono e dei diversi stili musicali.

Alla fine dei percorsi, i partecipanti verranno coinvolti nella realizzazione di un documentario che intrecci le singole storie dei personaggi. Il montaggio alternerà ogni singola storia fino a farle convogliare tutte in un grande evento collettivo.

We need your help to make our four training programs based on Music, Biodance, Photography & Video, Reading & Composition a reality. These programs will help people with Down syndrome create a realistic self-image and will help them gain the necessary skills to act as independently as possible. These four courses will enhance learning while constantly respecting the different attitudes and different interests each person has while also respecting the difficulties that each person may face. Searching for the beat, playing an instrument, looking at the world through their own eyes, perceiving their bodies in a harmonious way, writing down their thoughts and improving their presentation skills… all of these things will give birth to an authentic subjectivity and will stimulate their capacity for self-sufficiency and give them direction for their future and present life choices.

Other Ways You Can Help

Condividi la campagna con i tuoi parenti, amici ed amici di amici. Aiutaci a far sapere a tutti cosa vogliamo fare e perché!
Share the campaign with your Facebook friends, give us a shoutout on Twitter, email your colleagues to let them know about “The house of arts”, or rope in your friends and family. Every small gesture will go a long way towards building a better world for our guys.

story:
Our Inspiration - El Sistema

Inspired by El Sistema music program and founded by Sistema Fellow David Gracia, the Washington Heights and Inwood (WHIN) Music Project started in August 2012 to offer choral and orchestral instruction as a vehicle for personal development, social inclusion, artistic excellence and community building for the children and youth of these New York City neighborhoods.

Our Story - Washington Heights and Inwood

Since August 2012, WHIN has served an average of 150 children through the following music programs: Early Childhood, Strings, Guitar, Children’s Choir, STAR: School-Time Annual Residency Program, Children's and Youth Orchestras and Camerata, developing a pipeline of music instruction for children ages 5 through 21. Students have performed in venues such as El Museo del Barrio, United Palace Theater, The DiMenna Center for Classical Music, New York Society for Ethical Culture and The Morris-Jumel Mansion, among others.

Our Impact - Milestones

Thanks to the rapid growth of WHIN, Mr. Gracia incorporated Orchestrating Dreams as a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization that serves as the umbrella organization for WHIN.  

  • In 2014-2015 Orchestrating Dreams founded music programs  in Washington Heights, the Bronx, Brooklyn, and East Harlem in partnership with Dos Puentes Dual Language Elementary School, P.S. 304 Early Childhood School, P.S. 316 Elijah Stroud and TAG Young Scholars, respectively and serving an additional 300 students per week (70% minorities, 75% eligible for free lunch programs, 9% special education students).
  • In the 2015-2016 year, the WHIN Music Project has incorporated private classes into its curriculum to provide a complete education to its students consisting of: private, group and ensemble classes, choral and percussion instruction and advanced orchestral instruction. 
  • The Camerata Ensemble will make its Merkin Hall Debut on November 12, 2015 as part of the opening concert of the 10th Anniversary of the Latin American Cultural Week in New York City, performing alongisde internationally renonwned musicians such as Daniel Binelli, Polly Ferman and Eddy Marcano.

How You Can Help - Join the WHIN Movement

Through years of hard work and dedication by its leaders, teachers, families and students, WHIN has been able to improve the musical education of its students and reach new students every year. Although our families pay a small fee (based on a sliding's scale informed by each family's income), which helps to cover 40% of the program's costs,  60% of our budget is built on funds raised from foundations, volunteer work, and individual donations from people like you. Our $10,000 goal in this campaign will help us cover 10% of our yearly expenses including:

  • Master Teachers: Our instructors are highly-qualified scholars, passionate musicians, and dedicated teachers who empower our students and help them grow personally and musically.
  • High-Quality Instruments: A good music education requires quality instruments that help each student refine their musical skills and aim at excellence.
  • Mentorship Program: We train our teenage students to become the next generation of music teachers so they can develop their 21st century skills to become productive citizens.
  • Scholarships: All of our families receive subsidies to cover the costs of our music classes, but many of our families can't even cover the low cost of our program and they need additional financial assistance.

Contributions are 100% tax deductible.

Our Story - Washington Heights and InwoodSince August 2012, WHIN has served an average of 150 children through the following music programs: Early Childhood, Strings, Guitar, Children’s Choir, STAR: School-Time Annual Residency Program, Children's and Youth Orchestras and Camerata, developing a pipeline of music instruction for children ages 5 through 21. Students have performed in venues such as El Museo del Barrio, United Palace Theater, The DiMenna Center for Classical Music, New York Society for Ethical Culture and The Morris-Jumel Mansion, among others.Our Impact - MilestonesThanks to the rapid growth of WHIN, Mr. Gracia incorporated Orchestrating Dreams as a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization that serves as the umbrella organization for WHIN.

story:
Hi Everybody!

My name is Duncan and I live in England. Since 2006 I have been teaching spoken English to the world via YouTube. I have been doing this on my own and in my own time for free. I do not charge anything to anyone for my material. During the past eight years I have helped thousands of people of all ages around the world improve their spoken English. My lessons are video based, which allows me to make them in a fun and creative way, using vivid imagery. Virtually all of my video lessons are subtitled. Of course all of this producing takes time...and there are overheads (running costs) to meet. -  (In the past I have worked abroad as an English teacher and spent 4 years teaching oral English in China.) 

Popularity...

Many thousands of students in over 125 countries now follow my lessons, which means that I must devote more of my time to this venture. I have already invested a large sum of my own money to create a studio and purchase equipment so as to produce as many new lessons as possible. My subscriber base is growing. Right now it stands at over 300.000. In the future I would like to expand this virtual classroom and increase the output, ensuring that many more people will benefit from these free video lessons. 

The world of English is a fun and exciting place.

There is no doubt that these days the English language is widely used. It has become an international language. Having the ability to communicate in English can really open doors for people of all ages. Your help will allow many more people to take advantage of the various life-changing opportunities that the English language can offer.

New for 2015...

In 2015 I aim to expand the production time even further, with a new series of English lessons called 'Misterduncan's Full English'. I began making these lessons at the end of 2014 and I would like to continue making them in 2015. A new lesson will be posted every two weeks.

story:
What is this, you ask? 

Addis Ideas is a revolutionary mobile application that crowd sources African development solutions from African nationals and the African diaspora.

Our app aims to:

  1. Promote information sharing
  2. Enhance public participation in the development space
  3. Create a collaborative work-space for Africans who want to improve their communities

With your donation, we can change the way African development works!


Where your donation money goes... 

We are asking you to help us in our 60-day fundraising challenge, which will finance our mobile and web platforms and our 12-month pilot program in Ethiopia. 

Our budget breakdown:

  • 12-month Pilot Program in Ethiopia - 55%
  • Web & Mobile Development - 34%
  • Marketing & Promotion - 5%
  • Legal Incorporation - 4%
  • Research & Development - 2%


Our Guiding Principles 

  • African ideas matter. 
  • African development begins with African nationals and the African diaspora. 
  • African Innovation + Collaboration = African development solutions. 


The Risks & Challenges 

The primary risk is introducing our product to an emerging market. However, in this market, we do not have any competition. As well, we are conducting informational interviews, focus groups, and market research with relevant players in the African entrepreneurial space.


Can't Donate? You Can Still Help!

If you're unable to make a significant financial donation, we ask that you:

  • Make some noise and tell your friends and family!
  • Use the Indiegogo sharing tools to post this to all your social media accounts.
  • www.addisideas.org

story:
Audio Description

Audio Description is a narration service for individuals who are blind or have low vision. Arts Access has been providing Audio Description in North Carolina since 1982.

Debbie Hippler

Debbie has been an audio describer for a decade and has been Arts Access' AD Coordinator almost as long. She works to make sure this accommodation is provided to any individual who needs it to enjoy life in the Triangle and she recently expanded the program to the Triad. She works tirelessly to provide this service because she is a caring and compassionate person. The tasks associated with being the Audio Description Coordinator are numerous and the pay does not match because Debbie insists on keeping the cost for venues low so that the accommodation can be provided to the most people with low vision as possible. Debbie has trained numerous additional audio describers and continues to keep the program successful and cutting edge.

The Training

The American Council for the Blind is bringing their Audio Description Institute training to Washington D.C. for the first time. This puts the conference within the practical range for sending Debbie to update her knowledge. Your help sending Debbie to this conference will help to update the AD practices currently utilized in North Carolina, help Debbie to be a better trainer for new audio describers in the future, and make sure the that Arts Access is able to provide the best accommodation to people with low vision as possible!

The Funds

We need $1309.64 to send Debbie to the Audio Description Institute conference. Here is the breakdown of funds:

  • $118. - Round-trip train ticket to Washington D.C. from Raleigh, NC
  • $596.64 - Hotel with Conference Discount + Tax
  • $495. - Conference Registration
  • $100. - Travel Stipend

The Impact

Sending one person to a conference may not seem like a big deal, but sending this one particular person, Debbie Hippler, to a conference is a HUGE deal! She works with hundreds of people with low vision or who are blind annually; helping them, providing accommodations for them and working constantly to make sure they can enjoy the things in life that any person with full site can. She has trained numerous others to do the same through Arts Access' Audio Description program and beyond! The information provided in this training will help Debbie to impact hundreds of people in North Carolina in just the first year after her return.

Other Ways You Can Help

Arts Access is always looking for supports, volunteers and new Audio Describers! If you are interested in helping with this important cause but cannot donate today, contact Debbie (audiodescription@artsaccessinc.org) to give a word of support or to inquire about helping with the Audio Description program. Thank you!

story:
Hello,
Thank you for visiting!
My name is Marco, I live in the Netherlands, and am a music-hobbyist, songwriter, charital entrepreneur and founder of a non-profit organization. On personal initiative I've decided to raise funds to help build an educational centre for children and single women in Bangladesh.


Marco Akamawa

The Project
The aim, with your much needed help, is to fully renovate an existing building (currently unfit for habitation and has no roof) so it can be safely and durably house up to 48 children and 16 women, and provide the furniture & necessities so that already available teachers can start teaching as soon as possible in safe and caring circumstance.


Right now children of various age groups, some very young, are following their lessons under extreme circumstances, on barren floor, at different locations (on porches of houses, and in primitive provisional shelters, without chairs, tables, proper schoolbooks, clothing or even floormats) in exceptionally cold weather, with the only alternative to go (back) living on city-streets with possibly disastrous consequences. Single women, rejected by family, hardly have means (due lack of schooling) to support children or themselves.

Although government-funding is periodically made available, money spiralling down a too long line seldomly reaches the correct endstation, also due to a 'defective' local organization.


An important part of our goal is to create a certain independence, without letting politics or religious beliefs interfere the education of these children in any way, whilst at all times ensuring political, religious beliefs and especially cultural aspects are respected and remain intact. This will be done by frequenly producing film, music and artwork as means of exposure and support, also with the help of other artists around the world. 


September 2014, new books! (made available via private money)

September 2014, one of the provisional "classrooms"

September 2014, "classroom" on some-one's frontporch

I plan on heading over as soon as possible to help on site with the renovationwork (I'm good with my hands and have local experience), and will be filming/producing a documentary with the help of Dr. Shahida Akther, a known author, filmmaker and well-respected human-rights defender. 

I will be posting ('live' if technically possible) daily updates to various media-websites, to keep contact with you and the rest of the world, and out of safety-reason.

Together, with your help, we will be ready to create a sustainable basis for these children and women, a basis on which we plan to actively develope a transparent ongoing story into the foreseeable future, envisioning a relatively self-supportive educational centre, one of more in longer term.

 

Estimated cost-breakdown:

  • Renovation of building (material/transport):  USD 2.250,-
  • Renovation of building (labour):                           USD    600,-
  • Furniture / amenities:                                              USD    500,-
  • Books / pens / paper (1 year supply)                 USD     150,-
  • Sewing-machines                                                      USD     750,-
  • Travel Marco (airline/food/other)                      USD  1.000,-
  • Unforseen / contingency                                        USD  1.250,-
                                                                          TOTAL:         USD  6.500,-
_____________________________________________________________________________
Contingencyplan:

Now what if we do not reach our US$ 6500 goal ? 

Firstly I'd like to point out that 6500 US$ are equivalent to provide a child a brighter future at a price of approx. 100,- US$.

Though I do realize a contingency-plan as some form of guarantee is necessary:

I've produced a music-album (10 original songs & 4 bonustracks), it's paid for and am dedicating the entire gross sales-revenue to this project. 

You may listen to it here: 'MOONLIGHT by Marco Akamawa'

If you happen to like what you hear, it's made available as a 'perk' if you decide to make a donation.

A physical audio-cd and informative booklet are currently in production and should enter stores before Feb. 14 (Valentine's Day). If needed I will ensure these proceeds also can serve as contingency. Furthermore, I reserve proceeds of gigs and concerts to this project, as safety-plan C.

      Very much we look forward to your help and participation!

      Sincerely,
      Marco

      

      

p.s. if you represent a company, NPO or are a creative artist and would like to donate to this project, please feel free to contact me; I'd happily discuss ways of helping promote mutual causes! 

p.p.s. in case you are not in a position to support financially, please do consider sharing this project via one of the media-share buttons provided by Indiegogo... 

     Thanks again!

If you happen to like what you hear, it's made available as a 'perk' if you decide to make a donation.
A physical audio-cd and informative booklet are currently in production and should enter stores before Feb. 14 (Valentine's Day). If needed I will ensure these proceeds also can serve as contingency. Furthermore, I reserve proceeds of gigs and concerts to this project, as safety-plan C.

story:
We are the Board for the duPont Manual Regional Science and Engineering Fair (DMRSEF), a group of individuals from the Louisville community who are passionate about Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (STEM) education among school kids.

Our organization is responsible for producing the duPont Manual Regional Science and Engineering Fair and paying for Best of Fair recipients to attend Intel ISEF each year. The objective of the fair is to give an opportunity to the high school students of duPont Manual School in Louisville Ky, to present their research projects to external reviewers and in the process pick students to represent the school at the Intel International Science and Engineering Fair (ISEF).

Support Science Where Science Happens

The state of science education in US public schools is disappointing to say the least.  The US ranks #21 compared to other OECD countries.  Until such time as we can reverse course, we need to support the science students that are achieving in our schools now.

In Louisville, we have a school that is beating the odds.  Last year, the students at duPont Manual High School won more awards at Intel ISEF (International Science and Engineering Fair) than any other public high school in the US and all but one private high school (The Harken School from, no surprise, Silicon Valley).  That's right... a school from Kentucky beat every other state!  That's like Harvard beating University of Kentucky in basketball.  Or the US beating India in cricket.

The Problem

DuPont Manual High School sends more students to ISEF each year than the school or PTSA can afford.  Over the last 5 years alone, we've had 62 students qualify to go to ISEF.  The cost to send a student to ISEF ranges from $1,500 to $2,000 depending on the location of the fair.

The school can not afford this cost.  And the PTSA is responsible for meeting the wider needs of the school.  Unfortunately, budget cuts in Kentucky public schools since 2008 mean that local companies' generosity is already tapped out helping the school district in other ways.

So far, we've raised $9,000 to cover the cost of producing our science fair.  These funds came primarily from parents who contributed to 5 fundraising events in the Fall.  This IndieGogo campaign is to pay for the cost of projects that qualify for ISEF, the Super Bowl of high school science.

These students deserve our support...

How they do it (hard work and good judges)

DuPont students win because they've put in the hard work.  They've iterated.  They are passionate and persistent.  And they've been there before.  This isn't their first rodeo...

DMRSEF honors their effort by recruiting the highest quality science fair judges we can find.  It's not easy finding judges that understand the student's projects but it is essential to selecting projects that have the best chance of winning at Intel ISEF.

Who is going to ISEF 2015?

Meet some of the students and projects vying for the opportunity to attend ISEF 2015 in the video below.  These are real science and engineering projects, not just another app for the Apple Store.  After the KY State Science Fair, we will update this page with the names of the students and projects that qualified for Intel ISEF 2015.

Why Not Science?

'Professional sports leagues like the NBA and NFL have teamed up with the NCAA and brands like Nike, Adidas and Under Armour to IDENTIFY and DEVELOP young talent.  Why isn't the US doing the same for science?

Attending ISEF is a life-changing experience for a young scientist or engineer.

A good start...

By contributing to this campaign, you are supporting the message that science education matters.  Send the message to Kentucky (and every other state) that scientists and engineers are paying attention.  We need a critical mass of science education success stories and this campaign is a good start.  

What Happens When You Donate?

Indiegogo uses firstgiving.com to process donations for non-profit campaigns.  The gift acknowledgement will come from support@firstgiving.com, via e-mail.  The e-mail will list DMRSEF as the recipient of your gift.  DMRSEF is a 501(c)3 non-profit, which allows a possible tax deduction for your gift.

Contributions in excess of the goal will be used to pay the travel costs of future winners.

duPont Manual:  Science Happens Here

Thank you for your support!

The Problem
DuPont Manual High School sends more students to ISEF each year than the school or PTSA can afford.  Over the last 5 years alone, we've had 62 students qualify to go to ISEF.  The cost to send a student to ISEF ranges from $1,500 to $2,000 depending on the location of the fair.
The school can not afford this cost.  And the PTSA is responsible for meeting the wider needs of the school.  Unfortunately, budget cuts in Kentucky public schools since 2008 mean that local companies' generosity is already tapped out helping the school district in other ways.




So far, we've raised $9,000 to cover the cost of producing our science fair.  These funds came primarily from parents who contributed to 5 fundraising events in the Fall.  This IndieGogo campaign is to pay for the cost of projects that qualify for ISEF, the Super Bowl of high school science.
These students deserve our support...


How they do it (hard work and good judges)DuPont students win because they've put in the hard work.  They've iterated.  They are passionate and persistent.  And they've been there before.  This isn't their first rodeo...



DMRSEF honors their effort by recruiting the highest quality science fair judges we can find.  It's not easy finding judges that understand the student's projects but it is essential to selecting projects that have the best chance of winning at Intel ISEF.

Who is going to ISEF 2015?Meet some of the students and projects vying for the opportunity to attend ISEF 2015 in the video below.  These are real science and engineering projects, not just another app for the Apple Store.  After the KY State Science Fair, we will update this page with the names of the students and projects that qualified for Intel ISEF 2015.



Why Not Science?

'Professional sports leagues like the NBA and NFL have teamed up with the NCAA and brands like Nike, Adidas and Under Armour to IDENTIFY and DEVELOP young talent.  Why isn't the US doing the same for science?
Attending ISEF is a life-changing experience for a young scientist or engineer.
A good start...
By contributing to this campaign, you are supporting the message that science education matters.  Send the message to Kentucky (and every other state) that scientists and engineers are paying attention.  We need a critical mass of science education success stories and this campaign is a good start.  


What Happens When You Donate?
Indiegogo uses firstgiving.com to process donations for non-profit campaigns.  The gift acknowledgement will come from support@firstgiving.com, via e-mail.  The e-mail will list DMRSEF as the recipient of your gift.  DMRSEF is a 501(c)3 non-profit, which allows a possible tax deduction for your gift.Contributions in excess of the goal will be used to pay the travel costs of future winners.
